name: BrainBox: Teddy Bears
description:
BrainBox Teddy Bears contains 55 beautifully-illustrated cards by Rikey Austin! Each card shows different Teddy Bear characters from playing football to building sandcastles.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material. Designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: BrainBox: Action Stations
description:
Endorsed by the Imperial War Museum, this fun BrainBox features not only wars, tanks, rationing, heroes, and much more.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Contains 55 cards, 2 rules cards, 1 sand timer and 1 die,
Ages 8 - 108,
Players 1 or more,

name: La Batalla de Midway
description:
Two fleets fight for Midway, the japanese try to disembark on Midway and the US player avoiding it. The map is divided in squares for movement with Midway in the middle. The counters are plastic miniatures. Each unit has different movement and firepower. First move and combat the japanese player (using a table and the dice), but with only one unit each turn, then the US player do the same.
A player win the game if complete one of the three ways: invading the midway island, sinking the two transports or losing all units except the last one.

name: Bonaparte
description:
Bonaparte is a set of wargame rules which recreate warfare in the era between the French Revolution and Napoleon's final defeat at Waterloo

Ground Scale:
20/25mm - 1" = 10 yards
10/12/15mm - 1cm = 10 yards
6mm - 1cm = 20 yards

Figure Scale
1 figure = 50 real men
1 gun model = up to 6 pieces

name: Le Chat et la Souris
description:
The game consists of thirty-two cards, representing eight cats and twenty-four mice and the cards are lay out on the table in 8x4 grid face-down.

In his turn, the active player may turn any card face-up.
If it's a mouse he may continue his turn turning another card or decide to stop and take all visible mice in front of him.
If it's a cat, his turn is over and he must turn all cards face-down again.

When all mice were found, the player who has the most mice wins the game.

From Noris edition:

Katz und Maus - Wer findet die meisten Mäuse
translated: Cat and mouse - who finds the most mice

From the box back that also contains the games rules:

The game consits of 32 cards depicting cats and mice. 24 cards are with mice, 8 cards with cats. They are laid out face down in a 4 by 8 grid after a good shuffle. A player turns over cards on his turn. When the revealed card is a mouse its good and he can continue turning over cards. He can secure his winnings and keep the mice or continue. When a cat is revealed the players turn is immediately over, the face up cards are turned face down again, the next players turn begins. Whoever has the most mice when all mice are revealed is the winner.

A simple push your luck game for children.

name: International Matchplay Golf
description:
Statistical golf replay game. Players are rated in various skills based on their performances in competitions like the Ryder Cup. Dice are used to give results based on the skill in question at that time. It would be quite easy to use the system to rate players up to date.

Bernhard Langer on the cover.

name: Rugby League Trio's
description:
Promotional game published on behalf of MFS Associates, a firm of insurance brokers.

54 cards illustrated with the strip, club crest and nickname of 18 professional rugby league clubs. There are three cards to a set. Very simple game of drawing cards and discarding, but laying down a set if you manage to collect one. When all the cards are used, the player with the most sets, wins.

name: Femkort
description:
Swedish trick-taking game from at least early 19th century. Players are dealt five cards. Basic trick-taking rules: follow suit, go over if possible, winner of the trick leads to the next. Winner of the last trick wins the hand.

Adults used to play the game for money, nowadays the game is mostly used to teach trick-taking basics to children.

name: Poker Dices
description:
The hit card game "Poker" but in dice form all in a self contained plastic tray with tumblers to contain and roll the dice.

Players will be trying to get the highest scoring combination of dice, the best of which wins the round and gets points associated with their combo of dice. Rounds start off by rolling the dice up to three time during their turn. their first roll has to be done with all five dice but the second and third roll they must leave at least one but up to four dice unchanged. Players can score after their first or second roll but after the third roll they must score their dice. The ranking order of hands are the same as conventional poker. You win by having the most points at the end of a predetermined set of rounds.

name: VampireSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

What would happen if you were bitten by a mysterious Count? How might you repel a particularly malevolent vampire? Play alone with a clove of garlic by your side, or invite your friends for a competitive vampire-athon. VampireSmarts has the answers. Inside the mesmerizing box you’ll find a VampireTips Guide, a score pad, and 100 question and answer cards in four delicious categories.

name: Brief 'n' Brisk Baseball
description:
Statistical baseball simulation, different to the company's Brief 'n' Brisk Major League Baseball. Unusually for this owner/designer, Patrick Premo, he has co-designed this game, not published it as one of his own designs.

As usual, dice and charts combine to give match results. Results are quickly established so a whole season is a realistic possibility to complete in only a few evenings.

An amazing number of teams are rated, from 1871 to 1990.

name: Ach, du dickes Ei!
description:
Findus has birthday three times per year. And every time Petterson bakes him a pancake cake. But this time he is still lacking 5 eggs - who can get hold of them first?

Players choose a basket of eggs on the board and then search the eggs with matching color. If the underside of an egg shows the wrong color, it is returned back to the board without showing the color to the other players. The first player to have found his five eggs is the winner.

In the second variant a die is rolled, then an egg matching the rolled color is sought, and if both match, the egg is placed in the player's basket. If the die shows Petterson, one can put any egg from the board in his basket. If it shows Findus, one egg has to be returned from the basket to the board. The first player to fill his basket is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Mix Fix
description:
Mix Fix is a reaction game where you are trying to get rid of all your cards first.
In the beginning every player get six cards showing six symbols. There are 4 different symbols in this game (fish, ship, sheep, frog). In each round 4 dice are rolled. Each dice has one symbol on four sides plus two blank sides. The players must then quickly find a card which shows all rolled symbols. If a matching card is found the player has to put it quickly in the middle of the table and has to name all symbols. If all was correct the player gets rid of this card. If he has made a mistake (wrong card or misspelling) he has to take it back and gets a new card as penalty.

name: Das kleine Ich bin Ich: Memospiel
description:
The game consists of 16 book tiles which have text on one side and one to three illustrations from the children's classic on the other, and 42 picture tiles matching the illustrations on the book tiles.
The picture tiles are placed on the table, face down. The book tiles are sorted and the first one is flipped over. The players then take turns flipping over a picture tile. If it matches the illustration, the active player can keep it and goes again. If there is more than one illustration on the book card, though, the matching tile stays on the table until all illustrations are found - the player to find the last one can keep them all. The game ends when all illustrations have been found. The player with most tiles is the winner.

name: Wer wird Frühstücks-König?
description:
Who will be the Breakfast-King? A game with a message for children - eat wisely.

The board features a pathway with white, yellow, orange and blue spaces. If you land on any colour other than white, you must draw a card from the deck of that colour. The cards either tell you something positive or something negative. Examples:
Blue card - Bad choice of meal, hamburger with Pommes Frites. This is 'not good' so you have to go back three spaces.
Orange card - various breakfasts you might have. A healthy one illustrated, might move you forward two spaces.
Yellow card - Cleaning your teeth after a meal - very good, go forward two spaces

In addition, some cards show an activity that must also be obeyed. This will be one of four instructions:
3 x three jumps on the spot.
1 x run round the table
1 x hop round the table
1 x stand on one leg and count to 10

The winner is the first player to reach the end of the track and a crown is included for the victor to wear.

The game was published for the Zentralverband des Deutschen Bäckerhandwerks, a kind of organisation to promote different German bakeries.

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Einkaufen macht Spaß
description:
Benjamin Blümchen says "Shopping is fun".

Each player gets a board with 16 squares, all illustrated with things Benjamin needs at the supermarket. The item tiles are shuffled and placed in a face-down stack. A turn starts when the player reveals the top tile. If he thinks he needs it, he pays to the bank the cost (in Deutschmarks). If he doesn't want to buy it, the next player can, and at a saving of 50 Pfennigs (half a Deutschmark). If not wanted it is offered to all the other players, knocking off 50 Pfennigs each time. If it gets down to zero, that player will get it for free.

The object is to buy goods that will form four boxes in a row on your board, so four across, four down and four corner-to-corner are all acceptable choices. The first to do so, wins.

A few tiles are what you might call Event tiles. If one of these is drawn, it is read out and takes place if the drawer wants to make use of it. Example: You may take one item off the board of the player to your left.

name: Pocket Quiz: Optische Illusionen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Try to solve the puzzle first and find out what is hiding behind the optical illusions to get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Pocket Quiz: Brain-Games
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills on the subject of Brain Games! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner
Solve the task first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Chek-O-Rama
description:
Checkers with 4 players on a 14 x 14 grid, with the 9 squares of each corner cut out. 12 pieces to a player; game starts with pieces laid out in usual checkers fashion but on four sides of board. Rules for 2 player and partners variants are included.

The game's box boasts: "First NEW CHECKER GAME in over 3000 years"

name: Sea Chess
description:
Sea Chess is a board game, like Chess, or Checkers. Chess, however, is a game that interprets Medieval land warfare while Sea Chess interprets a modern Naval Battle. Every Sea Chess game piece represents a warship. Both players get 24 game pieces representing 3 battleships, 4 cruisers, 8 destroyers and 9 escorts. Each type of "ship" moves freely about the board with its own characteristic motion, speed and direction. The "ships" are engaged in dynamic moving action until sunk and you can watch all of the action.

In Sea Chess there is a gradual "sinking" instead of "jumping" or "taking" pieces. A game piece moves into range and "fires". A roll of the dice determines a successful hit. Each type of "ship" has its own characteristic striking force and range. Pegs are placed in the pieces to record successful hits. When the holes are full, the piece has been "sunk". Since a peg marks each successful hit, you can keep track of how much damage you are doing to your opponent's ships.

READY REFERENCE CARDS included with the game give you a neat summary to keep by your side as you play so you do not have to keep looking into the rule book for speed, direction, striking force, etc.

RANGE GAUGES are provided to help you determine what ships are in range and which are not. Soon you will be able to tell just by looking which ships are in range.

You develop the strategy! You make the plans! You decide whether to make the first attack or prepare a devastating counter-attack!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: TOTEM
description:
The aim of TOTEM is for your chief to build their totem pole before the other chiefs do, but it's not as easy as it sounds!

Players first decide how high totem poles need to be to win, between one and four totems, with higher poles meaning longer games. Cards in TOTEM come in three colours, representing the spirit power associated with them - red = power of destruction, yellow = power of protection, green = power of creation. Players are dealt at random a card representing their chief, and a spirit card (which is not looked at), which can be used as a risky last resort to destroy other player's totems, but can backfire and destroy yours (if the spirit card doesn't match the colour of the chief using it).

Players then take turns to turn over and collect totem part cards. To build a totem, players need to collect three cards, a wood, tools and paint card, in the same colour as their chief. Once they do this they discard those cards and choose a totem in their colour to add to their pole. There are several totem designs for each colour, so players can customize the way their totem pole looks.

Some cards in the totem parts deck are Magic Items - if a player picks one of these up and it is in their chief's colour, they can use it to do various things, from destroying other players' hands of cards (the Tomahawk), to preventing other players using magic items (the Teepee), or allowing them to look at other player's cards and swap any they want to (Pipe of Peace).

Once a player has created the set number of totems, they need to finish off by creating a Totem Topper (collect a wood, tools and paint card in each of the three colours in any order), and then they win! But play can continue to determine other placings.

Components:
Totem Parts (42 cards - wood, tools, paint, plus 6 Magic Items)
Totems (24 cards - 8 destruction, 8 protection, 8 creation, all double sided)
Chiefs (6 cards - 2 destruction, 2 protection, 2 creation)
Spirits (6 cards - 2 destruction, 2 protection, 2 creation)
Totem Toppers (3 cards, double sided)
publishers: sinocono GAMES, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: BrainBox: Deutschland
description:
This is a Germany-themed BrainBox game.

Description provided by the publisher:

Do you know which regions the river Rhine flows through Or where the Nürburgring is? BrainBox All Around Germany contains 69 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best Germany has to offer, and then some! The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!
publishers: Green Board Game Co., moses. Verlag GmbH

name: The Nature
description:
From the rule sheet

Wake up your environmental Protection consciousness

The Nature is easy to learn and quick to play. It's best for four or more players, though you can play with three people or more than five. The game aims to help players developing the consciousness of environment protection through fun and enjoyment.

Object to the game:
The object is to get living animal cards as many as you can in each round. Points score on the cards in player's "Zoo" card pile but minus points in the player's "Tomb" card pile.

Game play:
Player started with 5 cards. Each round he can 1) play a card; 2) draw a card and discard a card into his "Tomb" card pile.

When every player has play one card, the round is over. The greatest card of the latest colour will be the winner of that round. The winner can collect all the cards and place them into his "Zoo" card pile.

Game end when the last card is drawn from the deck.

name: Crazy Cat Fanciers
description:
A game for two to four pet aficionados.

Goal: - End the game with cats. Lots of cats. Cats that match your personal quirks (youʼre not crazy — just different) are especially nice to have. Donʼt let the feral cat population get to high or youʼll attract the attention of the ASPCA, and you donʼt want that.

You need:
A six-sided die. One die per player is good.
A City deck - this where the cats come from (available on the game's website)
A Thumb-Servants deck - This is where food-bringing servants with opposable thumbs find gifts to bring as offerings to their feline masters (available on the game's website)
Cat Fancier cards - These cards describe the cat fancier youʼre playing in the game(available on the game's website)
Crazy cards - These you what kind of crazy you are. You may have a thing for psycho kitties, lazy fuzzlewumps, or whatever.(available on the game's website)

Each turn begins by determining turn order — the player with the fewest cats goes first in each phase. The players then check to see how hungry the cats are (cats can either be sated, hungry, or famished). Cards from the City deck are then dealt out to the middle of the table. Each player, starting with the first player, then has the opportunity to feed cats, including cats on the table, cats in the Wild that were allowed to go feral in previous turns, cats that are in their household, or other people's cats (which gives them the opportunity to steal those cats). Each player then draws from the Thumb-Servants deck, drawing and keeping cards based on each player's Cat Fancier card. Then the players check to see which cats are hungry, deciding whether to call the ASPCA to pick up the hungry cats (which also may cause the player to lose other cats) or allow the cats to go feral, placing them in the Wild on the table.

The game ends when one or more players has 10 or more cats or if the City deck runs out of cards.

Points are then scored based on the number of cats each player has and any bonuses they may have received from Crazy Cat cards and Cat Fancier cards. However, if the City deck runs out, the ASPCA may come and get everyone's cats - if this happens, everyone loses!

name: Tabaluga: Der Regenbogenschatz
description:
In Tabaluga: Der Regenbogenschatz, the objective is to be the first to gather five coloured cards.

For setup, 35 cards (each with 3 different rainbow colours) are laid out on the table. The active player throws 3 dice (each with 6 different colours). Then, all players try to find the matching card. The first person to do so keeps it. But be aware! An already gathered card may be targeted in the next round.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Disneyland Snip Game
description:
Any number can play. All the 36 cards are dealt face down to the players. Each player keeps his cards, without looking at them, face down in front of him. The player on the left of the dealer starts the game by turning up his top card and placing it face up in the centre of the table.
When a “PUT" card (marked with numbers 1,2 or 3) is turned up the next player has to put down the number of cards shown. If in doing so he turns up a “PUT" card, the next player has to put down the required number.
Should no “PUT” card turn up in the cards laid down, the player who laid the “PUT” card takes all from the centre of the table.
The player who gets all the cards wins the game.

name: Home History Game
description:
This is sort of a "Go Fish" type of card game, but three cards, out of the 105 cards in the game, are needed to make a book. Sets are determined by the day of the week upon which the historical event took place. From the rules:

4273
Home History Game
For Boys and Girls
Copyright 1909 By Milton Bradley

This game consists of 105 cards, each bearing a historical event and date, including the day and week upon which such event took place. The dealer in the first game is chosen by lot, and thereafter the deal goes in turn to the left. Shuffle the cards and deal one at a time beginning at the left until ten have been dealt to each player. The remainder are placed in a pile face down on the table. The player at the left of the dealer commences the game by making as many "books" as he can from his hand. Three cards of the same day constitute a book. These books are laid aside to be counted at the end of the game. The player now calls upon any player he wishes for any card (any day of the week) he, the caller, may need to complete a book. If successful, he may continue to call for and receive the needed cards from any of the players, until he calls for a card from a person who has not that card; he then draws three cards from the pile and the next player plays.

The players follow in turn at the left from the first player. At the end the player having secured the greatest number of books wins.

name: Naruil Airfoil Championship
description:
Naruil Airfoil Championship is a steampunk airship racing game where players compete in a race of skill and madness. Each year a grand championship is held where teams from all over the realms come to put their skills to the test. The race begins with each team (player) receiving an old airfoil frame that will form the basis for their airship in the race.

The teams get four hours (turns) to fix up and prepare their ship for the race. When the time is up the teams must roll out their ship no matter the condition.. The race is on! The teams will race around the designated track, trying to stay ahead of the pack as they face challenges along the way. The airfoil that is the first to successfully cross the finish line, after the designated number of laps, wins. This is a rough race and you never know which racer, if any, will pull through in the end!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Was ist  Was: Junior – Polizei Kartenspiel
description:
A card game that teaches children about some typical tasks police officers have to do and what equipment they need.

Whether the finale of an important soccer tournament or a state visit is taking place, whether there is a case of suspected arson or a suspicious suitcase is found - the police has to face many different challenges. What is to be done in each case and what means are needed is described on the challenge boards. The cards also show different resources that help the police to complete these tasks, such as handcuffs, a walkie-talkie, a police dog, a police horse, helicopter, motorbike etc. Players try to collect all the necessary resources for one of the three current challenges. If they are successful, they earn that challenge card and the points written on the card. The game ends when one player has collected 10 points or when the last card has been drawn. The player with the most points wins the game.

Components: 16 challenge boards, 53 cards, rules

name: Capt'n Sharky: Piraten-Poker
description: Sword beats flag, flag beats bucket, cannonball beats sword. The pirates try to play their cards cleverly in order to collect the most gold coins. A pirate game with 52 cards and 36 golden coins that is played according to the rock-paper-scissor principle.

name: Wilde Worteljacht
description:
Translated from the rules:

"Collect your carrots... but be aware of the angry farmer!"

Players roll to advance on their own track. once they reach the crop field they roll another die, which allow them to look at 1 or 2 carrots or use the farmer to chase away another player back to their start field on their track.
The first player to collect 3 carrots in his own colour wins the game.

name: 宝探しアドベンチャーTORE!魔宮攻略GAME (Treasure Hunt Adventure TORE! Mamiya Kōryaku Game)
description:
Based on the popular Japanese game show, TORE! is a game where 2 to 4 players compete against each other in challenges and quizzes to try to earn the most golden Pharaoh Statues and win the game. The expansive board is built up as a three-dimensional play space representing the various chambers of the cursed temple from the TV show.

In this board game version, the players move together through five of the popular rooms of the TORE! Temple. First they try to avoid being eaten by the stone monster in the "Stone Idol Chamber" then they must race to avoid being crushed by the closing walls in the "Wall Chamber". After that, their task is to not get wrapped up in the "Mummy Chamber" before next trying to escape from the "Floor Chamber" where the ground slowly rises until the hapless player slides off to the their doom. Finally, in the "Cliff Chamber", the players must use their wits as they are quizzed one-by-one while portions of the walls begin to protrude, threatening to push them over into the bottomless abyss.

Interspersed between these five rooms are additional challenges including quizzes, gambling to win more Golden Pharaohs, and even the ultra-popular "Spring of the Goddess" metal-ball challenge of trying to control and drop a ball into a goal using two ramp-like bars.

TORE! is a game of both chance and skill as your brain and ability to stay cool under pressure will help you as much as a lucky die roll. All the while the game maintains the same light-hearted humor from the TV show.

From the game rules (translated):
This game is a three-dimensional board game of trying to find the "Golden Pharaoh Statues" hidden in the cursed temple! Try to escape from the Pharaoh's many challenges while collecting more Pharaoh Statues than your opponents!
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – The Fridge
description:
Fridge is heavy combat brain. It commands other machines, thinks for them, optimizes tactics. Fridge constantly scans battlefield for any changes that could affect Moloch actions.

This set contains 1 Fridge mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Anihilator
description:
Anihilator is most powerfull of Moloch machines - heavy, resilient and deadly. When it appears on the battlefield, everyone knows it is key battle for the machines.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Hybrids
description:
Hybrids are blasphemous mix of human and the machine. Just their look makes you shiver. They are strong, well armed units that can be used for large variety of tasks.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Parity
description: Parity is a trick taking game using the standard deck of cards. You get the number of points equal to the number of tricks you take. However, if the number of trick is odd, then your score is negative. Thus, for 0,1,2,3,4,5,... tricks, you get 0,-1,2,-3,4,-5,... points, respectively. Since there are 13 tricks, someone must have a negative score!

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Dr Quinn
description:
Toughest woman on the battlefield. Medic - best at sewing, best at saving lives. Gives hope to those who think there is no hope for them.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Lieutenant
description:
Its not easy to to promoted to lieutenant. He commands a squad and he knows how to do it. Must be one of the best in his squad. His special rules allow to add additional reaction.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Captain Berg
description:
Captain Berg survived more than most Outpost battalions did. He is used for special tasks, where everyone knows that Outpost is going down.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Cyborgs
description:
Cyborgs. Toughest of Borgo units. They have modified skeletons and muscles and augmentations that increase their stamina. That gives them superhuman ability to survive.
This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Brick
description:
Brick is natural born killer. Guy knows how to use his shotgun, and in need he gets his axe. He pours fear in hearts of his enemies and allies alike.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Bison
description:
Mutations made Bison huge. Huge and strong. Now he carries everywhere heavy machine gun and sledgehammer. He is so tough that he ignores first wound he gets.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Muttis
description:
Muttis are horrible creation of Moloch. Unnaturally grown muscles give him superhuman strength. They are made to be universal soldier - good at medium and close range, deadly in hand to hand combat.

This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Preacher
description:
Preacher is the voice of heavens brought to US. When words fail he turns to his shotgun. He gives your gang ability to reroll failed tests.
Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Rat
description:
Rat. Nobody pays attention to him. Can move not being seen. He is so cheap that your enemy will not want to waste his bullets on him. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Assasin
description:
Assasin. Hidden and deadly. Impossible to track down. Perfect sniper. Gives you bonus for every enemy he kills. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Griffeys' Dice Ball "The show" Baseball Game
description:
Select your teams from 24 possible line ups or create your own team. Simply roll the dice and look up the results for each players AB. Players of the era are featured. Along with Ken Griffey guys like Sammy Sosa, Kirby Puckett, Andre Dawson, Lenny Dykstra and Wade Boggs are on the rosters.
Game comes with a score book similar to one that you might get at the stadium to list the play-by-play results of a game.
For youngsters there is also direction on how to calculate a players Batting Average.

name: Wer weiß es? für Niveau 4
description:
Question-card set for Wer weiß es?
Questions for 4th grade.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wer weiß es? für Niveau 3
description:
Question-card set for Wer weiß es?
Questions for 3rd grade.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wer weiß es? für Niveau 2
description:
Question-card set for Wer weiß es?
Questions for 2nd grade.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wer weiß es? für Niveau 1
description:
Question-card set for Wer weiß es?
Questions for 1st grade.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Die Olchis sind da!
description:
Objective: get most dainties
- acting by turn -
There are hidden dainties in the mud (plasticine);
players are positioning a slide to determine the position to dig:
finding a dainty it shouldn't match with the one wich is yours by definition; if it isn't just keep it, if not, leave it.
Finding a 'Matschknödel' (mud-dumpling)=> place it uncovered upon the table, because game ends after the fourth one is uncovered.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy

name: Pippi Langstrumpf  Jetzt komm ich!
description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your cards
- acting by turn/reacting simultaneously -
all cards are distributed among players; staples are formed & active player unvovers top card:
Person or the ape => each player must shout the correct title simultaneously. Correct - discard your card into the centre of the table; wrong - take all the cards out of the centre;
if the card shows a bag - put your hand as fast as you can into the centre - the very last one has to take all the cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Novel-based

name: MERC: The Expansion
description:
Expands the original game for up to 7 players; includes new equipment cards; includes new dictator cards.

Cool Factors:
Adds three extra players to the base game.
Introduces new dictator chaos including the assassin!
Doubles the equipment over the base game.
Description:
MERC is a strategy game where each player hires and controls a team of mercenaries working co-operatively against an evil dictator.

MERC: The Expansion is an expansion for MERC that allows you to play with up to 6 players plus a dictator. It doubles the amount of available equipment, nearly doubles the size of the map, doubles the encounters, nearly doubles the amount of MERCs, and increases the amount of chaos the dictator can unleash dramatically.

This expansion requires the base game of MERC
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Die Olchis ziehen um
description:
Objective: get rid of most 'Olchi'-chips, evenly distributed
- acting by turns -
a garbage dump is prepared by placing cards = 'Olchi' items and oil drums (fire supplies for the dragon) vertically into board & box; next to the box 11 digging chips have to be placed.
Active player rolls the coloured die and turns the box in a way, looking at the matching colour (=digger) or oil drum; using the 'Olchi' tongs a card has to be drawn: an 'Olchi' item? => drop one of your chips; an oil drum? remove a digging chip;
if the die showed an oil drum symbol the dragon requires supply: now the player should draw an 'oil drum' card instead...
Game ends if all digging chips are gone; in case that a player dropped all his 'Olchi' chips game ends at once.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Memory

name: Conni auf dem Ponyhof
description:
Objective: be the first completing your equipment => gaining a saddle, riding helmet, carrot & caring box for your pony
- acting by turns -
memory like gaming approach
18 pony cards (6 different names => 3 coloured cards forming a complete set) are shuffled and split into 3 piles;
6 tiles (with images of 0,1,2 children) are placed upon the table, hidden.
Active player draws a pony card: symbol on the back shows required tile => draw the matching tile: successful - keep the pony card and drop & mix the tiles; wrong => discard the pony card and place tile back upon the table.

name: Kribbel-Krabbel
description:
A simple, turtle-themed racing game for children.

The board shows a racing track made up of tomatoes and salad. Each player has two turtles and a peg in the same colour (so they don't forget what colour they are). The aim of the game is to get one's turtles to the end of the track first. Players take turns rolling the colour die. Turtles are moved according to the die roll. If blue is rolled, a blue turtle is moved - even if it isn't one's own turtle. Green allows the active player to put one of his/her turtles on the next salad space, red on the next tomato field. If a turtle lands on the same space as another, it is put on that turtle's back. If a turtle in a stack gets to move, the others that are on its back ride along. Turtles can only leave the track at the end if the player rolls red, green or his/her own colour. If there is another turtle on its back, they also reach the finish.
The first player who manages to get both his/her turtles to the finish wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Fußballgötter
description:
Objective: gain most balls (chips) scoring goals
- acting by turns -
3 x 3 slides light, middle and dark green are positioned, forming a square with 3 rows respectively. In each row there are hidden the same three faces shown on a die: Justus, Peter, Bob;
active player throws the die; matching slide of the 'light green' row must be turned/shown and flip again to step ahead;
if player reaches the 'dark green' row there are 3 attempts to score a goal by using the approach of 'Tiddledy Winks'; successful? A ball (chip) is won out of supply - failed: A ball is lost out of supply.
Remarks: No. of balls in supply determine length of a game
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 3v3: The Commissioned Comic Card Game
description:
Zombies, ninjas, perverts, nerds, dwarves, elves (and weretigers), evil erasers, very manly bunnies and Cthulhu Ninja Zombie attack each other in a deck-building and battling card game.

Based on the webcomic Commissioned, 3v3: The Commissioned Comic Card Game is a rapid-paced game in which players build a thirty-card deck and battle by drawing three cards a hand. Each card has an attack value, a defense value, and a special ability. The twist is that you play one card for attack, one for defense, and one for special ability.

For every point your opponent scores on you, you must remove a card from your deck and send it to the scoreboard. The first person to 10 points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Die verhexte Hexenschule
description:
Objective: collect as many star chips as possible
- acting by turns -
cards (=items) are dealt - 5 per person:
5 places: (bookshelf, chimney, table, broom cabinet, herbal rack) must be equipped with items out of players' hands.
Active player may drop a matching card at that place Bibi is present; dropped card shows next place Bibi must be moved to; if active player has a matching card it may be dropped, too...
for each dropped item player receives a starchip; your turn ends at a space you can't drop an item; draw as many cards as you've dropped.
Game ends if you can't take new cards or if one of the 5 places is fully equipped (7 items).
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dierenvrienden
description:
Dierenvrienden (Animal Friends)

Encouragement and experimenting is what matters. Your child's selfconfidence will grow while playing together. By answering questions about animals, drawing animals or mimicing animal behaviour correctly players score points and progress on a scoringpath. In the end one of the participants will reach the finish first and can claim victory.

With questions in 3 categories, children learn a lot about the animals around them and build beautiful animals themselves.

This is not a standard game as winning is not the goal, but the game-play progresses until one person passes the end of the scoring track first.


Dierenvrienden is geen standaard bordspel: in dit bordspel draait het namelijk niet om winnen, maar om proberen. Het aanmoedigen van uw kind en de ontwikkeling staan centraal. U zult zien dat het zelfvertrouwen van uw kind door Dierenvrienden spelenderwijs zal groeien.
Door vragen te beantwoorden over dieren, dieren te tekenen of dieren na te doen worden punten verzameld. Diegene die als eerste het eindpunt bereikt mag zichzelf de winnaar noemen.

Kinderen krijgen vragen in 3 categorieën, leren zo alles over het dierenrijk en maken zelf de mooiste dieren.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Maths Minus Worry
description:
Card game with 52 cards. There are 10 of each colour, numbered 1 to 10. Plus there are 4 multiplication cards, 4 subtraction cards and 4 dividing cards. The latter three groups are called #Sign' cards.

The rules suggest you may play lots of traditional games with the cards (but I doubt it). The publisher does include the rules to three different games;

Fives
Players must build up a row of five cards that total a number multiplied by five. The normal cards must be of of the same colour but not the sign cards. You do not have to use a sign card if you don't want to. You add and discard cards from your hand as in Rummy games. The first player to reveal a correct hand of five cards, wins that round. The score is one point for each five generated by the total i.e. 20 would score 4, 45 would score 9, and so on. The rules helpfully suggest that the maximum number that could be achieved with five cards is 2,560, and that total would generate 512 points.

Auction Maths
This is a trick taking game and the only game where the colours are ranked; Black, Blue, Green, Red. Black is the lowest ranked colour and Red is the highest.The game is for four players, playing as partners. Both partnerships bid to claim a number of trick (5 being the minimum, 13 the most). Your partner can overcall your bid if he wants to. The player with the winning bid can choose a colour to be the 'Double' suit. This means that every card in that colour counts as if it was doubled (A 4 card would be an 8 card, a x4 card would be a x8 card, and so on). One thing to note, players do not have to follow suit. Any card can be played to any trick. When the calling side wins a trick, it only scores if the four cards played (and in the order the cards were laid) total 25 or more. If not, the trick is laid to one side and doesn't count. You score for each trick made plus a bonus for making your game. The opposition score for every trick by which you fail to make your contract.

Number Building
Players agree before the start of a hand, the total that five cards laid out must achieve. The rules suggest a number under 50 is the wisest choice. Once agreed (before you see your cards), all players will work towards that total. Every player gets 6 cards and must lay a normal number card in front of themselves in the first round. In subsequent rounds a player may draw a card of the deck or a card of the discard pile or can lay a card next to his cards on the table. Once a player has met the total successfully, the hand ends and scoring is based on the small number in the corners of the cards. If you make the total with 5 cards of the same colour, an extra 150 is scored. This bonus reduces if two colours were involved. After an agreed number of hands, the highest total wins.

name: Sportfåne
description:
Swedish quiz game. (English: "sport geek").

Simple quiz game with failry uncommon sports questions.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

name: Intim
description:
Swedish quiz game. (English: "Intimate").

Questions realting to sex, pornography, beauty, sex toys etc.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

name: Trifecta Poker
description:
Trifecta Poker is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards as Win, Place, and Show.

A blend of Horse Racing, Classic Poker games and all original Artwork.

This set of Race Horse Playing cards is a real game changer. For instance every card is a Face Card and there are no Kings or Queens, Jacks nor Aces. The Royalty here or the Ace of the Race is represented by what horse is the Winner of the Race. These cards wear Silks not Suits.

This is the only game that tells you the Winners before you Start. The only question is who holds the Winning hand. The objective of the Play is to determine if You hold a Winning hand and have a chance to take home the Cash. The Rules are Simple but you can't Win if you don't Try and it's obviously better if you Trifecta!

The rules are simple in the basic form of play however, all sorts of other cards games can be played with this new game.
Here are the rules:

The Rules
Trifecta Poker Hand Rankings

Trifecta Poker can be played using almost any variation of common Poker Play rules. The Key to Trifecta Poker is that the winning hand is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards. 

Dealer shuffles the 52 Cards and draws 3 different Horse Cards in a vertical display outward from the POT known as the Trifecta Flop. After each play the cards are shuffled and a new Trifecta Flop is drawn. The First Horse drawn is the Winning Horse, the 2nd is the Place and the 3rd is the Show - aka WPS. or a Superfecta game a 4th Horse is drawn. Duplicate Horse cards if they appear in the Flop are returned to the deck. Dealer then re-shuffles the remaining deck and deals 5 cards to each player. Players may now hold pat their original cards or draw from one to four new cards from the deck. The Player with the highest combinations of Trifecta, Quinella, or WPS card combinations wins. A Trifecta is all three winning horses, a Quinella is the Win and Place horses, and the WPS are any horses in the money. WPS combinations are ranked by the highest number of Horse cards in the money without a Trifecta or Quinella.

All Trifecta Poker hand rankings can be improved by also holding typical Poker combinations as shown below:

For instance no. 1 : A Trifecta with a pair of any horses beats a Trifecta with no pair.
For instance no. 2: A Win horse with three of a kind beats a Win horse with a pair.
If NO players hold WPS Cards typical Poker Hand rankings are won as follows:
Four of a Kind - Four of the same Horse cards.
Full House- Three of a kind and a pair. The player with the higher value three of a kind, wins in the event of a tie. If both players have the same three of a kind then the player with the highest pair wins.
Straight -Five cards of any horses in ascending order with the higher straight wins the tie.
Three of a Kind- Simply three cards of the same horse.
Two Pairs of Horses - The player holding the highest pair takes the pot in the event that more than one player is holding two pairs. If two players are both holding the same two pair then the player with the highest fifth horse (i.e. the kicker) takes the pot.
One Pair of Horses-Two cards of the same horse.
HIGH Horse -Highest card takes all in the event there is a complete absence of the above hands.

name: Das kleine Ich bin ich: Würfelpuzzle
description:
Objective: be the first completing your puzzle
- acting by turns -
arrange puzzle tile by colour and build a pile for each player,
symbols on top.
Each player rolls the die:
There is a matching symbol on top of your pile - take it and try to complete your puzzle; if your die shows 'Das kleine Ich bin Ich = joker', take the tile, too, but the 'moon' symbol let you sleep - lose one turn.

name: Moai
description:
Introduction
They say that the mythical King Tuu Ku Ihu and the god Make Make possessed the “mana” or divine power to command the Moai to walk. Question is, have you got the mana to move them?
Moai is a territorial game for 2 players.
Played on a hex board
You will also need a Black and a White pawn and a supply of counters.
Play
Players start by placing their Moai on a space anywhere on the board.
White moves first, players then alternate turns.
On a turn
1) Place two counters on empty spaces in line with your Moai on the board.
2) Move your Moai towards or away along an empty path from either counter, you have placed.
When placing counters, you must have empty spaces between those counters and your Moai. Once placed counters are fixed.
A Moai must move a minimum of 1 space toward or away from the counters just placed.
The player unable to take her turn loses the game.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Diggin Deep Tennis
description:
Welcome to the world of Diggin’ Deep Tennis. Diggin’ Deep Tennis is a multifaceted game, which brings the world of professional tennis right onto your tabletop. You play at the pace that suits you with Diggin’ Deep Tennis. The game engine offers a quick play mechanic in which you can resolve the action game-by-game, set-by-set, or you can even simulate an entire match in as little as one roll of the dice.

Diggin’ Deep Tennis also features a point-by-point mechanic which factors in every possible skill for the player rated. Whether it’s the big server like Andy Roddick, the great return of service game of Novak Djokovic, or fantastic all-around play of Nadal and Federer, every player will perform as they did in real life.

The point-by-point game also offers an amazing element of strategy with the Diggin’ Deep System, which allows players to dig deep for a little something extra in certain circumstances. Do you Dig Deep do attempt to break serve in the first set? Or do you wait for an opportunity later in the match? The Diggin’ Deep System brings tabletop tennis games to an entirely new level of play. The Diggin’ Deep System also makes for outstanding head-to-head play. Not to fear though, we didn’t leave solitaire players out in the cold, as the game also has a solitaire system for when to Dig Deep.

It’s match point, and time for you to Dig Deep!

name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Das Blütenfest
description:
A Princess-Lillifee themed travel game for two players.

The game comes in a metal box, whose lid also functions as the game board. It shows a grid of 4x7 squares and two starting spaces. On the grid are placed 28 magnetic flower pieces. Players take turns rolling a die. If the active player rolls a flower colour, he/she may move his/her player piece (also magnetic) until it reaches a flower of the corresponding colour. Pieces may only be moved either vertically or horizontally, and it may not jump over the other player's piece or the rose piece. If it reaches a flower of the colour on the die roll, the player wins that flower. If he can't reach a flower of the current colour, he/she may move their piece to an empty space. If a player rolls the rose symbol, he gets to move the rose piece. The rose can only be plucked once all the other flowers have been taken. In this phase of the game, there are no more die rolls. Each player gets to move once per round. While the other flowers are worth one point, the rose is worth three points.
The game ends when all flowers have been plucked. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Speed!
description:
"Speed!" is a card game designed to teach children to multiply and how to multiply faster. There are eight decks of cards that come in a rainbow of colors. Each deck focuses on skip-counting by a different number (2-9). Once familiar with the numbers in a game, multiplication becomes simple.

Two people play against each other to see who can get rid of all their cards first. There is no taking turns and is someone shouts "speed" when the played cards are the same their opponent must add the played cards to his/her stack.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: 24 Game: Primer Multiply/Divide
description: Each card contains two wheels and a target number. Player must pick the wheel that can make the target number. You can multiply or divide only. Use all the numbers on each wheel, but use each number only once. Only one wheel works on each card. Each card is worth 1 to 3 points depending on difficulty. The first player to make the target number wins the card. Player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Number, Puzzle

name: 24 Game: Primer Factors/Multiples
description:
Players work together to create wheels of numbers that share a common factor. Can be used as an individual or group activity. Cards have a self-check feature (answer on back) to allow students to practice or review multiplication facts without supervision. For more activities, go to our "Teacher's Tools" section.

Players can continue placing more cards around the edges to make more wheels. Remember, if the numbers are touching, they must have a common factor. Use any card with the same common factor, regardless of the color in the corner.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Number, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Pacific Battles: Nomonhan, 1939
description:
Publisher's description:
"Pacific Battles: Nomonhan, 1939, is a wargame series of several campaigns in the Pacific Theater of operations in World War II. The system emphasizes the operational level of these campaigns, and deals with land and air operations. Nomonhan is the second game in the series (Japanese vs. Soviet), following the first game in the series, Guadalcanal (World at War issue #23); It covers the entire land-air campaign for the strategic Mongolian city of Nomonhan, May to September, 1939. The game includes 228 die-cut counters, and also includes air units, supply markers, campaign chits, suppression chits, deception markers, etc.
Land units are primarily regiments, and air units represent from 12 to 60 aircraft, depending on the quality of the air force. The colorful map features Mongolia, with each hex representing approximately two miles across, and includes such prominent locations as Kawamata Bridge and Nomonhan, as well as various charts and tables for easy reference during play

Published in World at War magazine #32, Oct-Nov 2013.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 week
Hex: 2 miles / 3.2 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Regiment

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 5/8" counters)
One 16-page Sedan rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-4"

name: KISS: Got To Choose Card Game
description: The mix 'em match 'em game of KISSstory. Get ready to mix it up and test your knowledge of KISStory! Match the cards to score points then get ready to score more by answering questions in three challenging categories. Sure Know Something KISS trivia. Shout It Out Loud song lyrics and the Shock Me truth or dare challenge! Whether your a Private or a General in the KISS Army, you'll love the Got To Choose KISS card game.

name: Koekie Loeren: Het Kruipkoekie
description:
Expansion to the game Koekie Loeren (Cookie Disco). Het kruipkoekie (the crawl cookie) is played on top of the cookies of the basis game. The crawl cookie itself has no point value, therefore a cookie that’s connected to the crawl cookie only, cannot be moved. A cookie that’s underneath the crawl cookie, has no point value as long as the crawl cookie is on top of it and no points are scored for a cookie that’s underneath the crawl cookie at the end of the game.

This small expansion gives the basis game even more tactical options and depth.

name: China (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: In this installation we get to visit Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong and other fast growing cities. The game follows the original Ticket to Ride rules. While the destination ticket layout does not follow the original Ticket to Ride design the map is amazingly beautiful: it features a huge dragon on one side and inherits the usual TtR design. I am looking forward to playing this in conjunction with a quick game of Mah-Jongg maybe...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: À l'abordage
description:
The goal is to place six of his balls in the opposing camp.

Each player has colored balls (yellow or red) on the game board, each place 6 balls out of 6 boxes left his ship.
At each turn, player rolls two dice, each dice has faces marked 1 to 4, and 2-sided "star". The player advances the ball three number indicated by the dice. If the two sides shows "star", the player turns the tray mechanism which will bring up the holes on some boxes are player is able to move there.
Arriving on a square occupied by an opponent, the player takes the ball and place it in its hold.

The winner is the one who places his first 6 balls in the opposing ship.

name: Plantit
description:
A game for garden lovers. The board illustrates 4 gardens during winter. Each garden is divided in to squares with botanical names and a centre piece of 2 squares. Card cut out square tiles are similarly named and show summer bloom and garden furnishings.

Players roll the dice in turn. 4,5 or 6 allows you to take a tile from the pile. 1,2 or 3 forces you to return a tile to the heap. As the game progresses you make your own store for discarding weeds or duplicates back to the pile.

Planting is not as easy as you think! Many items for the garden are quickly collected as there are many copies. However, some items are rare and difficult to find. The first to finish, wins.

A rare, well designed and beautiful game. The designs vary but the contents are identical.

name: Jeu de entrepreneurs Bruxelles
description:
The aim of the game is to place company cards as quickly as possible on the board. The board is a map of Brussels. Each square on the map has a different value. The square where to build the companies is chosen by moving two counters by two dice. One dice result is moved vertical the other one horizontal. Whenever the two counters match the same square, one company card can be placed.

A soon as one player has completed his set of companies on the board the game is over and each player adds up the value of his sites.

name: Family Computer Quiz
description:
The game offers 1001 questions on various topics: history, cinema, through techniques and languages!
The game board is a console programmed with sounds and lights!

Each player chooses a color and pressing the corresponding button. Pressing the GO button starts the game and console offers a number of questions. The reader reads the text in the book and provided support on each answer he believes is right. Console flashes and gives 1 point for each correct answer. The first player who answer 5 ​questions wins the round.
Several rounds can be arranged.

name: Mia and me: Der magische Trumptus
description:
A children's game set in the universe of the 2011 live action/CGI animated television series "Mia and me".

Background story: The elves are trying to find the pieces of a magical instrument, the "magical Trumptus", which are scattered all over Centopia. The Trumptus is their only hope of chasing away evil Panthea and her Munculus warriors. But where to look for the pieces? They are all over Centopia, and behind every corner there might be an evil Munculus warrior. Cautiously, the players search for the pieces. Will they be able to find all the pieces before Panthea manages to mobilise her troops?

Gameplay: The Trumptus and Munculus chits are randomised and placed into the slits in the game board. Each player gets an elf board. The Panthea board is placed in the middle of the table, next to the game board. Players take turns rolling the die. If a number from 1-3 is rolled, the corresponding number of chits is taken from the game board and placed in front of the active player's elf board. Then he/she can decide if they want to roll again or end their turn. They may repeat this step as often as they want, as long as they don't draw a Munculus chit from the board or roll the Munculus symbol.
If a player decides to end their turn, they place all the Trumptus chits of their own colour on their elf board. They return the Trumptus chits of other players' colours to the game board (putting them into slits of their choice). Then it's the next player's turn.
If a Munculus chit is drawn, the player's turn is over immediately. The Munculus chit is placed on the Panthea board. Previously drawn Trumptus chits are returned to the board and the die is handed over to the next player. If the Munculus symbol is rolled, the player's turn is over too. All previously drawn Trumptus chits are given to the players they belong to, and they place them on their elf boards.

The game ends when one player has placed all 8 Trumptus chits of their colour on their elf board. That player wins the game. The game also ends when the Panthea board has been completely filled with Munculus chits. In this case, Panthea wins. Second place goes to the player who has collected the most Trumptus chits.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Croc Poissons
description: The die is rolled and each player must "catch" the small fish with the color designated by the dice. But beware, if the fish bite black fish by mistake, the player must put all catched fish back into play. When there are no more fish on the table, except the black one the game ends and the player with the most fish in his pile is the winner.

name: Aristoocrazy
description:
Aristoocrazy is a game about the Middle Ages which deals not with the clichés of that period – such as religious fanaticism or cruelty – but rather with slightly exaggerated relationships within the noble families. It offers deep strategic choices, but spices them with fun, humor, and player communication. Relive this comedy about the Middle Ages and have fun with Aristoocrazy!

Each player has ten unique characters from his family at his disposal – five noblemen and five noblewomen – but he starts with only one pair of aristrocrats. Throughout the game, characters will struggle to conquer neutral regions or those controlled by an opponent, in addition to using the benefits of their abilities. Each character has three abilities, which are helpful for gaining victory points (VPs) or attacking other characters. The game has nine different abilities, which are represented by cardboard tokens. When a male and female character marry, new characters are born into play, with the newborn children inheriting its parents' abilities.

If two characters with a close family relationship meet, however, there is a risk that their child will be "different". When such a child grows up, naturally you'll need him to take care of your domain or a military campaign that you're running – but if his wits aren't in the right place, he won't be of much help. (And who would want to marry such a dud in the first place?)

Aristoocrazy lasts twelve rounds, and at the end of each round the victory conditions for the current round are evaluated. The players try to optimize their actions – moves on the board, attacks, the use of abilities – in order to fulfill the victory conditions defined on the event card in place for that round. The players who best fulfill the victory conditions are rewarded with VPs or special action cards, which can help them in certain situations in future rounds. The player with the most VPs after the final round wins!

name: Le Cochon Qui Rit Encore Plus
description:
Modernized version of the classic game of The Laughing Pig

The pigs are dressed in funny outfits and accessories, becoming a bimbo, a football fan, a player lasso or a rocker.

The die has been replaced by a electric mechanism with the pig character sounds and voices.

The object is get his/her pig ready first spinning the wheel and fitting the pig together. But players must be careful and avoid the butcher!

name: Česká hudba
description:
A fun game for fans of Czech music.

A fun game for fans of Czech music and not only for them. In this game you will find 1800 questions, which are divided into 6 groups; such as popular music, film music, traditional music, folk etc.

Double-sided game board allows you to play family or party version of this game. You will perform tasks as humming songs, mime or drawing. The most successful of the end of the game you get "Český slavík" award.
---
Zábavná hra pro fanoušky české hudby

Zábavná hra pro fanoušky české hudby a nejen pro ně. V této vědomostní hře najdete 1 800 otázek, které jsou rozděleny do 6 okruhů: populární hudba, filmová hudba, tradiční hudba, folk a country, různé a dozpívej.

Oboustranný herní plán umožňuje hrát i párty verzi této hry, ve které budete plnit i zábavné úkoly formou broukání písniček, pantomimy nebo kreslení. Ten nejúspěšnější z Vás na konci hry získá Českého slavíka.
categories: Educational, Memory, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Endangered Species Game
description:
The Endangered Species Game was specifically developed to encourage an awareness of just how vulnerable the various species of life can be. This game has been produced with the endorsement of the World Wide Fund for Nature and provides an insight into the lifestyles and dangers to mammals, insects, fish, plants, birds, reptiles and amphibians.

Be the first player to complete a jigsaw puzzle of an endangered species before the species is extinct. Players earn puzzle pieces by answering questions about the endangered species but beware - your loss through the roll of the die could mean your opponents' gain. The sixty cards are superb photographs of Australia's endangered species.

name: Volu Puzzle: Drôles D'Animaux – Funny Animals
description:
6 Funny animal Stories to put together: puzzles for young children.
This puzzle contains 6 small puzzles whose pieces fit together to create animals in three dimensions.
After building these six funny animals, children can have fun with and tell fantastic stories!
Tha small pieces can be put in to a bag, each body handled to the players. Then the pieces get out of the bag, and the first to finish the animal or animals wins.

name: Dobrodružné hry
description:
Contains four original illustrated games of varying difficulty for preschoolers and young schoolchildren. Main purpose of the games is fun and motivating joint playful learning of basic math and letters.

LOST ATLANTIDA is an adventurous expedition to depths of the sea, during which players will learn simple counting through battles with sea creatures.

CLEVER CATS help sharpen thinking of small children and get to know letters.

ALPHABET PYRAMID works on the principle of verbal football and inventing appropriate words will ease the way to the treasure.

WALKING WITH DINOSAURS game is full of pitfalls and nice shortcuts and can be handle even by the smallest players.

All games have simple rules and are very intuitive.

---
Leporelo obsahuje 4 originálně ilustrované hry různé náročnosti pro předškoláky a malé školáky. Hlavním smyslem her je společná zábava a motivující hravé učení matematiky a písmenek.

ZTRACENÁ ATLANTIDA je dobrodružnou výpravou hlubinami moře, při které se naučíme jednoduché počítání při soubojích s mořskými tvory a při získávání vědomostních krystalů. Hledačky v hlubinách ukrývají kompletní malou násobilku.

CHYTRÉ KOČKY pomáhají bystřit myšlení a malé děti si dobře osvojí podobu písmen.

PÍSMENKOVÁ PYRAMIDA funguje na principu slovního fotbalu a vymýšlení vhodných slov vám usnadní cestu k pokladu. Když někdo neví, napovíme mu hádankou.

Hra PUTOVÁNÍ S DINOSAURY je plná nástrah i příjemných zkratek, kterou zvládnou i nejmenší hráči.

Všechny hry mají jednoduchá intuitivní pravidla a vše co potřebujete je jen kostka a figurka pro každého hráče, které jsou součástí leporela. To si poskládáte pro každou hru dle potřeby. TIP: K vědomostním krystalům, do dinosauřích hnízd nebo do cíle je prima dát nějakou sladkost. Rozhodně to zvýší motivaci k vítězství!


Stolní hry pro děti:
Rozměr rozložené knihy je 98 x 34 cm.
Rozměr složené knihy je 27 x 34 cm.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Veselé hry
description:
Contains four original and nicely illustrated board games mainly for pre-school children, but whole family will be entertained.

Attractive themes as a witch school or pirate treasure hunting become an inspirational environment for creating your own stories and legends. The focus of board games for children is especially fun in the game and not the vicious rivalry.

In all games children will expand their vocabulary and sharpen thinking.

All games have simple rules (roll dice and move) and are intuitive, all you need is a cube and the figure for each player.

---

Leporelo obsahuje 4 originálně a vtipně ilustrované herní plány stolních her na míru šité předškolákům, u kterých se pobaví celá rodina.

Atraktivní témata mašinek, čarodějnické školy či pirátských pokladů se stávají inspirativním prostředím pro vytváření vlastních příběhů a legend ke hře. Těžiště stolních her pro děti je hlavně v legraci při hře a nikoliv v zákeřném soupeření. Při stolní hře se budete radovat nad rychlými postupy vpřed. Avšak ani náhlé nezdary vás nemusí zarmoutit, ba dokonce vás jejich příčiny pobaví.

Tři tématické stolní hry pro děti doplňuje hra Chytrá opice, při které si děti rozšiřují slovní zásobu a bystří myšlení. Najdete tu i několik hledaček. Všechny hry mají jednoduchá intuitivní pravidla a vše co potřebujete je jen kostka a figurka pro každého hráče, které jsou součástí leporela. To si poskládáte pro každou hru dle potřeby.

Stolní hry pro děti:
Rozměr rozložené knihy je 98 x 34 cm.
Rozměr složené knihy je 27 x 34 cm.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Humor, Pirates, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Schlitzohr
description:
An abstract game played on a 9x9 grid, in which players have to find their pieces and every player can move every piece.

The game consists of a game board, 16 ear-shaped player's pieces, 12 joker cards and a standard six-sided die.
On each side of the board there are four coloured spaces to which the ears have to be moved.

Each player is assigned a colour and receives three joker cards. Players try to locate the ears in their colour (the colour markings are at the bottom, face-down side) and to move them onto the target spaces of the same colour. At the start of the game, the ears are randomly (and without knowing the colour) distributed on the starting spaces.
Players take turns rolling the die. A die roll can be used to move one ear the corresponding number of spaces vertically or horizontally, or the roll can be split among several ears. If a player rolls a six, he/she has several options:
- He/she can move ears as in a normal roll.
- He/she can roll again and look at the colour markings of a number of ears corresponding to the die roll.
- He/she can place an ear of which he/she knows it is his/her colour directly onto a target space.
A player can decide not to move on his/her turn and use a joker card instead. The active player then rolls the die to determine how many ears he/she may inspect.
When players have found out which ears are theirs, they try to move them to their target spaces as secretly as possible. When an ear has reached a target space, it is turned over and the colour is shown to all players. If it is the wrong colour, it goes to one of the target spaces of the player it belongs to.

The game ends when all of one player's ears have reached their target spaces. Each ear that has reached its target space is worth 5 points, each joker card that hasn't been used up is worth two points. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Mathable Quattro
description:
Mathable Quattro is a special counting card game that combines classical games Mathable and counting points cards.
Quattro hiding in a small box for card games, two stacks of 53 cards. So if you count well, it means total supply 106 cards in the deck. All cards have number from 0-50.
At the start of every game mix whole package properly, so you don´t have too much of the same numbers together. Lower numbers are usual in the package than the high ones. Each player gets seven cards in hand, which is required to discard as soon as possible. Who do it first, is the winner of the lot.
Players must combine the numbers in hands with the results in any row or column of the table. For example, if you are over twelve and four, you play sixteen (12 4 = 16), eight (12-4 = 8) threesome (12:4 = 3) or osmačtyřicítku (12x4 = 48).
---
Mathable Quattro je speciální počítací hra, která kombinuje herní systémy her Mathable a klasického přebíjení karet.
Quattro je nejmenším bratříčkem ze čtveřice a ukrývá se v malé krabičce pro karetní hry, ve dvou sloupečcích po 53 kartách. Pokud tedy dobře počítáte, znamená to celkovou nabídku 106 karet v balíčku.
Na začátku každé partie pořádně zamíchejte balíček, ať nemáte příliš stejných čísel pohromadě. Nižších čísel je celkem v balíčku víc, než těch vysokých. Každý z hráčů dostane do ruky sedm karet, kterých se musí zbavit. Komu se to podaří jako prvnímu, se stává vítězem partie.
Hráči nyní musí zkombinovat čísla ve své ruce s výsledky v některé řadě nebo sloupci na stole. Například pokud nad sebou leží dvanáctka a čtyřka, můžete zahrát šestnáctku (12+4=16), osmičku (12-4=8), trojku (12:4=3) nebo osmačtyřicítku (12x4=48).
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Wooky Entertainment

name: Das Schleswig-Holstein-Spiel
description:
A simple trivia game played on a map of the German State of Schleswig-Holstein.

A long track winds around the State, starting in Hamburg and ending on the Isle of Sylt. Movement is decided by a die. There are four categories of questions:
A = General knowledge
K = Culture
W = Economic
P = Politics and History
Obviously, all the 500 questions in the game have some connection to Schleswig Holstein.

There is an interesting shortcut that may be taken where no questions are asked. Instead you roll the die and if you get a number from 1 to 5, you move two spaces. But if you roll a 6, you must go back 15 spaces.

First to reach the end (Ziel) wins.

On a little bit of extra trivia, the board shows clearly that the Eastern neighbour to Schleswig-Holstein is, in fact, the DDR (East Germany). As the game was published in 1989 and the wall came down that year, then this might be the last non-historical game to feature the DDR as a neighbouring country.

name: Memo Grand Prix
description:
A car race game that includes elements of Memory.

Each player is given a set of 20 cards. Your set is shuffled and layed face down in two rows of 10 cards. This will be your 'track'.

Every turn, a player turns over two cards. If they match, his car can move on to one of them if one of the two cards is 'next in line' on the track. Thus, the first thing to do is to get a matched card on one of the two start cards. Having acheived that, you want to get a card face up in row 2, and so on. If you do not find a match,your turn is over. If you do find one, you can turn over two more cards and keep going until you fail to expose a matching pair.

The first player to reach row 10 on his track, wins.

name: Schnuffel
description:
A children's game in which judging length and shape by touch is the central element.

Game idea: A long time ago Schnuffel, the dog, and his friends hid many bones in the garden. Now they want to dig them up again but not any old bones, it has to be specific ones. The bone has to be the right shape and size. And the dogs are chasing away each other too!

Aim of the game: To find the correct wooden bone by touch as quickly as possible in order to collect the most bone cards.

How it is played: The board shows a circular path consisting of single-colour spaces and multi-coloured dog-house spaces. Arrows next to the spaces show the direction in which the dogs move. Each player has a dog-shaped player piece. A colour die determines movement. The active player puts his/her dog on the next empty space of that colour. If he/she lands on a dog-house space, he/she is allowed to search for bones. This means that he/she puts his/her hand into the bag with the wooden bones and tries to find the bone that is shown on the top bone card. While he/she is trying to identify the correct bone by touch, the other players continue taking turns rolling the die and moving their dogs. As soon as the active player thinks he/she has found the correct bone, he/she shouts "Stop!" and the other players stop rolling. The chosen bone is compared to the one on the card. If they match, the active player gets to keep the card. The wooden bone is returned to the bag. Then the active player starts searching for the next bone. His/her turn ends as soon as either one of the other players lands on a dog-house space, or he/she chooses the wrong bone.

End of game: The game ends when all the bone cards have been used up. The player with the most cards wins the game.

Game components:
- game board
- 4 dog-shaped wooden player pieces
- 9 wooden bones (different lengths, round piece on one end, or on both, or none)
- 18 bone cards (showing the different lengths and shapes)
- color die
- cloth bag

name: CCULELE Champion
description: CCULELE Champion is an action and memory game, with everyone participating at the same time to follow the poses presented to them. One by one, more poses will be presented and the challenge for you is to remember them all so that you can take actions of your own. Are you ready to challenge others to become the champion?

name: La Boîte à culture générale
description:
160 cards featuring 300 questions with six categories ("Letters", "Science", "History", "Geography", "Arts "and" Sports "). A book with a general introduction, the rules and the detailed responses of the tests.
