Assorted Monies (Votes) in five increments (500, 1,000, 5,000, 10,000)
Instruction manual
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Root Down
description:
Root Down is a 2-player abstract strategy game played on a standard 8x8 square game board.

The main mechanic is that all of a player's pieces flip from a state where they can move (kickers) to a state where they cannot move (roots) after every move. The kickers must also be next to a root in order to move, and the number of spaces they move is also determined by the number of kickers next to each root.

name: London 1888 (Second Edition)
description:
Two horrific murders were committed in London at the end of 1888. The victims were Emma Smith and Martha Tabram. That autumn, for three months, Whitechapel, in East London, was terrorized by a serial killer who came to be known as Jack the Ripper.

After committing five more murders, he suddenly stopped. Scotland Yard never solved the case and, to this day, the identity of the killer remains a mystery.

The players will personify some of the main characters of this horrific drama: they will be investigators, suspects, or both. One of them will secretly be Jack the Ripper and will have to escape, alone or with some help before being revealed and arrested.

London 1888 does not always rely on the same strategy in order to win. Roleplaying and bluffing is a very important part of the game. Every session is different and exciting.

This is the second revised edition, which includes more cards, more characters, more options and revised rules.

name: Up 4 Grabs
description: The fun of playing cards with all the excitement of a board game! Up 4 Grabs has plenty of twists and turns with every flip of a card. Collect the "aces" and "faces" (face cards) by landing on squares around the board, challenging an opponent to a "Duel", and many other ways. It’s fast-paced and constantly changing: you’ll find yourself rapidly gaining the cards you need, and then losing them just as quickly. Plan your strategy and decide what combination to go after. But keep track of what your opponents are doing and thwart them when you can. Collect the four cards you need and win!

name: Pochecko
description:
Pochecko is a strategy board game that combines aspects of Poker and Chess. It is a 2-4 player game for ages 12+.

In Pochecko, the players move markers around a board in order to claim poker cards and build a poker hand off of 1 of 2 community cards. As a counter maneuver, players may instead move one of the community blockers in order to block opponents from claiming the hand they are going for. The player with the best 5 card poker hand at the end of the game wins.

name: Are You My Baby?: Animal Game
description:
Players take on the role of an animal (dog, cat, bunny, chicken) and spin and move through farmyard spaces of various colors looking for their three baby animals. The first player to find all three of their babies and return home is the winner.

The pieces are all magnetic, as is the board.

name: Tippin' Toadstool
description:
From box:

TUMBLIN' FUMBLIN' FUN!
It's fun, it's unpredictable... It's Tippin' Toadstool! Can you get rid of your leaves without tipping the frog? Add one leaf at a time to the teetering toadstool and see it being to grow and sway as more leaves are placed. The first player to place all their leaves in the Tippin' Toadstool without tipping the frog, WINS!

name: Masheroo! The Game of Mash or Be Mashed
description: Masheroo!™ is the hilarious game that keeps everyone on their toes! The first player to match their shape and face chips to their pattern card wins! But be ready for the unexpected, the Masher Bolt can mash shapes, leaving no choice but to rebuild. It's the fast paced game of Mash or Be Mashed!

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Telepods Star Destroyer Set
description:
Product Description:

The Angry Birds Star Wars app comes to life! This line of Hasbro toys captures all the launching and destroying fun of the app in physical form and features your favorite Star Wars characters re-imagined as high-flying Angry Birds and villainous pigs! You get 5 Bird figures and 5 Pig figures in the Star Destroyer Set for big launch-and-destroy missions. You can stack and then destroy the Star Destroyer with the blocks, figures and launcher. Launch 3 Bird figures at once with the Lightsaber launcher for an epic Bird-on-Pig assault! Can you topple the Imperial oinkers? Destroy the Empire, then set the blocks up and destroy it again!

Set includes 1 Lightsaber launcher, 10 figures, 1 Telepods base, 20 blocks, 7 Star Destroyer pieces and instructions
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga TIE Fighter Game
description:
Product Description:

The Angry Birds Star Wars app comes to life in this Jenga TIE Fighter Game! Send your birds flying to pop the piggy pilot out of the TIE Fighter! The game includes Jenga blocks and parts to build a TIE Fighter and a TIE Fighter Pilot pig in the cockpit. Once you've built your fighter, send your Han Solo, Luke Skywalker and R2-D2 birds flying at it with the Millenium Falcon launcher! Can you knock the TIE Fighter Pilot pig off his perch? The first player to destroy the TIE Fighter wins!

Includes pig fuselage, base, pig nose windshield, 8 zigzag wing corner blocks, 18 full-size Jenga blocks, 2 half-block size wing center blocks, 3 birds (Han Solo bird, Luke Skywalker bird, R2-D2 bird), TIE Fighter pilot pig, Millennium Falcon launcher, setup card with instructions.

Product Features:
· Jenga TIE Fighter Game brings the Angry Birds Star Wars app to life
· Build a TIE Fighter with the Jenga blocks and fighter parts
· TIE Fighter Pilot pig figure sits in the cockpit
· Millennium Falcon launcher sends your Han Solo, Luke Skywalker and R2-D2 birds flying at the TIE Fighter
· The first to destroy the TIE Fighter wins
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Thomas The Tank Engine And Friends Card Game
description:
Try to get rid of all your cards by placing engines down of the same type that are already in play.

Thomas logo cards are jokers and can allow you to change the engine without needing an engine specific card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bonomix
description:
A game about observation and speed.

The deck contains some funny figures of simple men, each figure is divided in three parts: head, bust and legs. Each of these parts can have different shapes and color. For instance, we could have a men with a smiling head, a red bust and green-red legs. Another men could have a king head (with a crown), a green bust and some orange legs.

Setup: draw seven card and place them in circle on the table,

Gameplay: each turn a new card is draft from the deck. If the new card has two characteristcs matching at least two characteristcs of the cards already on the table (the seven cards) players must touch the matching card. The quickest player scores one point. If a player touches the wrong card, it loses 2 points.

Win conditions: game ends when the deck is over. The player with the higher number of points wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: GeoCards World
description:
GeoCards World includes fifty cards with which players can play three games that challenge their geographical knowledge. Each card is double-sided, with the outline of a country, its name, its population and its size on one side of the card and its capital and the surrounding countries on the other. In all three games, whoever collects the most cards wins.

In the first game, shuffle the cards with the capitals face-up, then take turns naming the country depicted on the card. Guess right and you claim the card; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

In the second game, deal the cards out evenly among the players with the capitals face-up. On a turn, you hold one of your cards capital side-out toward your left-hand opponent. If he can name one of the countries adjacent to the depicted country, he claims the card; if not, the next opponent in clockwise order can try to do so. Remove the card from the game if no one guesses correctly.

In the third game, deal ten cards capital side-up to each player. On a turn, choose two cards and hold them out to your left-hand opponent. If he can guess which country is larger in size or population (depending on what choose at the start of play), he claims both cards; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

name: Monopoly: Neuburg an der Donau
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Neuburg an der Donau, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Slangology: Promo Pack
description:
A small card expansion / promotional give-away for Slangology.

It consists of 9 playable cards and a cover card.

name: Crazy Cat: Wilde Jagd
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Everything has gone crazy in the sewers! Who will be the first feline in Crazy Cat: Wilde Jagd to follow the cheeky mice to the big cheese?

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Ninja-Flip
description:
Game description from the publisher:

On the pizza, ready...ninja flip! Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael and Michelangelo have ordered their favorite pizzas in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Ninja-Flip, and once those steaming pizzas arrive at headquarters, things really start hopping as everyone wants to take a slice from everyone else while still keeping as much of their own pizza as possible.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Entourer
description:
Entourer is played on a hexagonal board divided into 217 smaller circles or hexagons, nine on each side of the board. A kind of spinner is used to determine how many pieces a player may use in a given turn, zero through four. The game can be played with two to ten players, each with thirty-six pieces of his own color, whether playing individually or in partnership.

For every turn, a player spins, then places that many of his pieces on the board, with the goal of surrounding an opponent’s pieces completely. This is called an “entourer” and the surrounding player must then remove all of his opponent’s pieces and replace them with his own. If an entourer is caused by more than one player, they then take turns removing and replacing their opponent’s captured pieces.

At any time during the game, players may barter with each other to regain their lost pieces. The first player to have all of his pieces on the board wins the game.

name: Das Spinnen Spiel
description:
The board depicts a circular spider web. Players move their five dice around the outer rim of the web, but have to cross it once in each of the four sectors. The players also control ten spider chips each with which they attempt to intercept the other player's dice and block the other player's spiders.

Game play is dice-driven: On a roll of a 6, a player enters the web and starts the journey with one die (subsequent sixes force him/her to add another die). After each move, a player places a new spider into the web (any position, but a different grid that has intersections with the one for the dice). Once all ten spiders have been placed, these can be after a die's movement. Spiders move any distance along the web, unless they are blocked by other spiders.

Every time a die crosses the web, it is turned up one number (starting with a one). If a die with a five on it reaches the starting position again, it is turned to a six and the owner wins the game.

name: The Game of War
description:
The Game of War, in the designer's own words:

"THE GAME OF WAR is one of skill, and belongs to that class which includes chess and checkers. It is played upon a board laid out in squares or rectangles, and the pieces employed represent and symbolize the important men and weapons of warfare, while their movements simulate the military evolutions of two armies opposed in battle, advancing, retreating and engaging in the diverse methods that characterize actual warfare, and employing all the various forms of strategy.

Each side, as a fighting force, comprises a king, a commanding officer, field and siege artillery, cavalry and ordinary troops and flying machines.

All the movements of Chess are found in the game, and, in addition, the troops have the movements made familiar in checkers or draughts, while some pieces are given different moves, and more freedom of movement than in either Chess or Checkers. But while these two games are thus drawn on to contribute all their virtues, the vital principle of The Game of War is radically different and wholly new.

In Chess the game is won when a player so hems in his adversary's king that it cannot escape capture; in Checkers all of the adversary's pieces must be captured and taken from the board, or the last of them penned, to secure a victory.

In The Game of War, however, the object is to lay siege to and capture the citadel — a central square in the king's rank on which the ruler is stationed at the outset of the game. When an adversary's piece can enter and hold this square without being captured at the next move, such occupancy of the citadel wins the game.

Chief of the many other distinctive features in The Game of War is the introduction of two flying machines on each side. The purpose and the movements of these are wholly novel, and give a singular fascination to the playing of the game. Moreover, the board used in the game is of a new design, having one hundred squares, instead of sixty-four, as in chess and checkers, and the all-important citadel square stands forth in battlemented prominence. In addition, there are four flying machine stations."
publishers: (Public Domain), Wm F. Drueke & Sons, Inc.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Velbert
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Velbert
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Velbert. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Games of Life's Mishaps, Domino Rex, and Diamonds and Hearts
description:
The game is designed to represent the comic side of the many mishaps constantly occurring in daily life of that period (1875).
3 different board games in 1 set.
Components: 2 spinners and wood pieces.

Game of Life's Mishaps:
The object of the game is to cross 48 "stations". Typical spin the indicator and move game. The first player who cross all route - wins the game.

name: Barking Bruno
description:
To Set Up:
1. Insert the holes inside the front feet into the tabs on the side of the Bone Bucket.
2. Carefully place the tab bars inside both front feet.
3. Lock Bruno into a sleeping position by pushing Bruno's head down and turning it slightly counterclockwise until it locks into place.
4. Place the bones into the Bone Bucket, mix them well, and slide the Power Switch to On.
5. Shuffle the Bone Cards and place them face down in front of Bruno.

To Play:
1. After deciding the order of play, the first player takes one card from the top of the pile and shows it to the other players. The Player then removes the number and color of bones from the Bone Bucket as indicated on the card.

2. After the player successfully removes the bones indicated on the card, the next player draws a card from the pile and so on.

3. Following the instructions on the card, the players take turns carefully removing the bones from the Bone Bucket.

4. Whenever a player disturbs the Bone Bucket and wakes Bruno, he will jump and bark at the player, disqualifying them from the game. After putting Bruno back to sleep (see Step 3 in the To Set Up section), the other players continue to remove bones in turn until only one player remains that player is the winner.

5. If players remove all the bones from the Bone Bucket without walking Bruno, the game ends in a tie.

6. If a player draws a blank card, that player may skip their turn without having to remove any bones. You can also use blank cards as replacements for cards that are lost or damaged.

Contents:
Barking Bruno Body
Bone Bucket Case
25 Cards
- 5 Blank Cards
- 4 Sets of 5 Cards (Each set contains 3 Single Bones, 1 Double Bone, 1 Triple Bone)
32 Bones
- 8 Red bones
- 8 Blue bones
- 8 White bones
- 8 Yellow bones

Requires three AA size batteries

name: Leben in Essen
description:
A simple game published about the German City of Essen.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Essen. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Fraction Fortress
description:
This educational game consists of:
- A game guide
- A spinner marked with the fractions 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/5, 1/6, 1/8 and 1/10, and 3 "wild" spaces
- 76 plastic Fraction Fortress blocks (four circular base blocks, six 1/2 blocks, six 1/3 blocks, twelve 1/4 blocks, ten 1/5 blocks, twelve 1/6 blocks, sixteen 1/8 blocks and ten 1/10 blocks)

Each player starts with a circular base block, which forms the base of their tower. Players take turns spinning the spinner and taking the corresponding fraction block. If the spinner points to one of the wild spaces (depicted by pictures of a knight's helmet or a princess), the player may choose any available fraction block.

Once a player has enough fraction blocks to make up a complete layer of the tower (i.e. the player has fraction blocks that add up to a value of exactly 1), the player adds that layer of blocks to their tower.

When there are no more fraction blocks to pick up, the player(s) with the most layers in their tower wins.

name: Wo versteckt sich das Gespenst?
description:
An educational game for developing memory and the powers of observation.
In the old days, children used to be told about the spooks, which were rather sweet creatures and really liked playing hide-and-seek. It is never easy to tell where a spook is hiding for it might be under the carpet… or behind the curtain… or somewhere else...

name: Rondje Groningen
description:
480 questions (96 cards) are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Groningen). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the card; on the back of each card you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Rondje Friesland
description:
480 questions are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Friesland). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the cart; on the back of each cart you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: ADD-TOO
description:
From the game's rules:

"ADD-TOO is a game where the player places his diamond next to a diamond already on the table.

There are 45 diamonds, each of which is colored orange and blue, with a number on each color anywhere from one to ten. Colors always must be matched, but numbers can either be matched or played to make scoring combinations.

The object is to play all diamonds from the hand as quickly as possible in either matching or scoring combinations. Players left with diamonds suffer penalties. Each player, therefore, tries (1) to play out all diamonds from his hand as quickly as possible and (2) to make as many scoring combinations as he can.

Hands are played until a game of 200 points, or some other predetermined count is reached."

name: Pijin
description:
Phonetic Scrabble meets Apples-to-Apples! Pijin iz a gam ov fonetik speleng & a disarmingly fun new experience of words for everyone!

Pijin is the world’s first spelling game of the spoken word. It's a hackable, expandable game that emphasizes the physical experience of communication. To play, you spell what you hear and only what you hear in pronunciation, and you spell with phonemes. "Pigeon" is spelled /pijin/, "words" becomes /wurdz/, "spelling" is /speleng/, and so on. Familiar terms sometimes look completely strange, but that's part of the fun as players explore and tinker with language itself.

There is no board used. Each phoneme tile is worth one point. The player with the most points wins. In Pijin Grid the object is to create a crossword-style matrix of intersecting words, one point for each tile in every word created by tile placement. In Pijin Sprint players may choose to create either a list or an intersecting grid of 10 words that respond to a prompt, Action Card. The grid may take longer but offers more scoring possibilities. Pijin ships with one set of 52 Action Cards as the game's first "module," but more modules of different themes are planned for release.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Spelling

name: Legends of the Wulin Board-Game
description:
Legends of the Wulin is a board-game of Wuxia adventure and drama set in the genre-loyal universe of Ancient China for 2-6 players.

In this game players take on the role of Wuxia heroes – men and women who pursue their virtuous goals through the perfection of their martial abilities. Players complete quests in support of their individual (and secret) goals, fight bandits, rebels, cults, and other Wuxia heroes while developing their Kungfu abilities and cultivating their “Qi”. The story which the players create within the game is different every game, as their secret agenda is always different. The story plot – as told by the mission the players struggle to complete – follows story elements from popular wuxia movies and novels.

Xiake – noble fighters of the martial arts community – live to embody their personal virtues. They express these virtues in their main goals: defeat the tyrant emperor… or support the law against the rebels; defeat the heterodox sects… or support the traditional leaders of the Wulin; become the Wulin Mengzhu – recognized leader of the martial arts community… or burn down the community in revenge. Each of these goals is a secret which the player keeps until the final battle, where the player will fight against his main rival.

Legends of the Wulin is both a strategic and tactical game. On a strategic level, players compete to finish quests faster than the competition, thereby gaining access to better fighting abilities. Tactically, the combat system of LOTW incorporates a short battle card game, in which players play individual Kungfu “stances” against each other to get the upper hand within a three-round battle.

Legends of The Wulin typically takes 2-3 hours to play. A large-ish table is required because the board, cards, and charactersheets take up a lot of space. The rules are not particularly complex and is easy to pick-up. Mastering the game requires keen strategic thinking as well as experience learning the different Kungfu stances and abilities. However, this is an adventure game, and players are encouraged to “role-play” their character’s adventure.

name: Footsy
description:
Footsy

The Promiscuity Parlour Game
A game of deduction, risk, and flirting

Welcome to the dinner party. Promiscuity is the aim here, but discretion is key; it would be thoroughly improper to be open about your conquests after all.

You know who you want to go home with… only one thing for it, you'll have to play Footsy with them. But how can you be sure you're flirting with the right person?

At the start of the night you’ll decide on your conquest. Throughout the meal you’ll test the feet under the table to try and find your paramour. Once you think you have them, it’s time to make your intentions known... It’s time to play Footsy.


Footsy is a deductive reasoning game in which players hold secret identifies and also target identity cards. In each round, or Night, they must attempt to locate their target character, their Paramour.

If a player identifies their Paramour they win the Night, if they’re wrong they are ejected from the party for the Night; they're out of the round.

The first player to hook up over a set number of Nights wins.

name: Cosmos Trivia
description:
Cosmos Trivia is a trivia game with 1380 easy and difficult questions. It contains 6 categories of questions: Culture, History, Sports, Sightseeings, Geography and General questions. Questions are applied to all the world's history, geography, etc.

It includes the following question types: multiple choice, enigma, rebus, tongue twisters and visual questions.

The game play includes moving around the board using a dice after each correctly answered question. At certain regions when a player or a team answers a question correctly, he aqcuires knowledge certificate for the corresponding categoty. The first player or team that collects all knowledge certificates wins the game.

Published ca. 2002-2005.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: 20ος αιώνας (Quiz Hunt: 20th Century)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole wold focusing on the 20th century.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Hvem i all verden?
description:
Can you get the team to guess who the celebrity is - without saying the name?

Hvem i all verden? (Who on Earth?) is based on celebrities.

Game mechanics are as simple as it is fun:
The game spans three rounds, and each round you will give your teammate tips about which celebrities are on the cards. In the first round there is no restriction on the number of hints. In the second round, the same celebs guessed again, but now players must navigate using only a single keyword. In the third and final round, the hints muest be wordless, like miming or humming.

name: Seven Sleepers
description:
Seven Sleepers can be by played on an ordinary 8x8 square checkerboard, though in its original edition the board had starting positions for its pieces marked on the board. There are 8 blue pieces for one player, 8 red pieces for the other player, and 7 yellow neutral pieces.

The game starts with each player's pieces on the row of 8 squares on opposite sides of the board. The yellow neutral pieces are on the 7 junctions or intersections between squares in the middle of the board. Players take turns moving one of their pieces at a time, diagonally to an adjacent space, or jumping an opponent's piece to an opposite vacant space. Opponents' pieces are not captured or removed from the board.

Players may also move a piece vertically or horizontally, but only to jump an opponent's piece, landing on a vacant space on the other side. Because of these rules of movement, pieces will be bound to the color of square on which they began play.

The neutral pieces can be captured (removed from the board) by either player making a single diagonal move over the junction on which the neutral piece rests. Also, once a piece crosses the center line, it may not cross back to that half of the board. The player who first moves all of his pieces to his opponent's starting positions and has captured the majority of neutral pieces wins the game. Any other outcome is a draw.

name: Yin Yang
description:
This is a card game.

Cards are covered with 8 yin-yangs which can be red or black.

The winner is the last player with cards in his hand.

Each player in turn tries to lay a card on the cards already laid out. The correspondence of yin-yangs between the card played and the card it covers defines if the move is possible and how many points are obtained.

Basically, each symbol of a colour must be laid out on a symbol of the other colour. A player gets 8 points if his card completely covers the previous one or 4 points if it only covers half.
For each point marked, the player can take a new card from the remaining stack. A player without any card left is excluded.

name: Master Golf
description:
The game simulates a round of golf on a nine hole playing board.

Players each have a set of seven clubs, each of which has a number. A player choses a club and then rolls three d6 and then moves the number of spaces equal to the dice total minus the club number. There are special rules for teeing off, pitching on and putting and also for hazards such as bunkers, water, rough/trees and out of bounds. There is also a pack of hazard cards which are drawn and acted on in certain circumstances.

name: Split Suit Playing Cards
description:
Split Suit Playing Cards add 4 suits to a normal deck of cards. Each card has two suits to add another level to popular games. One suit on the top of the card (a traditional suit) and one suit on the bottom (the additional suit). All the suits are either red or black.

The cards have the traditional suits (Spades, Hearts, Clubs, and Diamonds) and the traditional values (2 - 10, Jack, Queen, King, Ace) and 2 Jokers. The additional suits are Cups, Crests, Swords, and Wheels. Those new suits are distributed over the traditional suits, so not all hearts are swords, and not all clubs are crests, etc.

The Red suits are: Hearts, Diamonds, Swords, and Cups.

The Black suits are: Spades, Clubs, Crests, and Wheels.

A new game was created called "Follow Suit 42" and rules for existing games, like Poker and Spades, have been adapted to the new features of the deck. The rules for "Follow Suit 42" and the changes to Poker are included with the deck, and are also available online.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Game System
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Sawbones: A Card Game of Misguided Medicine
description:
The history of medicine is gruesome, painful and sad, but as Steve Allen taught us “Tragedy plus time equals comedy.” So I guess what we’re saying is that using a red hot poker to scorch your hemorrhoids is a pretty hilarious concept once we have 700 years distance.

In Sawbones, inspired by the amazing medical history podcast from MaximumFun.org, you are bumbling “Doctors” trying to save a dying patient. Since your knowledge of medice is often limited to “Put Leeches all Over Her” or “Transplant These Goat Testicles Into Him” your Patient is unlikely to survive. Lucky for you you have other Doctors to share the Blame with.

Pick the least worst medical practice you can and try and shift the blame to your fellow physicians. Be quick though as only the Doctor with the least Blame will win when the Patient croaks.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Horror, Humor, Medical, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Glory & Riches
description:
Glory & Riches is a strategic game of resource management and area control for 2-5 players. Each person is a fief lord vying for the kingdom's throne. To gain the throne, a player needs to control three fief Capital cities.

During the game, you produce resources, construct buildings, train peasants into advanced units, and expand your territory. The interesting part of the game involves dueling expansion mechanisms. Players pursue economic expansion and/or military conquest on their path to the throne, which means that you can either bribe the loyalty of neighboring cities or trample them under the boots of your armies. The game typically takes 30 minutes per player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Kung Fu Fighting (Second Edition)
description:
Kung Fu Fighting is a card game that simulates an all-out brawl between 2-6 kung fu masters! Players are dealt a hand of cards, which include attacks, attack enhancements, weapons, blocks, chi restoration (healing) and fighting stances. They take turns playing cards from their hands to attack other players with stylish moves like the dreaded "Running up the Wall-Spinning-Flipping-Kick". A defending player can answer back with a block card, or counter attack with certain powerful cards. If an attack gets through, the defender loses chi (health). When a player runs out of chi, he is knocked out, and the battle continues until only one Kung Fu master — the True Master — remains standing.

This edition of Kung Fu Fighting combines elements of the original Kung Fu Fighting (2004) and its expansion More Kung Fu Fighting (2008) with new game mechanisms.

name: Sanasankari
description:
A word game where the players try to come up with words from a given category before the time runs out.

First, four random letter tiles are chosen and turned face-up (eg. S, K, W, N). Then, a category card is drawn from the deck and a die is thrown to determine the category (eg. "at the playground"). Players now turn the hourglass and write down all the words they can come up with that contain the chosen letters and match the category (eg. "sand", "swing", etc). When the time runs out, they score one point for each chosen letter they managed to use in their words; for example, "swing" would give 3 points for using S, W and N.

Contents: 29 letter tiles, 50 category cards, hourglass, pyramid-shaped die, scoring sheets, rule book.

Part of the Oppi&Ilo playful learning series by Sanoma Pro Oy.

name: Flucht vor Fürst Finster
description: Dice driven game for very young kids. The game "board" consists of five meadow tiles which are placed in a circle. On each of the tiles, there is one character: A dragon, a knight, a king, a princess and a horse. The active player rolls a die. If the result is a number, the player moves any character forward by that number of tiles. If it shows the dragon, s/he moves the dragon by one tile. If the dragon ever reaches the princess, the two of them move together from now on. If the black hat is rolled, a card is flipped over: It shows the character that has to move one tile forward. The six cards form a puzzle of the evil count. If the players manage to get all characters onto the same tile before the puzzle is complete, they win; if not, they all lose.

name: Путешествие в космос
description: Путешествие в космос (Russian for: Trip to Space). Soviet era board game with simple mechanics and two dice rolled simultaneously. Aimed at familiarizing children with the Solar System (and integer multiplication). The front of the board depicts planets and moons of the Solar System proper and the playing field. On the back of the board are depictions of Soviet space probes and satellites. The goal of the game is to visit the moon of Pluto and return back to Earth.

name: Mars Needs Mechanics: Prototype
description:
Prototype is a new Mechanism Card for the Mars Needs Mechanics game. Just add it into the Mechanism Card deck at the beginning of the game. This card costs two Scrap and provides the following ability:

"At the end of a round after prices change, you may break this mechanism down and sell both scrap. If you do, sell one for the value of the highest valued component, and the the other for the value of the lowest valued component."

Note: This card was included in the Unpub 4 Promo Card Pack.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Das Osnabrück-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Osnabrück", in the Northwest of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Elemental Clash HEX
description:
Elemental Clash HEX gives you the "classic" Elemental Clash CCG experience - gone HEX!

Elemental Clash HEX is a hex-tile-based, fully customizable fantasy game for 2 - 4 players.

The goal of the game is to run your opponent out of tiles in their magical bag of hex tiles (this serves as the equivalent of a deck in a regular, card based CCG) before they can do so to you. For each damage a player takes, that player discards a random hex from their magical bag. If a player is required to draw a hex from the bag and cannot do so, they lose immediately.

While emulating many key mechanics of the original Elemental Clash Customizable Card Game, such as deck depletion as the win condition and the beloved-by-many "Boon" mechanic, Elemental Clash HEX is a whole new experience and twist on the original game, as many mechanics are new, fresh and unique, taking advantage of what the medium hex-tiles can offer.

Furthermore, the game features stunning artwork by a talented cast of international artists, elevating the game on state-of-the-art level when it comes to visuals as well.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Enclosure, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Fädelspiel: Im Zoo
description:
Who will be the first to get their 2 threaded animal beads to Zookeeper George first? Players roll the d6 to see which action they may take.

A threading game for toddlers over 18 months old. In addition to being a game for 2-4 players it can also be used for free play threading bead practice.

Contents: 1 zookeeper George, 2 zebras, 2 lions, 2 hippos, 2 elephants, 1 block with 4 laces, 1 game board, 1 d6, instructions.

Part of the Meine erste Spielwelt series.

name: Dinosauri da Record
description:
A card game to learn about the most interesting and mysterious animals ever appeared on Earth: dinosaurs. The game will teach you names, height, length, weight of these wonderful prehistoric creatures.

The game includes 6 different types of play, all based on guessing which dinosaur among a group of cards is "the most" in a selected category of the four included in each card (Height, Length, Weight, Year of discovery).
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Bedlam
description: Players race to complete a drawing of a face, rolling a die to see which feature they get to add. A six must be thrown and the nose drawn to commence.
publishers: G. N. Raymond, Universal Publications Ltd

name: Lantau Fun
description:
Lantau Fun is based on the tourist attractions of Lantau Island in Hong Kong and gives players a sense of its geography and tourist attractions.

In the game, players are tourists who travel around the island and use the action and function cards in hand to collect "Lantau Fun" cards. The first player who collects the required number of sets of Lantau Fun cards – which are divided into "Local Delicacies", "Entertainment", and "Souvenirs" – wins.

name: Cads About Matrimony
description:
A card game that makes a mockery of one of civilization’s most sacred institutions.

CAD (noun)/ 'kad/: A witty charmer who behaves dishonorably and irresponsibly in matters of love.

In the spring of 2013, I was put in charge of games for my dear friend Nicky’s bachelorette party. Since I had no experience planning wedding party games, I went online to look for ideas, and found plenty of them that were extremely lame. I knew Nicky deserved better. I was playing a lot of Cards Against Humanity at the time, so was inspired to create a card game that honors the glorious institution that is matrimony, while also preparing my friend for the all frightening realities and ceremonial absurdity of humanity’s most fraught life-long commitment. The game I made for Nicky on my laptop and home printer was as hilarious, embarrassing, depraved, and satisfying as marriage itself. So I decided I should share it with everyone.

The game is simple to play: one person reads a question or fill-in-the-blank card aloud to a group of friends. Each player then gives an answer card that they think best responds. The reader picks the response they like best. The questions and clues are both a parody and a celebration of all our bizarre cultural hang-ups around weddings and marriage, and funny enough to make champagne squirt out your nose.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: A Clash of Catapults
description:
Players first tile together wall cards to create a fortification. Then players toss rock cards at the opposing walls, scoring any wall segments hit. A tossed rock card must be from at least 2 feet way, it most be from at least 1 foot in the air, it must flip over at least once in the air, and it must no land with the 'miss' side up. Players each toss six rocks, and then then player who destroyed the most wall segments wins.

From the Box:
Only one Baron can rule the realm. Will it be you? To master the land you must build a mighty fortress and once safe behind your walls, rain rocky death from the skies upon your rivals. Do you have what it takes to reign supreme?

Clash of Catapults pits 2-6 players against each other in a battle to build mighty fortifications then destroy them with catapult rocks in crazy card flipping action.

name: Lewd and Obscene
description:
The Dictionary is filled with words you may or may not have heard of. They are the words you used to look up on the internet or call each other when you were young. They are vulgar, sexual, positional, provocative, and just crazy. You will ask yourself, "do people actually do these things?" at least once every game.

But watch out, not every card in the Dictionary is Lewd and Obscene. Your creativity may get ahead of yourself. In that sense, you'll need to "get your mind out of the gutter."


Lewd and Obscene is an adult party game.

The game begins by picking a card from the Dictionary. The word is read aloud but the definition remains a mystery to everyone except the picker.

Players try their best to define the word. They write their made-up definition to the word on their "Definition Slip".

When all players are finished defining words, the slips are turned in, mixed up, and read aloud. After all definitions have been read, voting takes place.

When voting, tally points on the definition slip. If you convince a player to vote for your definition, you receive one (1) point. If you vote for the correct definition, you receive two (1) points. Once all the scores are collected, the next player picks a new card and starts all over.

Upon starting, you will all agree to a score to end on and once that has been reached, you will have your winner.

name: Contraband
description:
From the Instructions:
"The object of Contraband is for a player to become the wealthiest by purchasing 100 pound bundles of foreign and domestic grown plants, smuggling them into the United States or Canada, and selling them for fantastic amounts of cash."

Player collect bundles from Mexico, Hawaii, Colombia, and Jamaica, and then travel North where they must decide to sell in the USA, or Canada. Different bundles are worth different values, and prices are higher in Canada than the USA due to the additional time and risk it takes to travel there.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Covers Quarrel
description: Players represent a couple in bed fighting for control of the covers. Players each have a deck of 8 cards and a hand of 3. Players will reveal 1 card simultaneously, high card pulls the covers to their side of the bed. The winner is the player with the most covers in the morning.

name: Name the Advertisements
description: Eighteen cards bearing parts of advertisements from the 1950s. The eighteen pictures should be displayed about the room and the players write down the full name of the advertiser or product that each picture represents. The player who identifies the most with the greatest precision wins.

name: Saupreiß: Das bairische Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Bavarian-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Bavarian dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: S'het so lang s'het: Das Schweizer Weisheitenspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Swiss-German sayings out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Swiss-German dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: The Salem Curse
description:
A dark game of curses and lynching...

The Salem Curse is a hidden roles type game in which the players take on the roles of innocent villagers, law enforcement, and yes, even a witch. The Salem Curse offers a new spin on the classic "werewolf" style game with a unique mechanic that actually has the witch curse the other townsfolk right out in the open...while staying completely hidden in the crowd.

name: Fortune
description:
"Fortune. The Game of Trading and Speculation" is Pre-Monopoly game, which was published by Parker Brothers. Only 5000 of these games were created.
Parker Brothers wasn't about to put all its eggs in one basket though. They had Darrow file for a patent, but knowing the true history of Monopoly they decided to produce their own version of the game. Fortune was the result of this work. As few as 5,000 of these games were made in 1935 before patent 2,026,082 was granted giving Parker Brothers proprietary rights to Monopoly. The name Fortune was then added to Finance which became Finance and Fortune until Parker Brothers used the name Fortune for another game in 1958.

The main differences from Monopoly are: game board design, hotel color, and that the Property cards seem to be based on the streets of New York City.

name: Infect
description:
Infect is a 1-4 player turn based strategy board game where you play the role of an unnamed disease and try to destroy the world. The game features several play mode and levels of play to learn the game at a steadier pace. It features unique strategic elements not seen in other card/board games.

This game is a mostly card based game but not classified as a trading card game (Like Magic the Gathering) nor a deck building game (Like Dominion). It's a good, plain, draw a card, strategy card game and you have to adjust as the game goes on depending on what you draw.

The game is played in rounds where each player takes a turn. The turn order unfolds in 7 steps and you play with 5 stacks of cards: Symptoms, Resistances, Transmissions, Locations and Objectives . A basic turn is composed of these actions :


Get your turn's energy
Draw some cards
Play the cards in your hand
Attempt to kill
Attempt to infect the world
Complete objectives
Discard unwanted cards


To infect, you must first play cards from your hand that you draw on each turn. Laying down a location makes it possible to infect it, but you also need one or more symptom to make that happen. Getting some transmission vectors and resistances will help you along the way to reduce negative aspects or increase the infectivity of your disease. As the game proggresses, you will play objective cards and complete them to get victory points which will eventually make you win the game.

name: BrainBox: Ireland
description: The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time, Trivia

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition France
description:
This is a card set expansion to Trivial Pursuit containing 500 questions about France of the following categories:
Blue : geography, economy and society
Pink : culture and entertainment
Yellow : history and politics
Brown : letters and media
Green : art of living
Orange : sports and recreation
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Prattle
description:
From the game box description: "Prattle is defined as the uttering of child's talk or to talk much and idly. In this family game, the objective is to be the first to prattle off a sentence, the words of which begin with the letters shown by the dice."

Whoever finishes their sentence first gets a point for each word in their sentence. Whoever gets to 50 points first is the winner, and judged to be the biggest "Prattler".

Components:
- 10 letter-dice:
- C/D/H/N/R/T;
- B/E/J/O/S/U;
- C/E/I/O/R/T;
- C/E/G/M/P/S;
- C/E/G/M/R/S;
- B/E/K/P/S/V;
- A/F/L/P/W/Y;
- C/E/I/N/R/T;
- A/F/L/P/S/W;
- A/F/P/Q/S/S;
- 1 number dice (5/6/7/8/9/10);
- 1 dice shaker;
- 1 roll-mat (part of box) to roll dice on;
- Pad of paper sheets to write prattles on, and keep score

name: Dead Man's Bluff
description:
A microgame of tricks and treasure.

The goal is to find the map leading to buried treasure. And someone on this pirate ship has the map! To win, find that map and hold on to it, surviving the round - or be the last pirate alive with the lowest ranking card.

Rules:

• Each player is dealt two cards.

• Players can choose to use one or two cards against their opponents, discard and draw a new card, or bluff.

• A player can bluff as long as they have at least one card of the card type needed to perform an action in their
hand.

Example: Danielle has one “Barrel o’ Grog” card and one “Cannon” card in her hand. She decides that she wants to use the
special ability that requires two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. This special requires that every player with a “Barrel o’ Grog”
card must place the grog card face up in front of them. That card is out of play for the rest of the game. Those players now may only have one card in their hand.

• If a player does not believe that another player has the cards to do the action they just performed, they may call
the player’s bluff. If the first player was lying, they have to reveal the card that was the lie, and they discard their remaining card and draw a new one.

Example: John doesn’t believe Danielle has two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. He calls her bluff. As Danielle did not have
two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards, she places the “Cannon” card in front of her, as it was the lie - and that card is now
out of play. She then discards her “Barrel o’ Grog” and draws a new card. She is now down to having only one card in her hand.

• When the deck runs out of cards, the discard pile may be shuffled back in to form the draw pile.

• When there are no more cards to be drawn and no discard pile, the players that are still alive reveal their hands and what is stored in their “Smuggler's Chambers”. The player with the lowest numbered card wins.

Drop Box location for PnP rules are located here.
Drop Box location for high-quality PnP card art is located here.

This game won first place for the 24 hour contest - March 2014.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Grand Jeu de la Tour Eiffel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 101 (up and down the Eiffel Tower)
- moving by turns -
Roll the die and move forward; ending on a red marked space follow instructíons.

Note:
Game was published first in 1889 (inauguration); moderate changes (see images) within a reprint; mentioned artist: L. Robert

name: Explore The World
description:
Explore The World is a board game journey that takes players all around the man-made world vs. the natural world.

The goal is to be the first player to make a round trip back to his/her start square. Players advance around the board by correctly answering from the Question Cards or by following the directions on the Travel Cards.

The type of card used on a turn is determined by the flick of a spinner. Play continues clockwise around the table, with each player taking only one turn at a time.

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – E Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, World War II

name: Flug ins All
description: The players travel the Sol-System (between Earth, Luna, Venus and Mars) and try to accquire Property Cards with allow them to build space stations, rockets, landing crafts or atom reactors. The players have to pay a fee, if they land on a space that belongs to another player, even more it that player has already build something on this space or if the player has several properties on this planet. The last payer who has any money left or the player who has the most money after an agreed upon playing time, wins the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Scutarii
description:
From the introduction: "Scutarii is intended mainly for recreating historical warfare prior to the introduction of gunpowder firearms and cannons. The scale of the rules is designed for fighting the larger battles of antiquity, where armies would number 25,000 men or more, on an average sized table.

Missile and melee combat has been designed to reflect the fatigue and decline in fighting ability during the course of the battle. While it is possible to defeat an opposing force with missile fire it will take quite a while compared to engaging in melee. As troops take casualties, their morale will decline with one side usually routing from the field while the victor will usually only have a few losses.

As for battlefield tactics, one thing you will find is that using multiple lines and a reserve, though creating a narrower front, will have an advantage over an army arrayed in a single battle line with no reserve. Attacking with fresh troops against fatigued enemies will usually result in victory for the army with the fresh troops."

name: Erop of Eronder
description:
Erop of eronder is a cardgame for two players published by Plantyn. Aim of the game is to build the highest tower, using different cards. The game is developed as an educational game and has three versions in its rules. Version 1; 5-6 years, Version 2; 7-10 years and version 3; 10+ years.
The rules are in Dutch.

name: Chaos Ninjas
description:
Chaos Ninjas is a light card game that combines both strategy and take-that elements.
In Chaos Ninjas you play the role of a Warlord who is hiring Ninjas.
You are trying to be the first player to have six unique Defender Ninjas in front of your play area.
On your turn you only perform one action, either take a card or play a card.
Very easy to learn and easy to play.

name: Sargasso
description:
User summary:

A space-ship themed cooperative game. Players are crew on a derelict spaceship that has wandered in in a dangerous space zone. Game is played on the board that represent the space ship, with various stations such as the bridge, engine room, resting room and so on. On their turn, players roll a die to see what threat happens (ship breaks down, asteroids or space slime attacks), then may do one movement and one action; action depending on what station the player is – an action in the sensor room will increase the sensor system, an action on the bridge will navigate the ship.

All character have different stats in various actions, repairing, and endurance points, that may be used to strain the character for extra actions.

The goal of the game is to increase the sensor system enough so that the players manage to navigate out of the dangerous zone. Game is lost if any player dies, if the spaceship collides with an asteroid or if too many space jellyfish cling to the hull.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tschu-Tschu-Tschu... Die Eisenbahn
description:
Tschu-tschu-tschu...the railroad is a game with a colour die. It contains 5 wooden tiles depicting locomotives, 15 tiles depicting railroad passenger wagons and 4 smaller tiles depicting conductors. And then there is the 6-sided colour die.

From the publishers description on the back side of the game box: Tschu-tschu-tschu... the railroad is a colour die game made from wood. When the locomotive is steaming and ready the train be quite quick. Two or more build a common train or build their own one. Made from wood, so childrens hands can have a strong grip too. The game: From the wooden tiles coloured trains are built. The die sets the colour so everyone has a chance in this fast-paced tile laying game made out of wood.

The rulebook suggests two games: In one game one locomotive is put in the middle of the table. The wagons are shuffled and dealt to the players. The players take turns rolling the die and then adding to the locomotive if they have rolled the appropriate colour or black which is a joker in this game. The first player getting rid of all his/her wagon tiles is the rounds winner and gets a conductor tile. After 4 rounds the game ends, the player with the most conductors wins.

In a second variant each player gets a locomotive and the wagon tiles are put in the middle of the table. Then there must be an agreement which train will be the winning one: The longest one, the most colourful on or one in a single colour. Players take turns rolling the die and taking a wagon of the rolled colour. The rulebook is unclear if taking a wagon is optional or compulsory in this variant.

name: Big Bucks Football
description:
It's all about the big bucks with Big Buck's Football!

It’s time for your favorite team to play—all your friends are over and ready to watch—everyone has their predictions—it’s time to put your money where your mouth is—see who knows the game of football best. To win, correctly predict which play is going to be next. Each play is another chance to show your football knowledge and win BIG BUCKS!

Any American Football game will do. Game play is based on the actions of the teams and the results of each play and/or drive.

The player with the most Big Bucks at the end of the game, wins.

name: The Game of Legends
description: The Game of Legends is a unique RPG with an important financial part. Gametime is flexible and depends on which one of the possible three endings the players choose. Regain the occupied land from the Dragon, improve your character, fight monsters, attack other players, invest and make good deals. And be the first to be strong enough to attack the Dragon and rule the land! Beautifully drawn characters and awesome graphics provide the base for the unique experience.

name: Monopoly: World Dredging Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from IHC Merwede, a (maritime) dredging company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cults of Arkham
description:
In Cults of Arkham you control a gang of deranged cultists trying to summon their Lovecraftian god of choice and thus end the world.
You use action dice to visit different places in Arkham, activate location abilities, and initiate fights with the other players. Your aim is to fulfil sinister plots, defeat the feared investigators, and/or control key locations in order to gain Victory Points. The first player to reach 12 Victory Points wins the game and gets to end the world his way.

The core of the game is the custom action dice you use to move your cultists and to do stuff in Arkham; learn spells, corrupt the citizens, and more. And the farther you get into the game, and the madder your cultists get, the less chance you have of the dice actually showing the results you need. Madness may be a stepping stone, but it’s also an obstacle you somehow have to manage if you want to be the best cult in Arkham.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Investo
description:
From the rules:
Investo is a game of High Finance for three or more players. Play consists of investing In various companies, and receiving from the "INVESTO" Bank, Dividends and Bonuses in accordance with Instructions on a number of cards drawn by the players in rotation. Companies become bankrupt by the drawing of one of the Bankrupt cards.

TO BEGIN. One of the players is selected as Banker, and issues each of the players with £1,000 with which to make his or her investments; retaining the balance of the money as the "INVESTO" Bank. (The Banker is entitled to join in the game, and should also receive the initial £1,000.) The cards are then shuffled and placed face downwards in the centre of the table. The cards representing the ten companies are shuffled separately and placed face downwards beside the Banker, who is at all times in charge of the game. A number of company cards are then turned face upwards, in front of the Banker; the number so faced being one less than the number of players. (e.g. If five people are playing, then four company cards are turned up.) Players now invest in one or more of the companies as desired. All investments must be in multiples of £100. The Banker keeps a record of all investments.
THE PLAY. The first player (determined by any method desired) then draws the top card and places it face up in front of him. Each card has a number of the top representing one of the companies. If the player drawing the card has invested in that company, he announces the dividend (e.g. No. 4 —30% or 6/- in the £). The Banker thereupon pays ALL players who have invested in No. 4 company, 30% of their investment, from the money in the Bank. Should the player not have invested in the company whose card is drawn, the play passes to the person next on his left, and so on round the table; each player announcing the dividend or bonus to be paid. ONLY If he has money invested in the company.

BANKRUPTCY. On a player drawing a "BANKRUPT" card for the company in which he has invested, he announces "No. 7 —Bankrupt", and then reads the directions as to payment to or from the Bank (e.g. "Shareholders must pay in 10/- for every £ invested, to meet the liabilities of the Company.") or "Shareholders receive 5/- for every £ invested in the Company, from the sale of assets," as the case may be. The Banker then collects the money from, or pays the money to, the shareholders in accordance with the instructions. After all the players have paid or received their money, the Banker removes the bankrupt company from play and exposes the next company card. Any player who had invested in the company that was just bankrupt now has the opportunity to invest in the new company. There is no compulsion, and a player who has money invested in another company may elect not to invest in the new company. On oil investments being completed and recorded by the Banker, play continues with the next player.

CHANGE OF INVESTMENT. Changes in investments can only be made when all the cards have been drown. All changes must be recorded by the banker who makes a charge of 10% on the total investment for the issue of the new "Script". (e.g. a player increases his investment as one of the companies from £200 to £500. The Banker charges £50.).
GENERAL. After all the cards have been drawn, they are re-shuffled, placed face down, and commeacing with the player on the left of the person who drew the last card, play re-commences. When a company is bankrupt and there are no more companies to be exposed, the players who had invested in the last company to go bankrupt may choose any ONE of the remaining companies in which to invest. The game is cancluded when the last company is bankrupt. The winner is the player who finishes the game with the most money.

name: Hensslers Küchenrallye
description:
Do you know your way around restaurants and kitchens as well as Steffen Henssler? Right out of the starting blocks, you'll need to hunt for the right ingredients? What should you drink when you order a Pharisee? What color is a Weißherbst? What does "thickening" mean? Answer these and other questions correctly, and you'll win the ingredients that you need for his recipe.

The quick quiz game Hensslers Küchenrallye, which can be played individually or in teams, was developed in close co-operation with Steffen Henssler, and the cooking fan will discover special tips from the celebrity chef as well as original recipes.

name: D24 Wrestling Starter Set
description:
D24 Wrestling can be played with one to four players. It combines the elements of dice rolling (with a D24 die!) action, strategy, role play and simulation into one awesome package, with matches taking place in real-time!

D24 Wrestling features faces (good guys), heels (bad guys), combining for a total of 20 unique playing cards. Each card has a full color illustration on the front, and game play stats on the back. We have main event stars (like Superbandit, Goliath, all the way down to low carders like Tadpole). The unpredictability of the D24 die adds to the "anything can happen" feel of the game!

There are two versions of the game: basic and advanced. A "basic" match begins when two players roll the d24 to see which wrestler will start on offense. The player that gained control will then roll on his wrestler's offensive set (each wrestler has 24 moves, including their finisher(s)! For the offensive wrestler to stay in control, he must roll successfully vs. the skill rating (power, speed, technical, brawling, aerial and striking). The offensive wrestler loses control when he does not roll successfully vs. his skill rating; then the opponent takes over on offense (just like a real match!). When a wrestler hits their finisher, the opponent must roll their 3-Count or Submission Rating, plus the opponent's finisher rating, to see if he is defeated. If the opponent rolls their 3-Count Rating or below, the match is over and the opponent wins (there are also other random ways to win, such as pin scenarios on the "Into the Ropes Action Chart").

The advanced game turns up the heat with more strategy options and player input. The advanced game allows a wrestler to attempt pins up to three times during the course of a match. Strength of moves is taken into account (some moves are more damaging than others). Maximum Damage Points from close pins/submission attempts, and finishers indicate how hurt a wrestler is, including blood! The advanced game also allows for wrestlers to use steel chairs and other foreign objects...but be careful, a disqualification may result! Other options found in the advanced version: exiting the ring, suicida moves, finisher counters, submission wrestling--you have four turns to get out of a basic submission move, and three for a submission finisher--or you tap out!

The game comes complete with a storyline that also allows you to take on the role of owner/booker/promoter and run your own version of WOX! Crown champions, develop feuds, determine rankings, create TV and house shows that culminate in pay per views! Schedule tournament and play nights or focus on the storyline element of the game...you're in charge!

name: Shaq Attaq Pocket Shot
description:
Nice action game and beautifully designed. It is intended to be portable and the over-sized box houses a neat container. When you open the container you can see the mechanisms. You can stand them up and you have a basketball game, with the net at one end and the ball launcher at the other.

Players can agree a pre-set number of attempts at 'baskets', the winner being the one with the most at the end.

Game linked to Shaquille O'Neal and his picture is on the box.

name: Ice Cube Curling
description:
From back of the box:

Tabletop fun for all ages! This curling game uses real ice - not as the playing surface, but as the curling stones themselves! The set includes a 6 well ice cube tray with which to make your curling stones, 6 curling stone handles, 2 brushes and a 1.5 metre curling lane.

name: Bull Run 1861/1862
description:
Game covers two battle of the american civil war. First one, fought on July 21, 1861 was also first major battle of this war as well. Second, fought August 28–30, 1862, was the culmination of an offensive campaign waged by Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia against Union Maj. Gen. John Pope's Army of Virginia.

Game was published in the 35 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine. It uses "Napoleon" game system.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: The Peides Curse: Earth
description:
The Peides Curse: Earth is a strategic and tactical game in which players take on the role of heroes who are embarking on an audacious and dangerous rescue mission. They face the uncertainty of time travel that bring them to the future year of 2223 where they will join the Spirit and fight a tough battle to stop the power of Evil. In order to accomplish the objective of their mission, the players shall participate in the race of their lives to find 9 secret codes that will stop Evil from wielding its power and destroying Earth.

Each player is required to put into motion his or her most strategic plan and creative cunningness to plot successfully and beat the other players to be the first to find all the secret codes. The game uses two different decks of power card play / power travel to help the players navigate to their designated mission destination. In this phase, players must cleverly maneuver their moves to put into motion their plans and strategy. The game play takes on an infusion of race and prior planning. High levels of strategy deployment or plotting, combined with tactical maneuvers, is required.

In the quest to ﬁnd the secret codes, the players are required to follow the clues which will lead them to where they are hidden. They then need to decipher the code with the decoder dices. Successful attempts shall be rewarded with energy points and battle ﬂags. They are both critical game changing components that will propel the players to lead in the game.

The last phase of the race shall see them being pitted in the battle between the Spirit and Evil. Here, the players will be able to deploy actions or movements that will keep them safe. The battle card may also be a game killer if it is played correctly. The players need to be extra cautious at this stage because they may well fall prey to 3 ‘surprise’ cards in the stack. This can cause them to deplete their Vourton power and lose a turn when they meet face to face with Evil. However, all is not lost. There are saviour cards that will restore the players’ power immediately without losing a turn.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Tonnage War Solitaire
description: Tonnage War Solitaire is a solitaire game simulating the great North Atlantic convoy battles of 1942-43. The player controls the anti-submarine escorts protecting a convoy of Allied merchantmen, while the German U-boats attacking the convoy are portrayed through the mechanics of the game system.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Unheroic Samurai
description: These are rules for playing a wargame with toy soldiers. It is intended for several players - say 4 or more. Players control significant leaders – the key samurai of a clan, who in turn have contingents of fighters under them. These brave samurai find themselves opposed by hordes of undead horrors – the Oyoma.

name: Coal, and the Kaiser
description:
Coal, and the Kaiser is a naval warfare simulation portraying naval surface warfare in the period 1904-1918. The simulation presents aspects of this warfare through a series of scenarios.

Scenario generators provided with the game can be used to create scenarios typical for the time and place that the game covers.

The game presents these battles on a tactical, ship-to-ship level. The game is for two sides: each controlling the ships of a contending naval force. Ships are represented by 1/6000 scale miniatures, with any 4 foot by 6 foot level surface serving as a playing area. Movement and combat are conducted in accordance with these rules of play.

name: Firepower Naval wargaming Rules: Naval Gaming with Rules and Model Ships for the Period 1900 to 1945
description:
Naval gaming with rules and model ships for the period 1900 to 1945 These rules can be used for any of the popular scales, though most players will prefer the smaller scales for space and cost reasons. For
the purpose of this game, scales are divided into two classes; 1/700th and smaller (sub-1/700th). The most popular small scale is 1/3000th. At the end of the rules there is a special section for players (including myself) who prefer the 1/700th - the real scale.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Street Dice, Racing For Pinks
description:
Street Dice is a 2 - 4 Player game. Players all start with a car and use the dice to race each other. If you lose your car in a Race you must Borrow, Earn, or Steal another.

Setting the Qualifying Combo: On the player’s turn they are automatically in the dig(the race). Player 1 rolls their 3 qualifying dice to set the combo for the others to get into the race. After the combo is set, player 1 says, “On your mark, get set, go!”

Qualifying: The other players roll their 3 qualifying dice as quickly as they can to qualify for the dig. Once someone rolls the right combo they yell out that they have it. If there is a tie Player 1 re-rolls another combo and the tied parties re-roll.

Only 2 players race in a dig. Once the qualifying is done the 2 players each draw a Start Stage Card ad place it face down in front of them. They also get the 9 start stage dice (Red, Yellow, & Green) and place them in front of them.

To win the game a player must hold 4 cars in their garage at the same time. After you have 4 cars you are the Street Dice Champion.

name: Weimar-Spiel
description: Trivia and travel game about the classic literature, art and music of the Unesco world heritage city of Weimar in Thüringen/Germany. Players start a tour through Weimar, leading to their destination, the Wittumspalais, where Duchess Anna Amalia held her weekly "Round Table" with writers, musicians and artists.

name: Oldtimer-Rennen
