description: This is a car racing game. The start of the cars is determined by dice. Further movement happens according to speed markers (10, 20, 30 and 40 km/h)at the choice of the players. At higher speeds there is also a higher risk to get in an accident at the more dangerous spaces of the race track or through events on the obstacle cards. There are 22 obstacle cards and 8 luck cards wich are dealt to the players at the beginning of the race. The players can play the cards to hinder other players or to press their own advantage. The first player to complete 4 laps on the race track wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Great Knowledge Game of Ireland
description: Its object is to provide a simple entertaining and educational game whereby knowledge of Ireland, her people, history, geography, arts, culture, ancient traditions and pastimes, sports, politics and much more may me acquired or exercised.

name: Dania 1945
description:
Dania 1945 (Denmark 1945) focuses on a fictional operation, "Cauldron" - allied airborne attack on Denmark in April 1945.

The game is an expansion of Arnhem 1944 and uses counters from this game. It contains a map of Denmark and areas nearby.

It was included in Taktyka i Strategia.

name: Spiekeroog Das Inselspiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Spiekeroog, part of the East Frisian Islands in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Dementalism: Garden of Smellemental Glee
description:
Publisher Blurb:

You're in some serious trouble! Those clones you let escape from the Primordial Soup Kitchen a while back have made it all the way to the Garden of Smellemental Glee. You better nab them before things get out of hand. Or more out of hand, as the case may be, or, apparently, is. Oh, and watch out for hungry beasts and whatnot while you're out there. It'll take every modicum of brainularity you own to make it through this fast-paced and exciting expansion to the Dementalism card game, not to mention a shlode of luck and a few yorts of good old-fashioned courage. Also, an unspecified amount of gumption. May be played on its own or added to the Dementalism: An Ingenious Game of Ingenious Ingeniousness deck (MOC30001) and other Dementalism expansions. This 60 card expansion to the Dementalism game contains several new Denizens, Giggities (wild cards), and Turmoil Cards and introduces new Beast cards to the game.

name: Modern Lightning War
description:
Specifically for 1/300th scale.

The basic object of the game is for either opposing player to achieve a required number of victory points. This is achieved by capturing a number of defined objectives while simultaneously destroying enemy units. The ‘Initiating Player’ commences their game turn by selecting a particular command (usually a Company or Squadron) and then attempts to move and fire it in order to attain their game objective(s). The game turn is relinquished to the opposing player immediately the current ‘initiating player’s’ selected command fails a morale test. If the command passes a required morale test it continues to move and or fire until it either completes its current orders or fails a subsequent morale test. Command Morale tests are always carried out immediately a platoon is disabled. Once the currently selected command completes all the tasks the initiating player requires of it and it passes all required morale tests, the player may select another command to move and fight or they may relinquish the initiative to the opposing player.

Constructing a force
Both players begin the game with 6 command headquarters of any type within their selected country organisation. Once the types of commands are established, each player rolls 2D6 for each command and this represents the number of platoons or batteries contained in each
command. If larger forces are required, players keep adding blocks of command headquarters as required. Commands may not exceed their T&OE strengths.

name: Herman's Castle
description:
Herman's Castle is a game published as part of Chief Herman's Next Big Thing.

The board consists of an X-shaped grid representing the castle. Owners of the game supply their own colored stones (10 red, 10 blue, 10 yellow). On a player's turn he places a stone of any available color on any empty space in the castle. The player immediately scores points for placing stones of the same color next to each other.

The winner is the player with the most points.

name: Sjov Gennem Skandinavien
description:
Travel from Rødby Havn to Copenhagen via Denmark, Norway, Finland and Sweden.

The first to reach the goal in Copenhagen wins. But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards.

An exciting drive through all Scandinavia. Family also for the little ones.

name: Stay and See Georgia: It's a PEACH of a game
description:
Players move around a map of the state of Georgia leaning fun historical facts about the state while racing to visit eight locations first. The game contains a map of Georgia, 100 location cards, four small colored cars, 32 green chips and four peach tree cards (with eight peaches on each tree).

Players begin the game by choosing a car and taking 8 green chips and a peach tree card showing 8 peaches. The players then draw a card from the location deck and place their car at that place. That card is then placed at the bottom of the deck. The players then draw a new card, reading it aloud to all. This will be their first location that they will need to travel to.

Players roll a die and move their car, trying to reach the location on their card. When they do, they place a green chip on a peach on their tree, draw a new card and repeat journey on to the next location. The winner is the first person to reach eight locations, covering all their peaches with green chips.

(Information is from rules on the back of the game box.)

name: Trivial Pursuit: Famille
description:
Small limited edition of Trivial Pursuit sold with a french TV magazine

Categories:
blue: geography
pink: entertainment
yellow: history
purple: arts and literature
green: science and nature
orange: sports and recreation

name: Golf the Card Game
description:
Golf the Card Game (GTCG) is a fast paced, easy to learn, hard to master, rummy-style game. GTCG has all the elements of a timeless classic - strategy, game depth, a twist [Fore Card], second chance [Mulligan], player distraction and interaction. No golf knowledge or proper attire required on this course!

The Challenge - Be the golfer with the lowest score!!!

The Twist - The FORE cards & a Mulligan on the front & back nine.

The Strategy - Work your hand for pairs, three of a kind and maybe even 4 of a kind. Use the FORE Card, Mulligans and wilds wisely–completely changing everyone's game!
categories: Card Game, Memory, Print & Play, Sports

name: Pettersson und Findus: Eine Geburtstagstorte für die Katze
description:
A memory game with a rotating gameboard.

8 way tiles with 3 images each are stacked, players start at the bottom. 24 corresponding memory tiles are laid face down. Players move up by picking up a memory tile of a free space in the way tile above, and can pick again as long as they continue to move. When the bottom-most tile is free, it is moved up to the top. When a player is at the top way tile he/she must pick the cake memory tile, the first player to do that wins.

That the way tiles only have 3 spaces and a player on it blocks picking that memory tile, together with the rotating board, makes for a varying and interesting game.

name: Battle of the Sexes Toplist card game
description:
In the Battle of the Sexes Toplist card game, men and women compete to name items on gender-biased top ten lists. For example: women, can you name any of the top ten states that issue the most hunting licenses? Men, can you name the fittest cities in the United States?

Each player on the team gets one guess. Earn points if your guess is on the list. The higher up the list, the more points you earn. At the end of 10 rounds, the team with the most points wins.

name: Die Fit-Esser
description:
The players try to make their superhero fit for the next race. To do this they have to choose the right diet and make some sportive exercises.

This game tries to teach children how to eat healthy.

name: Saban's Power Rangers Super Samurai Samuraizer Switch Game
description:
From the back of the box:

It's a Power Ranger-filled adventure with Mighlok, Xandred, Zords and more. Move around the game board collecting the Kanji tokens that will help you in battle. When you land on a Gap Sensor space, get ready for action!

Lock your mover into the Samuraizer Morpher then press down on the reveal button. That will you what mode you have to be - Civilian, Ranger, or armed Ranger - to beat that particular Nighlok. Press the spin button and your mover changes. If your mode matches the Nighlok card, you win the battle.

The first player to collect three Nighlok cards - and complete the mega-battle with Xandred - wins!

name: Down The Drain
description: Be the first player to connect 4 or more Pipe Cards (5 or more in 2 player game) from the bathtub to the spout (with no clogs).

name: Ice Age Thrills & Spills Adventure Game
description: Join an unlikely group of friends on an exciting quest of ice age adventure. Race against the elements and each other to see who can return the baby Rodhan home first. pass the baby back and forth with other players while sliding on icy paths dodging lurking predators.

name: A Crowning Mercy: A Solitaire Game of the English Civil Wars (1642-1651)
description:
BACKGROUND: A CROWINING MERCY is semi-historical simulation of the English Civil War. The game begins just after King Charles I dissolved Parliament. The Player represents the Commander of the Parliament Forces with the goal to overthrow King Charles. As the Commander of the Parliament Forces, you must control a significant number of Cities and Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played.

GAME OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the Parliament Forces. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to control at least 16 Cities and 14 Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played. If the Royalist Army controls 16 Cities and 14 Towns at the end of their Turn, the Royalists win.

GAME FEATURES: Game includes many colorful, graphic Counters, a period flavored map, and Campaign Cards. Counters include Pike and Musket, Musketeers, Cavalry, Cuirassier, Cannons and Leaders. The Game is Card Driven where the Player draws a number of Campaign Cards that may be Forces, Actions or Events. The Player then takes his turn carrying out actions with his Leaders and Forces.

GAME MECHANICS: The Player moves his Leader Counters on the Map along with their Troop Points. If a Battle occurs, Troop Points are exchanged for Tactical Units and combat is carried out in a Tactical manner on a Battle Mat. If there are any Reserve Units in the "Play Area", he may add them to a Battle Force.
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: The Game of Who's That?
description:
"The fast and furious name-guessing game!"

Players divide into two teams, and decide on a time limit for rounds, which adjusts the difficulty.

Each card contains the names of a celebrity, a sportsperson and a historical character, and there is spinner with these on, plus three wilds.

One member of each team takes a card, spins the spinner, and sees who they must describe. They then have to describe that person to their team. If guessed correctly, they gain a point. If not, the card is discarded.

The first team to 15 points wins.

name: Woody Woodpecker's Great Newspaper Chase
description: Spin and move game where the object is collect all five sections of a newspaper before proceeding to the finish.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hütchen-Spiele
description:
A Trap the Cap adaption - 2 different games.

Instead of a die, this game uses a spinning top to reach results between 1 and 6. The game board has two sides. Side 1 is a standard "Trap the Cap" game with an altered game board. Side 2 uses different rules. Each space shows the first part of a mathematical expression, which is completed by the result of the spinning top. The amount of the whole expression is the number of spaces the cap can move forward. This game can be played like "Pachisi" or "Trap the Cap".

Game 1: Be the first catching all other caps/acting by turns
Board is entered on an 'A'-space. Players move their "caps" around the board according spinner. If a player lands on another cap or a stack of caps, that player captures the stack by nesting his/her cap on top of the stack. The game ends when there is only one active color of caps left on the board. Caps on spaces with an 'F' or matching color can't be caught. Ending on a 'F'-space all captured caps must be released.

Game 2: More like Pachisi (kicking out other ones), but additionally players must perform one of the 4 basic arithmetic operations (according spinner & space) moving their meeples.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grubleren
description:
Each player have a screen to hide away his side of the board; behind this screen he places his combination with the numbers 1-5 (Black numbers on White background).

The purpose is to guess the other players combintaion by placing number counters on an open row (Black numbers on Red/Yellow background).
If the player have any numbers correctly placed he will be informed of how many numbers are right.
Example:
Jack uses the combination 2-3-1-5-4
Joe guesses on 2-4-1-3-5
In this example Joe is correct about the location of 2 and 1 - so he have two numbers correct and will be informed by a marker that two numbers are correctly placed, but not which ones.

The winner is the one who first guesses the opponents combination. Depending on the round the player guesses the combination he will be awarded different amount of points using the scale 40-35-30-25-20-15-10-5.
If succeded in the 5th round he will get 20 points
After the 8th round it is called at tie and the game is restarted

name: Tutti al Mare
description:
"Where's my beach umbrella? That's my towel! Come on, give me my swimming trunk". What a mess! The items in the beach bag are all mixed up!

Tutti al Mare is a fast and funny card game for sea-loving players who must take the right items from a messy pile, picking the one that belongs to them. Players will pick and trade items with their "beach umbrella neighbors" in order to be the first to be ready for the first swim of the season.

Tutti al Mare is a fast and funny game for 2-6 slobby bathers.

name: Star Wars: Feel The Force – Hidden Powers Card Game
description:
Reveal the hidden powers of your cards.

A fast and furious game where risking HIDDEN POWERS can bring great rewards!

Object: To be the player with the most sets of cards or 'tricks' at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bankgammon
description: Monopoly type game. Unique three section game board fits together like puzzle pieces so that a standard sized board can fit in this small box without folding. Game comes with4 wooden game pieces, dice, Bankgammon money in 50's and 100's, banking slips, fortune cards, instructions and game board. Info on game comes from description on EBAY sale 9/25/14

name: Reds Are Better Dead: The First Bolshevik Offensive January 19, 1919
description: Reds Are Better Dead covers the Bolshevik attack on the of the Americans 200 miles from Archangel, Russia, during secret allied intervention in the Russian Civil War. The American 339th Regiment had been sent to North Russia to help the British and French advance down the Dvina and Vaga Rivers to threaten Moscow, where Lenin commanded.

name: Skitters
description:
2 – 5 players | 10 min | 5+

Object
Roll as many numbers in sequential order as you can to get the highest score.

Materials
10 six-sided dice
A board having numbers in sequential order from 1 to 10 and the number six highlighted.
50 tokens, 10 each in 5 different colors.

Setup
Each player takes 10 tokens in their chosen color and 2 dice.
The empty board is placed between the players.

Play
The youngest player calls out start.

At the start players simultaneously roll one die from their hand trying to roll the first number on the board.

The first player to roll a one calls out the number one, and places one of his color tokens on the number one spot on the board.

Then players continue to roll one die trying to be the first to get the second number in the sequence.

This calling out of numbers and placing a color token continue until a token is placed on the spot numbered six.

From this point on players roll both dice from their hand attempting to roll the remaining four numbers (7,8,9 and 10).

When the last token is placed on the spot numbered 10, the game ends.

Scoring
Add up all the spots on the board in each players color tokens, highest score wins.

name: Kri-Kra-Krabbelei
description:
Bug-eyed munching beetles, fluffy fuzzy caterpillars, and smooth grasshoppers scurry topsy-turvy because they still need to take the big leaves to the feast site before the creepy-crawly feast begins. Who wants to help these cute, crawly creatures?

In Kri-Kra-Krabbelei, the players have to find two matching creepy-crawlies under the leaves. If the players are successful, the crawly leaf trail moves forward toward the feast site and they receive a dewdrop as a reward. Whoever has a great sense of touch in their fingertips and a good memory will have collected the most dewdrops by the end of the game and be the winner.

name: Parkour
description:
A three-dimensional game of running, jumping and climbing to be the highest street gymnast once the city has finished building.

Players roll dice each turn, and select one number to choose their action, and the other two numbers to select a location in the city to act in. Actions can be placing blocks to build the city, knock down previous built sections, or to attempt a dangerous parkour move.

Movement of the players piece can climb up and down the city scape being built, with parkour moves allowing players to leap further upwards, moving diagonally across roof tops or the gravity defying wall run across open space..

Be the highest runner when the blocks run out!

name: Bingo Bandit
description:
From the box:
Bingo Bandit is a bingo game that "combines the luck of a one-armed bandit and bingo with clever strategy!"

User description:
The game features a large plastic bingo machine with a slot in the top for tokens which fall out through chutes at the bottom when the arm of the slot machine is pulled.

The object of the game is to make complete rows on your game card or complete rows on other players' cards in order to collect points. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Paper Toss
description:
Paper Toss is a fast, fun, new card game where players compete to deliver the most newspapers on their paper route.

Paper Toss can be played by 2 to 6 players in anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes (more players make longer games), and the rules are simple and easy to learn, suitable for ages 5 and up.

The comical art and theme, coupled with the silly, competitive nature of the game make it great for younger children and even the whole family.

Draw cards from the blue "Paper Deck," and take turns trying to toss your newspaper on a new doormat (by playing the "Paper Toss" card), as other players try to throw off your aim with hazards like angry dogs, sidewalk obstacles, and neighborhood kids. If you have the appropriate counter card, you can ignore the distraction.

A simple discard mechanic adds a subtle layer of strategy: choose which cards to hold or discard, keeping your defensive cards, or going on the offense. Wild cards like "Flat Tire!" and "Bully!" help you stick it to your opponent and gain an upper hand.

Once you throw your paper, turn over a card from the green "Toss Deck," to see how good your throw was. With every successful paper toss, you gain a Paper Token. The first player to collect 10 Tokens wins the game! Can you be the first one to toss all your papers?

name: Jippijaja Quiz: Mat & dryck
description: 550 Questions about Food and Drinks from champagne to comfort food, party game

name: Zeppelin Raider
description:
From the game cover:
"A World War One solitaire and 2-player game.
Fly against...or as...one of the MONSTERS OF THE AIR!"

This game is a promotional insert in World War One Illustrated, Number 1, a publication of the World War One Historical Association. It was produced by Lombardy Studios, then a part of 1A Games publishing.

The games uses a simple, rock-paper-scissors chit-draw mechanic to simulate a World War One aerial duel between a British BE2c fighter, and a Zeppelin raider that is bombing England. It can be played solitaire, where the player draws randomly for the German Zeppelin, or as a two-player game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Die verlassene Forschungsstation
description:
Your story - your rules!

Rumours of the mysterious research station "OMEGA" make their rounds within scientific circles. Secret experiments during the war are said to have unearthed discoveries beyond the wildest dreams of any scientist. But all of a sudden all contact to the station broke off. Nobody knows what became of the researchers or the station. Now, 20 years after the end of the war, hints to "OMEGA" surface again, while you try to look into it. What is behind all this? What secrets may "OMEGA" hold? And who will get to use them? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Die verlassene Forschungsstation (The abandonded Research Station) is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Who's Like Me?
description:
Who's Like Me? You may be surprised how much we all have in common.

In Who's Like Me?, children learn how to recognize emotions in their friends and see what they all have in common. This game develops skills like observation, memory, distinguishing and grouping multiple elements, and sharing emotions. Make matches and earn points. Score the most points and win the game!

name: Bubbles and Puddles
description:
For each game, the set up and game play is the same, but the game objectives are slightly different. In the Bubbles game, the last player to have at least one Bubbles Tile left in their section wins the game! In the Puddles game, the first player to remove all the Puddle Tiles from their section wins the game!

Roll the Die to move the Rubber Duck and discard the Tile where the Rubber Duck lands. Replace a Tile from the discard pile when you roll the Duck Symbol. To Win the Bubbles game be the last player with a Tile left in Play. To win the Puddles game be the first player to remove all your Tiles.

name: Ball's Chess
description:
Ball's Chess, also known as CU-BONO (Romanian for "Who benefits?"), is a chess-like game designed by Albert Edward Ball from Wrexham, Wales. He patented the game in 1933 and once again (with slightly altered rules) in 1969. It was described by the Czech game expert Miloš Zapletal in his book "Velká kniha deskových her" published in 1991. The game is played on a 10x10 square board with 10 flags, two missiles, two 4-jet planes, two field guns, two tanks and two generals per player. |In the 1933 patent, the flags were called "regiments", the missiles "airships", the 4-jet planes "aeroplanes" and the generals "commanders".

The object of the game is to conquer one of the opponent's "capitals", that is, one of the squares the opponent's generals started on. Today the patent specifications (GB19330001481 19330117 and GB19690023908 19690510) are freely available on the internet so that the exact rules can be studied there. The game has at least as much strategic depth and tactical choices as ordinary chess, but draws are much less frequent due to the specific architecture of the game's design.

name: Elf Dance
description:
Quest with us as we embark into an enchanted forest where the mighty Elf King grows tired of the Faeries in charge and requests a dance of leadership for his enjoyment. Listen in as Katie, Tim, and Matt take on the roles of Faery faction leaders and attempt to win the favor of the Elf King and thus secure a thousand year reign for our faction of elf.

Elf dance is a simple card game that will provide enjoyment for any age. If you are interested in helping this project get funded you can click the little faeries throughout this post! But hurry you only have four days left before the Elf King grows angry and banishes this game to the planet Thra!

Objective:
Elf Dance is a 2 to 3 player game. Each player has a Native Clan, determined before play begins. The player’s goal is to recruit as many Faeries and Goblins (Faery and Goblin cards) as possible to the player’s Native Clan,while thwarting the other players from recruiting Faery and Goblin cards to their own Native
Clans. The game itself is one of the players: its Native Clan is always the Goblin Clan, and the game itself may possibly come out the winner. Each player’s recruited Faery and Goblin cards are kept in a pile by the player’s side, and whoever has the most
of these recruited cards when the deck runs out wins the game (bonuses and penalties from equipped Enchantment Cards are also counted).

name: WordTov
description:
Build words and crush your opponent by flipping to your color (blue or red letter tiles) his or her letter tiles.
Aim: To get the largest number of tiles of your color on the board by forming words

name: Girl's Time
description:
Girl's Time is a 2-5 player bluffing game. The player that gets the most money will win the game.

In this game, there are two customers on the table and they need some goods such as shoes, clothes, etc. Each player has three cards and on their turn must choose one of three actions:

1. Play cards: You can play up to three cards, face-down, so you can bluff. If somebody think you are bluffing, they may call "check" and reveal all of your cards this turn. If they called your bluff correctly, you must pay them $100 per card, otherwise they pay you $100 per card.

2. Finish a sale: If you think most cards on a customer are correct, you can finish the set and sell them. If most cards are correct, you can earn lots of money. On the other hand, if most cards are incorrect, you have to pay money back to the customer.

3. Change your cards: pay $200, redraw five cards and keep three.

This game is very is to learn and play. In most case, if you want to play correct card, you have to trick the other players because they want to "check" you. If you want to play an incorrect card, you have to trick them to sell the product and lose lots of money. In this game, trickery is the most important thing.

name: The Mage Codex
description:
The Mage Codex is a cutthroat game of aggressive deck-building and fluid combat set in a fantasy universe. Your goal is to eliminate all other players by emptying their draw deck.

The objective of the game is to defeat your opponents by eliminating their draw decks.

There are two primary stages to the game: Gather and Battle.

During the gather stage, all players get a chance to draft the cards they want to use into their deck.

The battle stage is all about aggressive deck building, where all the card you want are either stolen from your enemy or you must sacrifice your own life to acquire them. You will take turns to draw cards (possibly from your opponents sources), then play cards to attack opponents, steal their cards, and protect your own decks.

Will you be the last mage standing?

name: Quiz Battle
description:
The five star general knowledge quiz war, Quiz Battle is a battle of brains for two players.

Each player has a book of trivia questions and answers. The box has a sliding drawer that looks like a battlefield and is used as a scorekeeping device.

Players take turns asking each other questions from their own team book. If the question is answered correctly, the person who answers can push the Score Drawer one "click" forward to advance his troops. If the answer is wrong then his army must retreat one "click" by pushing the drawer in the opposite direction.

The winner is the first to defeat his opponent by capturing the opponent's base camp and raising his flag (or the player whose forces are advanced the farthest when all skirmishes have been fought).

name: Tropem Dębowego Liścia
description: This 2-4 player game for players aged 10 and up has been created by request of the Nasze Kalety association. It aims at teaching the players about the community of Kalety and its interesting sights and trivia. The players have to find multi-coloured oak leaves and to collect them, they have to correctly answer questions about Kalety.

name: Tortoise and Hare
description: Will the tortoise beat the hares to the finish line? Players race their rabbit movers along a twisting, colored path. A wind-up turtle races along its own circular path, trying to beat the rabbits to the finish line. As the tortoise moves, a colored ball randomly appears on its back, indicating the current player's next move. The winner of the race is the first one who crosses the finish line, whether it is a player's hare or the wind-up tortoise.

name: Svinedrengen
description:
A roll-and-move game based on Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale of the "The Swineherd".

The game board have 50 spots, and have some special, white spots (6, 13, 18, 24, 31, 40 and 47) that have some spcial actions action.
Those spots, as well as spot 1 and 50 have connection to the fairytale.

First to #50 is the winner; You have to land exactly on #50 to win.

Game is possibly from the 1950s

name: Discipleship Plus Junior
description:
From the rules:
"Be the first person to give away your cards by matching the same color or shape on the discard pile. Get a Judas card and skip a turn. Get a Devil card and you have to draw another card. Get the Jesus card to help you or someone else win."

Discipleship Junior is a game similar to Uno or Crazy Eights, with a few differences. Each player's cards are kept face-down and are unknown to all players including the owner. They are turned face-up one per turn, and can be discarded if they match the top of the discard pile. Judas cards cause the drawing player to lose his turn. Devil cards "trap" a disciple card, and must be "cast out" by a card matching the trapped disciple. The Jesus card allows each player to discard all face-up cards.

name: Novela: il gioco della soap opera
description:
What horrible secret is Reginald, the most popular model in the world, hiding? Who will get the CEO position at Superglobal Inc., the most powerful company in the world? And, above all, will Miriam and Max be able to marry, overcoming the perfidious machinations plotted behind their backs?

Novela is the first board game allowing you to play as the protagonists of a soap opera or telenovela, and live their stories of fame, money, love and power. Every player must attain their three secret purposes... by all means! And every game is a true adventure: constant twists, alliances, betrayals and intrigues will fascinate any TV serials lover, while those who can't stand them will finally be able to take sweet revenge on Ridge, J.R. and the likes. In "Novela" the rules are very simple, and it is up to the players to decide how much to invest in their characters, possibly turning the game in the craziest, intriguing and fun role playing game.

Players roll dice to move around the board. Each space contains events or allows players to draw cards to achieve their objectives.
mechanics: Events, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: One, Two, Three... ZOMBIES !!!
description: Game now in new setting: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/183679/one-two-three-gol...

name: Chi
description:
Chi is a light card game that combines both strategy and take-that elements.

In Chi you play the role of a Zen Master trying to maximize your Yang Chi energy.

The game ends when one player has six unique Yang cards in front of their play area.

Players earn points by the total number of Points on each Yang Card they have in play, in addition they also earn 1 point for each remaining card in their hand.

The highest points wins. The player who caused the game to end may not necessarily be the winner.

On your turn you only perform one action, either take a card or play a card.

Very easy to learn and easy to play.

name: Parasite
description:
My God, they're everywhere!
Or are they? An alien parasite has infected crew members of the ISS Fluffy Pink Cloud. Seeking comfort in each other's company, the crew members try to fight off the treacherous invader. Will Bartholomew Broadside and his trusty crewmen be in time to halt this spreading disease?

The players are crew members of the ISS Fluffy Pink Cloud. An alien infection is spreading through the ship and some players may already be infected when the game starts. It is not clear, however, who is infected and who isn't. Each turn, each player visits another player in his/her quarters, to protect the fellow crew member from infection (or, alternatively, to infect him).

On board are engineers (who can perform a body scan), a doctor (who can surgically remove an alien and perform a blood transfusion) and the doctor's assistant. Each turn, the players vote on who is going to perform which action and on whom, to clear the infection. However, among the voting crew memebers are those that are already infected and who want to infect the entire crew. Other players each have a special ability they can use to spread or to stop the infection. The end of the game (which has as much turns as players) is either a victory for the aliens or the humans.
publishers: Cynyc Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Simon Swipe Card Game
description:
Simon Swipe the Card Game for when you feel like defeating your friends with cards instead of the game. Be the first player to get rid of your cards each round and have the lowest score at the end of the game.

The game is played in rounds. A round ends when one player has played all his cards. You then tally your points and the player to the left shuffles and deals a new hand.

Each player begins with 9 cards, the the top card of the draw deck is flipped over, if its a wild card keep flipping. This determines the first card of the pattern.

On your turn place a matching color, swipe or wild card on top of the first card.If you cannot play a card you must keep drawing till you do. Then place another card next to the first one, keep doing this until you run out of cards. You can start a pattern even if you can't finish it. If you finish it and have a card left over, add it to the pattern.

When one person runs out of cards, its time to tally points. Any cards left in your hand are equal to 1 point. when 1 person gets to 15 points then the game is over. If no one gets 15 points that hand, then shuffle the cards and play another hand. If there is a tie all tied players win.

name: Absolute Blast
description:
A rocket-launching math board game to boost understanding of integers, operations and absolute value for grades 6 through 8.

Absolute Blast is played with a custom deck of cards and a player board for each player. The deck is made up of positive and negative numbers in 3 different colors, modifiers, and action cards. The player boards each have 3 rockets which need to be launched. Each player has a hand of 5 cards, and players take turns playing cards onto any open space on any player board. The goal of the game is to have the sum of the absolute values of your rockets be greater than any other player.

Absolute Blast is available for free as a Print and Play game through The Institute of Play's website.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Seltsimees Puu Eestit vallutamas
description:
Humorous roll and move game about Mysterious Comrade Puu attacking Estonia.

Players start from Kuressaare town and must race to Narva. Whoever finishes first is the winner. There are also cards what add or substract the movements of players´s pawns in this game.

A crowd-funded ‘patriotic’ board game about reclaiming Estonia after a Russian invasion has become a hit in the Baltic state, feeding on popular fears about the geopolitical ambitions of the country’s eastern neighbor.

Named ‘Comrade Pu conquers Estonia’ – the monicker is a popular local nickname for Vladimir Putin – the board game features a recognizable caricature of the Russian president on the front of its box, though it does not mention him by name.

In a variant of Snakes and Ladders, the players have to ‘fight back’ from the Western border of the state, which became independent from the Soviet Union in 1991, with the help of dice. Instead of ladders, players pull out cards that may help or hinder their progress. “Pu wins the Nobel Peace Prize” sets the player one step back, while “Kazakhstan is prevented from joining Russia’s side” lets them get one ahead.

“The idea of the game was born during the events of last spring in Ukraine,” Taavi Emajoe told the Russian-language Delfi website in Estonia. “We hope people find the game humorous. There is nothing unethical about political satire.”

Emajoe, who was working on another game with two other young designers, before the spark of inspiration, says the game wouldn’t have worked without Putin.

“We chose Putin not to create animosity towards him, but because he is such a multi-dimensional political figure. Most of the ideas in the game are derived directly from his persona.”

After easily passing the €1,500 (US$1,734) funding requirement on the local version of Kickstarter, the game has now hit the shelves, retailing at €23.45 ($27).

The manager of Tallinn’s leading Apollo bookshop, Liis Paas, told Delfi that the game has been “attracting a heightened level of attention” from curious shoppers. However, the manager did not elaborate whether interest had transformed into sales.

Estonia is historically sensitive about being invaded by the Soviet Union in 1940, following the Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact, and local politicians still frequently evoke the specter of a Russian invasion, despite the country being a member of NATO and the EU.

Meanwhile, satirical board games about Putin – often based on Snakes and Ladders – have previously appeared in Russian and Western media following a whirlwind year for the Kremlin, mostly as playful illustrations, not actual games to be played with pieces and dice.

Satirical board games have enjoyed a mixed history, with acclaim depending largely on the players’ political orientation. The US board game War on Terror – which satirizes US foreign policy and forces players to temporarily don balaclavas as they face American wrath – is still popular, while the pre-WWII Juden Raus, in which German players had to “round up Jews” and “push them off the board” enjoys a different sort of notoriety.

name: Dementalism: Holy Crap
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Perhaps a bit of divine intervention will save your shiny wazoo... Remember all those clones you accidentally let escape from the primordial soup kitchen back in the day? Well, they're out wandering the countryside and if you and your pals can't bring them back you're going to lose your job or get fed to something horrible. It's a good thing all these assorted Holy Rollers are willing to put in a good word with the gawds on your behalf. Of course, the gawds tend to be rather fickle, so it's up to them whether to do you a solid or hurl you a snub. Good luck. May be played on its own or added to the Dementalism: An Ingenious Game of Ingenious Ingeniousness deck (MOC30001) and other Dementalism expansions. Introduces Holy Roller cards to the game.

name: Flakes of Ice
description:
The glacier is collapsing, and every step you take makes the glacier break into smaller pieces. Soon you'll have no place to stand; can you escape before that happens?

In the solitaire game Flakes of Ice, you want to be standing on the last bit of ice after the rest of the glacier melts.

The game consists of seven hexes, one that bears the game logo (which is placed in the center of the playing area) and six that bear three pairs of colored symbols (which are placed at random around the central hex). To start, you place a player token on the central hex.

On a turn, you first move a hexagon by rotating it 60º in either direction, or by swapping it with a neighboring hexagon or the hexagon on the opposite side of the glacier (keeping their orientations the same in the latter case). You then move the player token from a hexagon to a neighboring hexagon or the opposite hexagon — but only if these hexagons are both connected to the central hex by the same colored symbol. (On the first turn, you move the player token from the central hex to any hex of your choice.) You then flip over the glacier hex that you left to show ocean water.

If you can't move your player token legally, you lose the game; if you can move it six turns, then you'll be standing on the last piece of ice, victorious.

name: Chopstick Challenge: Wooden Tower
description:
A game for 1 or more players who take it in turns to use the chopsticks to pick up pieces.

Take it in turns using chop sticks to pick up a wooden block and create a wooden tower. Stacking 2 pieces per level with each level being at right angles to each other, see how high you can build. Whoever knocks the tower over loses.
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing

name: Snail Invasion
description:
Snails try to eat the plants before they can grow, while the gardener tries to trap the snails: a Looney Pyramids game played with a single rainbow stash and two dice on a 3x4 board.

In the solo game the player is the farmer, and in the two-player rules the second player plays the snails. The farmer has all 12 of the transparent colored pyramids (plants), and the snail farmer has only the three black pyramids.

All pieces start off the board, and each turn one player throws both dice, applying the roll to a single piece, which must be moved in a single track, from left to right and top to bottom, circling back to the beginning if it runs off the end. Smaller pyramids can be carried by larger pyramids that they land on top of. Same-sized pyramids can trap pyramids of the opponent. Larger pyramids can capture smaller opposing pyramids (or protect smaller friendly pyramids). Captured snails are available to return to play, while captured plants are removed from the game.

The farmer wins by building a three-part tree of a single color, or by trapping all three snails. The snails win be capturing at least one piece of each color.

name: Junior Party
description:
From the back of the box (translated from german):

The right game for kids with mind!

Guess your friends correctly, test your knowledge, be creative and spontaneous, prove your skills.

Each participant moves his playing piece on the double circuit. Depending on the color of each box a party task awaits:

On the Green the Alphabet disc arrow is rotated and you have to find a term with the correct letter within seconds.

It applies to YELLOW to find five termns to a specific category in 30 seconds... the hourglass is running!

On PINK there is a funny question, often with three crazy answers, but only one is correct.

And BLUE brings all the action - lots of original creative tasks: for example: Lightning Draw - tight - feel - represent a concept pantomimic or rewrite funny - not tangled in tongue twisters - etc etc etc!

The multicolored fields bring double pleasure: one can give the task either to one or all other gamers and even be the referee!
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Newton
description:
A quiz game based on a norwegian TV science show for youths, where all the players get the same 8 questions. Every question have 4 alternative where 1, 2, or 3 answers are right. Each player choose the alternatives they think is right by choosing the right "answering tokens". If you have one or more wrong you get no points but if you got all right you got points depending on how many answers was correct.

The one with most points after the last question is asked is the winner.

name: GoCache
description:
In GoCache, you search for Urban and Wilderness cache cards using your GPSr device and Transportation cards. You can use Lifeline cards to help you on your way, but watch out! Your opponent will be throwing Muggle cards at you to throw you off course!

You have to play GPRs cards and then you can Cache Cards, in order to win the game, you need to "find" 10 caches.

Phases of the turn:

1: Equipping your GPSr and/or Transportation.
Place the card(s) you wish to equip in front of you. You may only have one of each type equipped.

2: Discard as desired.
You may now discard as many cards as you wish. If you have more than five cards in your hand, you must discard down to five.

3: Draw Phase.
Draw cards untill you have five cards.

4: Play one Cache Card.
Play one cache card of your choice from your hand.

5: Counter Phase.
It is at this time other players have a chance to stop the current player from acquiring any points, by playing cards against this player.

6: Discard all played cards.

7: End of Turn

name: Unia Europejska
description:
This game is about collecting flags of countries in European Union. It lets children learn useful informations - capital city, population and where to find each country on the map of Europe.
Each player gets a card with flags printed on it. Then everyone chooses his starting point - one of the capital cities. Every city is connected to 3-5 others by lines with number on it. To move from one country to another, player must roll such number. By visiting every country he gets a small flag, which he puts on his card mentioned earlier. The first one to collect all of them - wins.

name: The Logo Board Game MiniGame
description: The mini game is a faster version of the Logo board game. It has customised rules and enough cards for up to 6 games. The cards are taken from the original Logo board game.

name: Tom y Jerry
description: Simple trick-taking game for youngsters. There are 32 cards, broken down into 4 sets of 8 cards. The cards are numbered (and have nice illustrations and text on them, none of which is relevant to the game-play). Every player gets 3 cards. Play is traditional with such games. A trick is won by the highest card played to a trick, unless it was trumped. Play continues until the last card is drawn from the deck. The player with the most tricks, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Amazing Spider-Man
description:
Publisher's description: "Find your way to the center of the web! Spider-Man's spider-sense is going crazy! Mysterio, Master of Illusion, is up to his dirty tricks again. He has hypnotized everyone in New York City in order to trap Spider-Man. Hobgoblin, Venom, Carnage, and Green Goblin are also on the loose. Only you can help Spider-Man and Black Cat stop Mysterio and restore peace to the city."

The Amazing Spider-Man was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. This is a fairly standard roll-and-move game where players use an attached "electronic die" to move their pieces around a spiral spiderweb toward to the center. Various spaces on the board move players back or forward or cause players to gain or lose a turn. First player to the center captures Mysterio and wins.

name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 4 – More Battles
description:
Nine battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include Monmouth (initial), Monmouth (final), Harlem Heights, Fort Washington, Ticonderoga Defiant, Paulus Hook, Red Bank, Bound Brook, Fort Clinton.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 3 – Other Battles
description:
Nine battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include White Marsh, Bennington, Princeton, Kettle Creek, Burgoynes Stand, Barren Hill, Brooklyn, the Clouds, and Springfield.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 2 – The Southern Theatre
description:
Ten battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include Charleston, Cowpens, Eutaw Springs, Camden, Guildford Courthouse, Kings Mountain, Hobkirk Hill, Yorktown, Gloucester Point, and Cornwallis breaks out (hypothetical scenario).

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Sky High Scoops
description: How high can you stack the scoops? Listen carefully to the ice cream dish as it tells you either how many scoops or what color scoops to stack. Take turns placing the right scoops on the dish. Make any scoops fall and you take them into your pile. Be the first player to stack all of your scoops and win the game! A sweet way to learn colors, numbers, and following directions!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Number

name: Pudding Wars
description: Pudding is very popular with people in Taiwan, especially children. Almost all of us have eaten pudding, and it is an unforgettable childhood memory for us — but pudding can be used for more than what you think...even for the fun party game Pudding Wars!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
publishers: Kuraki Mura B.G. Studio, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: De Fabeltjeskrant voorlees-memo
description: Players listen to a story being read from the included booklet. At specific points the players can turn 1 memory card trying to find the one with the illustration that belongs to the specific point in the story. If a player turns the wrong memory card this card is placed back (face down). If the correct memory card is correct he/she can keep it and the story continues until a next memory card needs to be found. Now the player left of the player that found the correct memory-card can turn a card first. This continues until all memory cards have been collected by the players. The player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Se Vira
description:
A party game where the players must complete activities from cards to reach the final space of the board.

The activities are all cumulative thru the end of the game and can be something like "put a ball in the middle of your arm", "maintain this card on your right elbow", "put a finger in your left ear", "sing a song", etc.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun
description:
In case you don't have enough problems in your life..here are 330 more! The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun features riddles, including logic problems, visual conundrums, lateral thinking problems, and world riddles.
Noggin Workshop's The Big Box of Brain Stumping Fun can be played for any length of time. Players determine how many cards they want to play and then count out that many cards. Other cards are put back in the box for another time. One player reads out the question and then places it face up for everyone to solve. Once a player solves the problem, he/she checks the answer on the back of the card. If it's correct, that card is kept as a means for collecting points. If it's incorrect, the player is eliminated from the round, while other players continue to solve the problem. The winner with the most cards is the winner.

name: Chikara awaseru nihyakuman!
description:
User summary:

ちからあわせる二百万！ (Chikara awaseru nihyakuman!) is a Japanese card game for younger children. The game uses the popular character Gunma-chan, who is the mascot for the Gunma prefecture in Japan. The game involves drawing cards up to "200" without overdrawing them, so it can be played by children so long as they can count to 20. Objects found locally in Gunma appear in this quick party game.

From the Publisher:
"『ちからあわせる二百万！』は、ゆるキャラで大人気！群馬県のマスコット「ぐんまちゃん」を使ったお手軽パーティカードゲーム。
数字を「２００」ピッタリにするだけの簡単バーストゲームなので、
０から２０までの足し算が出来るお子さんなら楽しく遊ぶことが出来る。
群馬の郷土アイテム「上毛かるた」がモチーフの「つちけ、すもの、おかめきけ」といった役札要素で、最後に大逆転も起こるかも？"
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Party Game

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #14
description:
The 'Mayfair Game Variants & Mini-Expansions Set #14' is composed of expansions for 2 Mayfair games:

Bacchus' Banquet: New Years Celebration - 1 New Years celebration tile. When you take this tile you MUST accept the next card given to you.
Mad City: General Contractor - 1 general contractor tile. This tile is taken similar to the Park Ranger Tree but doubles all Contractor tiles.


This is available in [Game Trade Magazine (Issue 179 - Jan 2015).

name: Bacchus' Banquet: New Years Celebration
description: This promo expansion adds one New Years celebration tile. When you take this tile you MUST accept the next card given to you. It's a gamble but might help you win if you only need one more card!
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Mad City: General Contractor
description:
Adds one General contractor Tile. This tile cannot be taken instead of the Park Ranger Tree. You may not take both. Once you take it you can no longer work on your city.

This tile doubles all Contractor tile points gained or lost.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: All About Indianapolis
description:
The object of All About Town is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel cards by moving around the game board. You can adjust the length of the game by changing the number of collected cards required to win.

Players can acquire money from Banks and Money Spaces. Surprise Spaces allow players to draw Surprise Cards that provide money, movement, both or cause them to lose a turn. Whenever a player acquires a Travel Card, another one is turned up.

All About Town: Indianapolis appears to have been sponsored by local businesses. Ads for various business appear on the rulebook, Surprise Cards, Travel Cards and money, some with addresses and phone numbers to those businesses. A full Participant Listing appears in the rulesheet.

Part of the All About Town family of games.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: UNO: Horses
description:
Test your steed's speed as the classic card game meets the world's most majestic breeds in the Horses edition of UNO.


112 Custom Cards featuring beautiful horses of all colors and breeds.
Same great UNO play PLUS the special Horseplay card, which forces other players to swap hands.
Be sure to shout "UNO" as you go for the win.

name: Errands
description:
The people in Errandtown need your help!

In this game your goal is to complete errands that the people in Errandtown need help with. The players take turns to move through town and collecting what's on their current errand. To really master this game you'll have to remember where everything is in town and know where to find it when you need it. Errands is a quick and easy game to learn but quite hard to master.

For each errand you complete you get a certain score. The first player over a set value (depending on the amount of players playing) is the winner.

On your way to victory you'll find clipboard cards that will help you or will make it harder for other players to complete their errands.

The game is perfect for both young and old players. For the youngest players it may be a good way to learn English.
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: ATC: Rush Hours
description:
ATC Rush Hour is a game in which players take role of Air Traffic Controllers on an airport. The main objective of the game is to make sure that all the planes land or take off without any problems. The game will is available to play from 4 to 6 players. Each player controls one airport with its ATC (Air Traffic Controllers) and try to take off and land as many planes as possible.

Each player receives one board at the start of the game. The board represents an airport that is controlled by the player and it is divided into five Zones and seven spaces for Action cards. The Zones are used as an areas to place ATC and Plane cards and the other spaces are destined for corresponding Action cards (Airport, Upgrade, Event and Weather).

The key element of the game is moving the Planes between the Zones and players. The Planes are moved by sending them ATC commands. To send a command to a Plane, a player must pay with ATC points, which is done by removing a number of counters from ATC cards. Moving Planes provides victory points which are needed to win the game.

name: Spelligator
description:
Description from the Box:
Be the best at word building! Stack your Spelligator with as many words as you can to win! Challenge your friends to see who can build the highest stack of words!


Spelligator is a children's game designed to teach simple vocabulary, spelling and phonics. Each player has a plastic "Spelligator" with three shaped spaces on its back. Players then take turns turning over letter tiles, each of which can fit only in the beginning, middle or end space. Each tile is printed with either a single letter, a blend or a digraph. If the player can add the tile to his or her Spelligator's back to make a new word, it is added. If not, the tile is turned back face down. When all the tiles are used or no more words can be made, the player with the highest stack on his or her Spelligator's back wins.

name: 9'ers
description: A variation of Fan Tan. 54 cards; 1-9 in 5 colours / 3 'joker cards' / 6 'give or take 2 cards'. On a turn, a player either plays a card or draws a card. Played cards are placed on the table next to previously placed cards. The new card has to be of an immediately higher or lower value and of the same suit, or it has to be of the same value and from another suit. Players can only play 1 card per turn. A joker card can be played at any time and at any place while a 'give or take 2 card' (used to have another player take 1 or 2 extra cards or to remove 1 or 2 cards from the table) can be played at any time except as a player's last card. When a 'give or take 2 card' is played it goes back into the stack of cards and the stack is shuffled again. The first player to have no card left wins.

name: Bird's Eye View
description:
Rather clever party game.

The box contains 18 pictures and 12 answer cards.

Pablo, always wearing his sombrero, (represented by thick black rings) is a man of many parts. Our artist has drawn his impressions of some of Pablo's activities as seen through a bird's eye from above.

Distribute the pictures about the room and give each player an answer card. They should then be allowed abouf 20 minutes in which to write down their guesses as to what Pablo is supposed to be doing in each picture. The most correct answers, wins.

name: Box O'Cats
description:
Box O'Cats challenges 3 to 5 players to fire up their imaginations solving bizarre dilemmas. Each round, players creatively convince the others that their unusual items best solve the presently perplexing predicament.

Giant robots are attacking. Do you whip out the dynamite or the magic spells?

Or maybe you're pulling the ultimate prank. Will you choose the rubber chicken or the warped time machine? Or maybe... the Box O'Cats?

name: Famous Missions
description:
Famous Missions is a party game where players put together their best team of famous (and sometimes infamous) personalities to handle the mission at hand.

You need to dismantle a bomb, QUICKLY! You look around and see George Lucas, Donald Trump, Oprah, Gene Simmons, Danny DeVito, Joan of Arc and Shaquille O'Neal. Who will you choose?

Choose 3 and defend your choice. You'll need to argue for them later.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: FlipFight: Battle of Gettysburg
description:
FlipFight is a series of strategic manual dexterity micro-games. Battle of Gettysburg is the first game in the FlipFight series. The game pits Union and Confederate forces against each other in the pivotal Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

The players assume the roles of field commanders during the battle with access to different cavalry and infantry units. At the beginning of each game the battlefield is dynamically generated from a deck of key strategic locations -- from Round Top and the Devil's Den to Cemetery Hill and Seminary Ridge -- ensuring no two games will be the same.

On their turns, players select a combat unit from their reserves and flip it onto the battlefield in an attempt to seize control of a location or capture enemy forces to gain victory points. Infantry and cavalry units are not only different shapes, each has distinct strengths -- capturing a location featuring High Ground with infantry allows the player to perform an artillery strike, while cavalry can capture enemy infantry forces and remain in field.

Each strategic location has different values representing how difficult they were to control (units needed), and how valuable they were to each side's efforts (victory points). Combat units have varying levels of effectiveness, representing the makeup of their forces and the quality of their leadership.

The first player to earn 10 Victory Points through control of key locations or captured enemy forces wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Picture Posers
description:
Party Game. Each guest is given a card. The card is split into 3 different competitions.

1st: Place Names. A montage of 24 illustrations is given. Players must pair them off into pairs that represent the name of a town. Thus, 12 towns in all.
2nd: Words. Similar to the first competition but this time representing 'dictionary' words.
3rd: Silhouettes. There are nine pictures in silhouette and they must be identified.

Up to 12 can play. The host must set a time-limit and when "Time" is called, the guest with the most correct answers wins (and a good host or hostess should have a small gift as the winner's trophy).

name: What's Your Magic?
description:
There are three elements to magic: fire, water, and wood. Each has its weakness. Fire burns Wood, Wood absorbs Water, and Water extinguishes Fire.

Your goal is to become the most powerful wizard by gathering as many Magic Stones of your element as you can, while avoiding the Magic Stones that your element is weak against.

But do not let other wizards know your element, or they will use their magic to thwart you!

"What's your Magic? forces you to conceal your affinity, while trying to deduce what affinity your opponents are.

The wizard with the most points at the end of the game, calculated by [stones in your affinity - stones your affinity is weak against], is the winner.

On your turn you may cast a spell using the stones in your tableau and then you must use a card in your hand to move the fairy that many times around the central decks.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Find My Monsters
description:
Two children have lost control of their pet Monsters. Help them collect these Monsters-on-the-loose. Find My Monsters is 2 fun and fast card games in 1.

In Game 1, the deck is shuffled, then spread out face down. Players decide who goes first. They each then take turns turning over two cards in order to match the Alfi card (Green Background) with one of his pet Monsters (Green Background), or the Penny card (Orange Background) with one of her pet Monsters (Orange Background). (Or vice versa – matching Monster to matching Alfi/Penny) The cards that match are then placed in front of you to form your Point pile. At the end of the game, players will add up the total Monsters in their Point pile, and the player with the most Monsters wins!

In Game 2, the deck is shuffled and placed between both players. Each player draws four cards, and then one person takes the top four cards of the deck and places them face up in a row next to it. Decide who goes first. During each of their turns, players will look at the cards in their hands and the cards face up next to the deck in order to pair up two cards, Penny to one of her Monsters or Alfi to one of his Monsters(or vice versa). Your goal is to put together the cards that add up to the highest value (using the numbers on the bottom right of each card). These cards are then placed in front of you to form your Point pile. At the end of the game, each player adds up all the numbers on all of the cards in their respective Point piles, and the player with the higher total wins!

name: Explorers & Exploiters
description:
In Explorers & Exploiters, you are one of several leaders over a people, exploring and exploiting the resources of a New World. However, you also lead the barbarians fighting against the people.

Each player starts with a number of settlements in different sizes; hamlets, villages, towns and cities. The first player to place all of them on the board is the winner.

The world is made up of tiles of different kinds - foundations for settlements, resources necessary for settlements, and useless wastelands. At the start, the world is terra incognita and all tiles are turned face down, waiting to be explored by the units.

The units in the world are of two kinds - explorers and barbarians. They do not belong to particular players but any player may act with them. Explorers may explore a tile (move to it and look at it privately) or exploit a tile (turn it face up and make it available for all players). Barbarians on the other hand plunder tiles and turn them face down again.

By turning tiles face up or face down, players may make more or less resources connected to settlements. This allows the settlement to be expanded or expelled and the player to replace the existing settlement with one from the hand.

The challenge of the game is to play the common units so that the right settlement can be played in the right place at the right time.

There are no such things as ”mine” and ”yours”, nor such things as ”good” and ”evil”. All units are commonly played, whether they be explorers or barbarians. To win, you must use the common resources to rise above the commons, not unlike the challenges of a real leader!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Memory, Modular Board

name: Match 'em! Adverbs
description: A card game of rummy in which players form correct verb/adverb combinations of two or more cards. Reinforce language arts skills with the 60 cards in the deck.

name: Match 'em! Synonyms
description: A card game of rummy in which players collect two or more cards showing synonyms. Reinforce language arts skills with the 60 cards in this deck.

name: Match 'em! Contractions
description: A card game of rummy in which players collect two or more cards showing the three parts of a contraction (I, will, I'll). Reinforce language arts with the 60 cards in this deck.

name: Beer Party
description:
Beer Party is a fast game card, in which players try to serve and drink more beer than the opponent.
The more you drink the closer you are to victory ,but the harder it will achieve it !

Players will play face down cards in columns that form the "jars" (setting the correct cards). You may consult cards and swap cards every turn, until someone decides to "drink" one. If you can drink 3 beers will have finished the game! Time to count points.


Beer Party es un juego de cartas rápido y de reglas simples, en el que los jugadores tratarán de servir y beber más cervezas que el rival.
Cuantas más bebas más cerca estarás de la victoria, ¡pero más difícil será alcanzarla!

Los jugadores irán jugando cartas ocultas en columnas que formarán las "jarras". Estás cartas podrán consultarse y moverse cada turno, hasta que alguien decida "beber" una de ellas. Si consigues beber 3 cervezas ¡habrá terminado la partida! Hora de contar puntos.

name: Sherlock Holmes: salapoliisipeli
description:
Sherlock Holmes is a variant on the famous whodunnit detective game (called Cluedo in the UK, Clue in the US) especially for younger children to play.

In this variant players move between 9 different places. One item has been stolen from mr. Newlyrich's summer cottage. The goal is to find out the stolen item, the thief and the place where the item is hidden.

This game also exist in a Swedish edition, made by Alga.

name: Dementalism: Flop, Slop, and Sop
description:
From the publisher:

Things are getting out of control around here. Those wandering clones are still doing their thang, aimlessly meandering about, waiting for you to round them up so you won't get fired or fed to anything. The thing is, now they've entered the burg (some of them, anyway) and they're populating the digs and whatnot. This BRILLIANT expansion to the Dementalism game introduces brand new DIGS cards. These guys alter the very fabric of reality, influencing the way the game is played for everyone. Do you have the NOGGIN to match wits with Oith's greatest dementalists, or should I call your mommy so she can come kiss your boo boos? That's what I thought...

name: Tu m'en diras tant
description:
English description:
Each player, at their turn, has either to answer a question about French language (orthography, litterature...), or mime or draw a French expression, depending on the space their pawn is located on the board. If they answer correctly, they roll the dice and advance the corresponding number on the board.
The first player reaching the final space and answering correctly the final question wins the game.

French description:
Chaque joueur, à son tour, doit soit répondre à une question sur la langue française (orthographe, littérature...), ou mimer ou dessiner une expression française, suivant la case où leur pion est situé sur le plateau. S'il répond correctement, il lance le dé et avance du nombre de cases correspondantes sur le plateau. Le premier joueur à atteindre la case finale et à répondre correctement à la dernière question remporte la partie.

name: Kokuhaku
description:
User summary:
コクハク (Kokuhaku) means 'Confession'. The players have all recently died and are taken down to Hell. Before you reach Hell, you have a chance to ascend to Heaven by confessing to your crimes and sins. Each player has seven face-down cards in front of them, each of which represents a crime or a sin they had committed during their lifetime. You must get rid of your cards before anyone else does. Only one player can take the ticket to Heaven!

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは全員、地獄に案内された人達・・・
天国に行ける一席を巡って生前犯した罪を「コクハク」する時間がやってきた。各プレイヤーの前に並べた7枚裏向きのカード。このカードを1番最初に無くした人の勝ち

name: Dinner Murder Party
description:
Gather some beer, snacks, and your closest friends for Dinner Murder Party, a remix on Werewolf-Mafia like party games.

You play as one of a group of celebrity Dinner Guests gathered at an old mansion located in the Hollywood Hills or as a Murderer hidden in their midst.

As a Dinner Guest, you will be tasked with the singular purpose of bringing about the end of the world through evil, Illuminati-like, sacrificial rituals. That is unless the heroes, err the Murderers, kill all the celebrities at the party. But be careful if you’re a murderer because the celebrities will be more than happy to feast on you as the main course.

This game is great for seven or more players. An odd number of players is best, although not mandatory. Use the handy table below to figure out which roles you should be using based on the number of players you are playing the game with.

name: Dirty Detectives
description:
In Dirty Detectives, everyone has been assigned to solve the same murder, but solving murders is hard work, so instead each detective is going to try to frame someone for murder. Each time a player touches a piece of evidence, they learn what it is, but unfortunately now that evidence points to their involvement in the crime!

The games uses 17 cards, 16 of which are laid out in a 4x4 grid with the 17th card in the active player's hand. Each card has an arrow on the back of it, and during play these arrows point at the players.

On a turn, you have the one extra card in hand and pick up any card from the board. You choose one of these cards and place it face-down in the empty space with the arrow pointing to you; to end your turn, pass the card still in hand to your left-hand opponent, who now takes their turn.

On your turn, you can also make an accusation. To do this, name a weapon and a motive, then pick up two cards pointing to the same opponent and look at them. If these cards match what you said, reveal these cards to everyone because you've just won the game; if you're wrong, however, place these cards facedown once again, but now pointing at yourself.

Each card also has a special reveal benefit. When you place a card facedown on the board pointing at yourself, normally only you know what that card is; if you reveal the card, everyone now knows what it is, but you get to do the reveal benefit on that card, e.g., looking at cards without pointing them at yourself or rotating cards to point at opponents.

name: Monopoly: Celtic Football Club Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent Celtic Glasgow.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chikuwa Soudatsu Sen
description:
User summary:
ちくわ争奪戦 (Chikuwa Soudatsu Sen, literally "struggle for Chikuwa") is a card game in which the players are cats, craftily trying to get the best serving of Chikuwa fish paste at supper.

In the game, the deck has cards numbered 0, 1, 2 or 3. Players are dealt three cards each, and three more cards are placed face-down on the table. Starting with the player who's most recently had Chikuwa, each player may swap two cards from their hand with those on the table, or they may pass. Going clockwise, once each player has had their turn, the cards on the table are shuffled back into the deck, and another three are dealt face-down. Going back the other way, the players repeat their turn to swap one or two cards in their hand. Lastly, everyone shows their hand.

The aim is to get the best ranking combination of three cards. In the game, 3-3-3 is the worst of all, since you have been a greedy cat and stuffed yourself until you've got stomach-ache. 0-0-0 is the best combination, since the owners see you've been so unselfish and punish the other cats by giving you their food. But after 0-0-0, the best combo is 3-3-2, then 3-2-2, then 3-3-1 and so on, down to 1-0-0 which beats 3-3-3. So, by bluffing and guessing, can you work up to a high ranking hand, or do you risk holding 0s in the aim of winning all?

Publisher's summary:
いつも仲良しのネコ達ですが、今日のごはんにみんな大好物のちくわがご飯のため、目の色を変えて奪い合います。ただし、食べ過ぎや仲良く食べていないと大変な目にあうかもしれません。
遊び方は、とても簡単です。
スタートプレイヤーから時計回りに中央の伏せカードから最大２枚まで手札を交換し、その後シャッフルします。今度は最後の人から半時計周りに同じ事を行い3枚の数字の合計が一番高い人が勝利となります。
ただし、１番強い数字は食べ過ぎて１番弱なり、１番低い数字は仲良く食べてない事がばれ１番強くなります。

name: B-Daman Crossfire Vertigo Spin Arena
description:
From the publisher’s website:

Ready…Aim…Crossfire! Can you handle your next mission in the Vertigo Spin Arena? Blast away with your B-Daman figure (figures sold separately) and try to knock three marbles out of the arena before your opponent does. Do you have what it takes for precision target blasting? Find out with the Vertigo Spin Arena. Vertigo Spin Arena includes a centerpiece with six Vertigo Spin marble slots! Fire at the centerpiece and knock three marbles out before your opponent does. Includes unassembled arena, 6 B-DA Marbles, collector card, label sheet, and instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Button Mashers
description:
Mash the buttns along with your opponents in this exciting 2-4 player dice game that emulates playing an old school fighting game!

Do you remember the glory days of arcades; walking into that dimly lit building, the buzzing lights and distractingly repetitive tunes fighting one another, vying for your attention? I recall fondly how my shoes fought for every step as the floor clung stickily to them and feeding my quarter into the arcade machine only to watch it disappear and the machine not reading it. Do you recall the days of getting really good at your favorite game and taking on any challenger; and then getting destroyed by that one person who didn’t know what they were doing, and kept hitting the same button over and over again? Well ... welcome to Button Mashers!
