Button Mashers is a 2-4 player dice game where players take turns rolling dice, and match the results to their character's special moves to deal damage to their opponent

name: Monopoly: Cheltenham
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Cheltenham, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Selectinomicon: Quest for Consent
description:
In times of extreme uncertainty, one may call upon the power of Selectinomicon and hope that indecision is the only thing consumed.

Selectinomicon is a collaborative selection metagame which allows a group to come to consensus on a game by voting for various characteristics of games such as theme, mechanisms, weight, and length.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: The Great Toilet War (トイレ大戦争)
description: In The Great Toilet War (トイレ大戦争), the player passengers are riding on a train and competing for the limited number of toilets available so that they can do their business before things get messy and they need to return home for a change of clothes.

name: Wish You Were Here...?
description:
This is a geographical card game based on a popular TV travel show. The aim of the game is to accumulate 10 golden travel cards over a series of rounds.

In each round, players compete to place numbers on each of the 7 regions: Asia, Europe, Far East, Africa, North American and South America. (only five are used in the two player game)

During a turn, a player with play a card, then draw a card (either from the discard pile, or the deck). Play continues until the deck runs out.

Note: There is an optional for playing with the trivia cards included in the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel, Trivia

name: Match'n'Turn
description:
Match'n'Turn is a very special lotto!

You must match the images on the tiles with those on your board. It seems simple, but the objects to look for keep changing!

You have to look carefully to gather the most tiles.

name: Doug The Bluffscouts' Adventure 3-D Board Game
description:
It's the Great Wilderness Adventure - and you're invited! So grab your backpack, and join Doug and the other Bluffscouts on their mountain-top camping trip.

Hike up and down the 3-D mountain trails collecting the gear you need for your campsite - firewood, water, a tent. Then hunt for the special badge that's yours and yours alone: Doug's sister Judy needs to find her Bongo Drums... Roger needs to find Stinky the Cat. Good ole' Doug may stumple along and help you find your gear. Or you might send out that canine camper Porkchop to swipe what you need from another campsite. Be the first Bluffscout to set up your camp - and win Doug's Great Wilderness Adventure Game!
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Janosch Tiger Party
description:
It is the little tiger's birthday and he celebrates a real Tiger Party. All are invited: the fox, the lucky mole, the elegant goose and all the other Tiger Friends. Each brings paintings. The little tiger is highly excited because homemade gifts are the best, right? Splendid images for a terrific card game are a wonderful birthday gift and you can try it: View the pictures carefully and cleverly put cards and win real Tiger!

Game has 32 cards, and tiger points. Everyone gets 6 card and some tiger points. Each card has two or more tiger friends on it. On its turn player must play a card that don't have tiger friends that are on a card that is on a table, or draw a new card. Whoever plays his last card wins the round and gets tiger points from other players depending on how many tiger friends they have in hand.
When someone can't pay a game ends, and whoever has most tiger points is a winner.

name: Palette
description: Palette features a deck of cards, each of which displays one of six colors and some which display the designation, goal card. Players are dealt a hand of cards and take turns playing one card and then replenishing. A goal card is played into one of four slots in a central area; the other cards are played into players' individual tableaux. Special cards also can be played that replace and otherwise manipulate the cards in the tableaux and central area. The winner is the first player to match the colors of the four cards in his tableau with those in the central area.

name: Mulberry Bush Game
description: The Mulberry Bush Game is a roll and move game for young children. Land on a picture of a teddy getting ready for school, mime the action (eg brushing teeth, putting on coat) and you get to collect the card. The first player to collect all 6 cards is the winner!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: VERBA: Español Core Set
description:
VERBA is the new language learning card game developed by The Pericles Group. The concept is incredibly simple -- one player (acting as a judge) draws a random card containing a fill in the blank sentence in the target language and the other players play a card containing a noun from their hand. The player who has played the sentence card then chooses the best card played and that player scores a point. Play continues with that player as the new judge.

All VERBA players benefit from seeing high frequency words, with many repetitions, in a context that fosters authentic learning and comprehensible input. As with all of The Pericles Group's educational games, the play objectives and the learning objectives are one in the same. Players win by making comprehensible sentences, scaffolded by the cards, the images, and the helpful hints included on the sentence cards. We always want to ensure that the learners are seeing correct forms and those forms are continually reinforced by the mechanics.

This is a core set specially tailored for novice level Spanish learners and works great in or out of the classroom!

name: Soccer Manager Express
description:
Soccer Manager Express is a Print-and-Play game available for free on BGG! Players assume the role of the Manager of one of six teams vying for the League Title at the end of the season.

Each player starts by drafting a team of Academy players with basic skills and a modest budget of cash. They can then buy Premier players from the Transfer Market and build a small squad to challenge for title glory.

The league matches consist of super-quick rounds of dice rolling, where custom dice for various players and positions determine the outcome. The team that performs the best over the course of the season will accumulate the most points and be crowned the League Champions!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports

name: Kreative kocken
description:
Swedish cardgame about cooking.
Basically all about a card deck with 101 different ingredients, where the players plays ingredients from their hands in turn, trying to be the first player without cards. The game comes with rules for three different game styles tucked into the card deck.

From the publisher:
"Ta fram den Kreative kocken i dig!
Detta kortspel utspelar sig i ett kök med välfyllt skafferi. Men Kreative Kocken handlar inte bara om att kombinera ingredienser till spännande nya maträtter. Det är också ett lagarbete där flera kockar måste samarbeta och argumentera för de ingredienser de lägger till. Så vad du än kokar ihop, så måste du också lyckas övertyga medspelarna om att smaka på det…"

name: Séance
description:
JOIN THE CIRCLE:
During the mid-nineteenth century, spiritualism became increasingly popular. Mediums would gather a group of believers for a séance as they attempted to contact the spirits of their dearly departed relatives. Now it’s time for you to create your own circle around the table as you attempt to contact these wispy spirits.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:
Play cards onto the séance circle to “make contact” with Spirits – contact your spirit by matching its incantation or steal another player's spirit by spelling out the word “Séance”. Use special chain cards to "lock" incantation cards in place or scare the other players silly with game-changing "fright" cards. Collect Spirit cards for points.

CONTACTING SPIRITS
There are two ways you can contact spirits:
Capture your spirit by matching the Spirit’s incantation
Steal another player's spirit by spelling the word Séance

HOW TO WIN: The player who captures 3 spirits wins. For a more challenging game, collect 13 points of Spirit cards to win.

VARIANT PLAY
For a more challenging game, discard one Séance card from your hand to use its unique ability

S – Steal a random Séance card from any player's hand.
é – Expel any player's Spirit from the circle and replace it with a new card from the Spirit deck.
A – Alter the circle by discarding a Séance card and replacing it with a new card from the Séance deck.
N – No - Chosen player gets one less action on their next turn.
C – Change a Seance card on the circle with another Seance card on the circle.
E – Exchange your hand with another player’s hand.

name: Dinosaur Math
description:
Dinosaur Math consists of 1 double-sided game board, 4 dinosaur counters, 2 number dice and 1 operations die. Each side of the game board is a different game.

Dino Tracks: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space. The youngest player goes first. Both number dice are rolled and the player adds the numbers together and moves that number of spaces on the board. The first player to move their dinosaur to the home space is the winner.

Dino Stomp: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space, and rolls the two number dice. The highest number goes first. Players roll all 3 dice and use the numbers and operation shown to determine what number of spaces to move. Some spaces have instructions on them. The first player to reach the finish space is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Ringe Tauchen
description:
Children's game. The board represents a swimming pool. Before play starts, place the 25 tiles face-down, one in each square.
Players roll a colour die and may take a face-down tile related to that column or row which matches the colour thrown. If you roll a 'white' then you may choose any colour. 13 of the 25 tiles have a rubber ring on them and twelve are without a ring. When the pool is 'empty', players count up their tiles with rings and the one with them most, wins.

The 2nd game indicated in the rules is for older children. This time two colour dice are rolled together and draw the tile indicated by looking along a row indicated by one dice and also down the column indicated by the 2nd die. In addition, depending on the colours rolled, there are opportunities to give 'empty' tiles to other players or you may lose a tile you have previously taken. When all the tiles are taken, you add up your tiles with rings and subtract the tiles you have without rings. The highest total wins.

name: Murder in the Forum
description: This two-player abstract strategy game plays out an angry disagreement within the forum of a provincial town in Roman Britain. Two groups of citizens have come to blows over missing taxes, and pursue each other across the forum plaza and in its surrounding corridors. All pieces move orthogonally, with the aim being to trap their enemies while avoiding capture themselves. Capture is by blocking. Once trapped, hapless citizens are quickly dispatched (removed from the board). A Magistrate and two forum guards have wavering allegiances, and swap sides each time citizens are murdered. The two guards can also take part in capture. The winner is the player to eliminate all the opposing player's pieces. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

name: After the Titans
description:
Battle of Gods

The Titans have fallen to the hands of new gods. The Olympians struggle against one another for power, and now it is time for all mortals to choose sides. Which gods will you worship, Devotee? Battle one another to see whose gods are mightiest. Command beasts, summon mystical objects, and worship your gods to increase your power and cast spells to eliminate other Devotees.

Quick Review

After the Titans is a themed gateway card drafting game in a 100 card closed set.This game encompasses all the fun of deck building collectible card games, without the time investment found in similar games. Game play is designed to be brisk and competitive. The Core Set is made for 2-4 Devotees, and one game lasts approximately 5 minutes per Devotee.

Meet the Gods

The war Zeus waged against the Titans has ended. The Olympians now rule the Universe, and the Titans are imprisoned in Tartarus. Following their final victory, the Olympic gods divided the world amongst themselves and are now in a struggle against one another for power.

Apollo
Apollo is the healer. He ensures you and your Beasts can last the battle. He doesn’t just heal, Apollo keeps Beasts dealing maximum damage. He’s deceivingly good.

Ares
Ares seeks the blood of his opponents. He has the most ruthless direct and single target damage spells.

Athena
Athena is wise and patient. She counters spells, steals Beasts, and controls the minds of other Devotees. She waits until an opponent is vulnerable, then sabotages them.

Zeus
Zeus is powerful but slow to rise, making use of Favors to strengthen Beasts and Static cards. He can also fortify structures and works well with Static Cards that will be released in future expansion packs.

name: På Rejse i Alverdens Viden
description:
Quiz race the board have five different "districts" from Start to Finish divided by orange paths;
On the orange paths you use the die to move, and some spots have question mark.
When coming to the the coloured districts you drop the die and only move when answering questions depending on the difficulty of the question (if you guess wring you can only move one space).

First to finish is the winner.

name: Need for Speed Trading Card Game: Canyon Rush
description:
42 cards deck expansion for Need for Speed
The cards are known, it is not a blind booster.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: Need for Speed Trading Card Game: Downtown Dash
description:
42 cards deck expansion for Need for Speed
The cards are known, it is not a blind booster.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: Armoured Clash
description:
Armoured Clash is a game designed to recreate massed armoured battles in the alternate Victorian super science fiction world of Dystopian Wars.

Not for the faint hearted, these rules and fast and furious, allowing the very largest and most epic world changing battles from this alternate history to be brought to your gaming table.

In Armoured Clash, full brigades of gargantuan tanks perform vast advances on deep defensive lines, capture entire cities or raze towns as they wrestle across the continents of a war-torn world.

Each commander has at their disposal full regiments of steam powered armoured vehicles; all comprised of dozens of colossal iron monsters and thousands of men. These mammoth creations are supported by great zeppelins and other, more esoteric, flying machines, destructive long range artillery and anything else the finest scientific minds of the era can conjure to wage their war.

Commanders are able to customise their brigade to the task at hand and match their preferred way of fighting through their choice of battalions.

Armoured Clash is a standalone, comprehensive game, ideal for playing out the greatest land battles depicted in the Dystopian Wars history, from the entirety of the Second Battle of Waterloo as described in Storm of Steel to Operation Bear Trap featured in this book.

The rule system is suited to any style of play, from highly competitive tournament games to campaigns of linked scenarios between friends.

Prepare your forces, make your battleplan, and ready yourself for the Armoured Clash!

name: Tingo Tengo Ecuador
description:
Tingo Tengo Ecuador is a set collecting and memory card game. The aim of the game is to collect the majority of the four-card sets of fourteen cities of Ecuador.

The game is played in two phases: in the first phase the players try to guess which other players have the cities they are dealt at the beginning (with a correct guess the player receives the card; with a wrong guess the turn goes to the next player); in the second phase the players try to remember which four-card sets the other players have collected in order to steal the cards fro the other players. The first player to get all four-card sets is the winner.

name: Eier mit Speck
description: Child's game where you are flipping pieces of bacon into the air & trying to catch them using a pan divided into scoring sections. Published in a children's magazine as a cut-and-assemble game.

name: Shuffle: Play-Doh
description:
Shuffle: Play-Doh is a game targeting younger children and that wants to improve there speaking skills.

Goal of the game is to get rid of your cards by placing them in the middle. This is only allowed if the top card in the middle has something in common with the card a player wants to play. Each player decides by himself what this common thing is, but the other players have to decide if this thing is acceptable.

Shuffle: Play-Doh comes with app support, also. In app mode the app decides which cards are allowed.

name: The Office: Trivia Card Game
description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the Scranton, Pennsylvania branch of Dunder Mifflin, scene of the hit NBC sit com "The Office." Think you know your stuff about Michael Scott and his group?

Every card features two questions, including one extra-challenging question for the super fans of the show.

name: Knee Jerk: Sci-Fi Pack
description: A set of 10 science fiction themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

name: Knee Jerk: Movies Pack
description: A set of 10 movie themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

name: Knee Jerk: Time Travel Pack
description: A set of 10 time travel themed cards for Knee Jerk that were available as part of the Kickstarter campaign.

name: Het Grote Smurfenspel
description:
Translated from the back of the box:
To escape the ongoing threat of Gargamel and his cat Azrael, the Smurfs left their village and moved into the forest.
The players, which get involved in this adventure, have to find the hiding place of a certain number of Smurfs and bring them back to the village. While doing this, they have to cope with Gargamel's magic, Azrael's anger and other trouble.

Kids game that combines luck of the draw with a little memory challenge.
The board consists of six locations where the Smurfs hide (closed boxes with Smurfs in it), Gargamels castle (where they have to draw cards with negative events), and the Smurf village.
Each player gets one cart that he moves across the board, visiting the different locations for the Smurfs of a certain type. When a player has a Smurf in his cart, he then has to find the matching Smurf (two of each kind in the game), and then move the cart back to the village to collect the Smurfs. First one to collect all the Smurfs on his "mission card" wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: boo... don't say it!
description: This is an entertaining party game like Taboo where you have to describe a word to your teammates without using specific words as fast as you can!

name: Världens huvudstäder
description:
The goal of the game is to score as few points as possible. This is achieved by answering questions about capitals, and by getting rid of ones cards before the opponents do so. There are five series of cards (matching five different colors), and the cards are all numbered from 1 to 6. All cards has a country, a flag, and the country's capital printed on it.

The first player starts by playing card #4 in any color. He/she also asks the player to his left if he/she can match the country with its capital. If the player doesn't know the answer, he/she adds as many points as the card shows to his/her score. Play continues with the next player playing either another #4 card, or a #3/#5 card in the color already played. If a player is unable to play a card, he has to draw cards from the deck (up to a maximum of three cards). Game ends when the deck runs out of cards. Players with cards on their hands add up their scores. The scores are adjusted with earned minus points from answering the questions about the capitals.

The game resembles The Game of Capitals from 1933, but this version adds some more rules, and expands gameplay to include card placement resembling that in "Sevens" (also known as "Ruter Sju", "Laying Out Sevens", "Fan Tan", "Crazy Sevens", or "Parliament").
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Top Gear Challenges South America
description:
"Top Gear Challenges South America. Loosely based on the TV show".
"Take part on your very own Top Gear Challenge".

"Use your game cards wisely to battle for the lead, or slow down your opposition as you rack up the miles and make your way around the board".

name: Great Battles: The Napoleonic Wars
description:
Great Battles is a miniatures wargame that is played on a hex grid, it combines elements of board gaming and miniature wargaming in its rule mechanics. Movement and firing ranges as well as arcs of fire, front, flank and rear zones are all regulated by a hex grid.

Each turn represents 30 minutes of real time and each hex is 250 yards across. Each hex can only contain one combat unit though commanders can stack with other commanders and/or friendly units. Units of deployed artillery, infantry or cavalry are faced towards a hex spine and have 2 front, 2 flank and 2 rear hexes. Command stands, infantry in square and limbered artillery do not have facings and can be positioned anywhere within a hex.

name: Tentacle Bento: Marie-Claude
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Ett ölspel
description:
400 entertaining questions and answers about beer.

A player throw a die that show the different categories and try to answer correct and score points.

name: Sexual Pursuit
description:
A clone of Trivial Pursuit.

Players start in the center of the hex shaped board, the "Erogenous Center". In turn, they roll a die and move that number of spaces down one of the six radial tracks where they will land on either "Subject Position" or "Capital Position" spaces. The "Dealer" (an opponent, or partner in team games) draws a card and, based on the symbol on the space, asks a sexual trivia question. If answered correctly the player rolls and moves again. If incorrect play passes to next player. If players correctly answer a question while on one of the six outside Capital Zone spaces they get a plastic ring ("Stage Pieces") they can place on their spindle shaped game pawn. If they land on an "Erogenous Zone" space they are asked a question from a card but instead of being right or wrong the answer has to satisfy their Dealer. Once they have all six rings from the outside Capital Zones they move towards the center Erogenous Center space and try to answer an Erogenous Zone question there. If their answer satisfies the Dealer, they win. If not, they must leave the Erogenous Center on the next turn and return again.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Bajkoland kosmiczny
description:
Family game in which you throw the dice and move pawns.
Number of Players 2 - no limit but above the 8 players played not very well.
The game refers to the fairy tales.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Erlebnis Nationalpark
description: A journey through the German national parks. The experience game for World Animal Week 1993. A journey to the 10 national parks is a journey through the 16 German federal states. A visitor to a national park can earn points by showing that he knows a lot about animals and nature (activity cards/question cards). Through special events, but you also win or lose points. The game is over when the first player has visited all ten national parks. He gets a bonus of 5 points . The winner is whoever has the most points at the end .

name: Talk to Cecil
description: Build the jigsaw puzzle like game board, roll and move your Beanie pawn. There are spaces where you get to pull the string on the Cecil the Seasick Sea-serpent. The puppet will give you clues to find a character card which you keep for points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2013 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
Adds 3 drinks to the drink deck.

Barroom Brawl
Monster Attack! (d6 version)
Gambler’s Grog

Two of the three mix things up by requiring die rolls, and Gambler’s Grog (not to be confused with the Compulsive Gambler's Grog) adds a neat little twist to the original.

Barroom Brawl, Monster Attack!, and Gambler's Grog expand/change the effects of the original cards contained in the RDI3 Drink Deck, effectively making these new cards that reuse old titles. The original Gambler's Grog, with the same effects as the one in RDI3, is also present in the RDI4 Drink Deck.

The promo cards have a "C" in the bottom right.

The promo version of Monster Attack! would later appear in the collectors edition of The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox with an "S" in the bottom right.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Défi Chronologique
description: Défi Chronologique is a game for people who want to increase their knowlegde while having fun. To play, you choose a category of 8 cards and you try, card by card, to place them at the right place in a row. When you place a card at the right place, you must answer the question on the card correctly. You win a little token for a correctly placed card and a big token if you also answered the question correctly. 28 series, 224 questions.

name: Baby Boomer
description: A trivia game with questions from 1965 to 1979 with Quebec cultural and political background. Each player has three cards in hands, on your turn you choose a card and ask the two questions. For each correct answer, players win black tokens. Some joker cards needs a die in order to know which questions to ask.

name: Les Capitales vs. les Aigles
description:
A baseball board game featuring Can-Am league Quebec teams "Les Capitales" and "Les Aigles". Designed for baseball fans of all ages, the game reproduces the sequences of a baseball game.

In Les Capitales vs. Les Aigles, each player starts with the "Throws" deck from their respective team. The home team is chosen and each player shuffles their opponents "Offensive" or "Defensive" deck and gives them 5 cards from it.

Then, each player chooses a card from their "Throws" deck and place it face down in front of them. They reveal it at the same time and, depending on the combination, the result will either be a strike, ball or contact.

In the case of a contact, the offensive player plays one of their 5 offensive cards and the defensive player tries to counter it by playing one of their 5 defensive cards.

Innings ends when both players played the defensive phase and got three outs. The game ends after 5 innings.

name: The Game of Peterborough
description:
A family game of skill, excitement and fun played in familiar surroundings.

You build your companies in the centre of the city where space is at a premium and most valuable! Can you beat the competition to become the most successful entrepreneur in town?

Complete with a beautiful playing board (which is a map of the city), 80 company cards (4 per company, 5 companies per player), 8 marker tokens, 3 dice and full easy to understand instructions. Includes fascinating information on the companies taking part.

On your turn you roll dice (once or twice) and choose how to use them to adjust your horizontal and vertical markers. These determine the position where you may (a) Add a tile, (b) Remove a tile, (c) rotate a tile or (d) challenge the owner of the tile in that space. The four tile for a company when placed in a square and correctly-oriented form the company logo, which cannot be removed/challenged. Locations nearer the middle of the city score more points than those on the edge (score is the sum of the distances from the nearest edges.

name: Lingering Hues
description:
Lingering Hues is a solitaire "tower defense" type card game. A player may play as one of the heroes, both heroes, or let a second player control a hero.

Heroes must last the night by warding off the advancing Kimryr, using a specialized dice system to match the enemy K.O. points. By playing certain "candle" cards, starting dice may be swapped for special stock of dice which eliminate higher or lower pips of the dice.

Hero traits, special abilities, and cooperation can push the battle in their favor. Players must have at least 1 Capacity Point,(health) after encountering all the enemies in the game to be victorious.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Question Impossible
description:
The trivia game that you liste at Rouge FM in the morning when going to your job has transformed itself into a board game to intertain you even more. Answer theses impossible questions that draws a wierd picture of our daily habits and where answers are even more impressives.

Question impossible: The game where you can change your mind!

name: Jane Austens Hochzeitsball: Traumpaare
description: Jane Austens Hochzeitsball: Traumpaare is a Schmiedespiele-exclusive expansion for Jane Austen's Matchmaker, in which you have to match the exact couples from the books.

name: Karten klatschen
description:
Translated from the rule book:

A lot of different pairs of cards lie scattered over the table. When revealing a card good eyes and quick hands are needed. Who keeps seeing everything and reacts fast fetches the most pairs!

The game consists of 54 cards, making 27 pairs of 2 cards each. The cards are put into a tile. Each player turns over the uppermost card on the tile and reveals it. As soon as the new card is revealed all players can put their hand on the other card of this pair, that was revealed before the current one. The player who has the most pairs when the tile is used up is the winner.

name: Create
description: The player the collects 5 Light Bulb tokens or Reaches the end of the Rainbow first wins the game. You collect Idea (light bulb) tokens by landing on them, or by getting a card giving you one, or by by thinking of ways to alter the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: You are the Ref
description:
Test your friends and family in football knowledge. Based on the classic "YOU ARE THE REF" strip from The Observer, you take on the role as a football referee.

As you move along the board you will pick up scenario cards based on the laws of the game.

Each scenario has three possible outcomes but only one of them is correct. The question is which? You have to be quick though, as in football, you don’t have long to think about your decision; only 15 seconds or the game moves on.

Each time you answer correctly, you will get a match card in the colour of the field.

The first to visit all six different colours and answer correctly will win the game. But be careful; you can be challenged in your knowledge by your opponents and might have to hand over one of your match cards.

All the scenarios and answers in the You are the Ref board game have been written by international football referee Keith Hackett and the scenario cards are accompanied by the art of Paul Trevillion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track

name: My Grandmother Went to Market
description:
A fascinating memory game and a valuable aid for developing language skills.

From the box:
This memory game consists of 112 different cards. Each card has a picture side and a word side. Played with the pictures only, the game can be enjoyed by children from 3 and by adults. A supreme test of memory and concentration it is also an excellent aid for developing language skills.

name: Dolphin Blade
description:
In this little 48 cards game from designer Sanchuu, the girls from the Ruin series are surfing the waves on the new artifacts called Dolphin Blades, trying to perform the best maneuvers.

Players must combine the color coded cards in certain order to perform the best tricks!

name: Trivial Pursuit: Wellness Edition
description:
A small version of the famous game, specially produced for the Nestle Company and it promotes the healthy ways of life.

The box contains everything you need to play, a folded board, a die, 6 different plastic player tokens with 36 pieces, and a deck of cards, that have the following categories of questions:
1. Diet and Health
2. Workout
3. Entertainment,Hobbies and Relaxation
4. Ecology and Environment
5. Science and Technology
6. Geography and History

This product is for promotional use only

name: Grow Fairy Kingdoms
description:
Grow Fairy Kingdoms is a Competitive Plant-Growing Game for 3-6
players, ages 6-and-up.

Each player starts with a Base on which to grow their plant.

There are two phases: the Day when each player chooses tiles to grow their plant, and the Night, when each Thorn on your plant is a chance to prune your rivals.

There are four main types of tiles: Stems which cause the plant to branch, Flowers for victory points, Thorns for night-attacks, and Leaves for shielding against attacks.

Rare tiles include powerful gold Flowers, Thorns, and Leaves, as well as tiles to place on opponent plants: Caterpillars (to eat opponent tiles) and Rot (to prevent growth).

In the Night phase, Thorns allow players to roll six-sided die to target the ends of rival plants.

The game ends when at least one player survives a night with at least 5 victory points.

Game comes with 98 tiles and one 6-sided die. No reading required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: 4th Fleet
description:
4th Fleet is based on the Victory Games Fleet Series system operational naval warfare featuring individual named ships, submarines, airplane squadrons, marine landing units, and smaller coastal patrol combatants.

This game covers the potential wars in The Caribbean Sea & Central America where a Nicaraguan canal has been completed.

name: Gran Jefe Indio
description:
Translated from the back of the Finnish edition box:

TOM tom tom TOM tom tom ... tactful Native American drumming raises the atmosphere, the cards turn, drumming stops and the race to find the right image begins! The one who is the fastest, slaps their hand on the right card and wins the plume into his Indian headband.

The first to get five plumes into his headband will be the Great Chief, and he wins the game!

name: Dragon & Lyre
description:
As the leader of the team, you should make the best use of the heros at your disposal.
The more wars, armors, and territories you claim, the closer you are to victory.

Powerful prophets and sacred animals will help you reverse the situation.
But watch out for other players, maybe they are figuring the same thing.

Hero cards form the player's hand cards.
Players use them to claim Legend cards, attack other players, and defend oneself.

Legend cards include Wars, Armors, Territories, and Sacred Animals.
They provide VP in different ways and are contested by players.

Players score VP by claiming Legend cards, the player with the most VP wins the game.

Summary for Game Flow

Turn flow:
Turn over 2 Legend cards, and the active player performs 3 actions.

Actions:
(A) Claim a card with your Hero.
(B) Claim a card with your Prophet.
(C) Snatch a card from another player.
(D) Recall Heros from your Hero deck.

Game End:
When the rotated card is revealed, the final round begins.
The game is played for 10/7/5 rounds in 2/3/4 -player games.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Sonodingo
description:
Learn Phonics from a playful perspective!
Consisting of 102 maps words, Sonodingo is a scalable game with 5 different levels. For each level, there is, for each card, a card that begins with the same syllable and a card that ends up the same syllable.
Simple and traditional games as mistigri, Rummy, the battle... give a touch of fun to approach the phonology.
Important step in the establishment of phonological awareness, and the process of learning to read, Sonodingo can be used from the large section of kindergarten for learning of phonetic syllables. In CP/CE1, we can also use the spelling of the words corresponding to the phonetic syllables to make understand the existence of different spellings for a phonetic syllable.
A clever system of verification helps children to correct themselves. Parents and teachers will also appreciate the beautiful illustrations and the affordable price of Sonodingo.

name: Bingo Animal Kids
description:
B-I-N-G-O! An assigning game with animals for 1-6 children, and perfect for ages 2 and up. The game will grow with your child as it includes variation for older players.

Each player receives a picture card which shows four animals. Players now take turns drawing an animal tile. If the tile matches an animal on one of the player's cards, that player takes the tile and places it on the card. The first player to collect all four tiles on his card wins the game.

name: Word Topper
description:
Word Topper is a great way to build your vocabulary while having fun with your friends and family! Use as much word building strategy as possible to try and score the most points on every turn.

GAME PLAY

Word Topper is quick to set up and easy to play. The more times you play, the more words and combinations you will learn to make.

Start by choosing a dealer. The dealer deals out six cards to every player. After the deal is over, the dealer puts the rest of the deck face down to create a draw pile. He then draws 7 cards and places them face up in the middle of the table creating the community cards for everyone to play off of.

On their turn, each player uses the cards in their hands to make the best scoring word possible by laying them on top of the cards placed in the middle. Scores their turn, then draws from the draw pile to make up for the cards they just played. The next player then plays their cards on top of the cards the previous player just played creating a new word and also new community cards. Each time a player plays the community cards and the players cards change, creating a constant change to the game every turn. Game play continues until all the cards are gone from the draw pile. The highest scorer wins.

Bonus cards include double word points, skips, wilds, and switches.

name: Transmogrification
description:
When shape shifters do battle they do with displays of their skills and strength. The shifter who best adapts to the tactics of their opponents is the victor.

Set Up
Each play gets one set of the four Form Cards. Unused Form Cards are set aside.

The Combat Style Cards are shuffled and dealt out until each player has an equal number. Un-dealt cards are set aside face down.

Objective
Be the first player to empty your hand of Combat Style Cards.

Play
Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning
The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

name: A Cha Co
description:
In A Cha Co, you become a pyrotechnician wanting to be the first to construct 10 fireworks to win the game!

Roll the dice (number is dependent upon the amount of players, n+1 formula). You choose the colour of highest quantity rolled. Then, everyone hides a gem of the colour of firework they wish to produce, with a simultaneous reveal afterward. Those who have chosen a singular colour (that no one else has selected) each receive a ring of that colour, representing one firework.

The point value system is the following:

White = 1 point
Blue = 2 points
Red = 5 points

The steps are repeated until a player reaches 10 points first and wins the game!

name: Was ist Was TV: Das Quizspiel zur TV/-Serie
description:
Google translation:

Together we are unbeatable! We know everything! Yup! You do not believe that? You want to try it really, to beat us? Well, then you sit down times!

The trivia game for the TV series is based on the facts of the popular WAW-IST WAS books. Theo, Tess and Quentin present interesting facts and exciting from six different topic areas.

The choices are; Ancient Rome, whales & dolphins, volcanoes, Planet & Space, Cars and Ritter. On the basis of 198 questions per topic, players can prove that they are attentive and well rested to go through the world. And while playing you can also learn a lot.

In the game it comes to answering questions correctly and thereby collect chips. Anyone who has ever Theo, Tess and Quentin completely, it can be exchanged for a three WAS IST WAS / point. And who has the most points at the end wins the game.

Content:
6 card sets of 32 sheet
3 fixtures printed on both sides
1 tableau cards with WAS IST WAS chips
1 character
1 set of instructions


From the Backside (German)
Zusammen sind wir unschlagbar! Wir wissen alles! Jawohl! Ihr glaubt das nicht? Ihr wollt es wirklich probieren, uns zu schlagen? Also gut, dann setzt euch mal hin!

Das Quiz-Spiel zur TV-Serie basiert auf den Fakten aus den beliebten WAW-IST-WAS-Büchern. Theo, Tess und Quentin präsentieren Interessantes, Wissenswertes und Spannendes aus sechs verschiedenen Themengebieten.

Zur Auswahl stehen; Das alte Rom, Wale & Delphine, Vulkane, Planeten & Raumfahrt, Autos und Ritter. Anhand von 198 Fragen pro Themengebiet können die Spieler beweisen, dass sie aufmerksam und ausgeschlafen durch die Welt gehen. Und beim Spielen kann man natürlich auch viel dazulernen.

Im Spiel geht es darum, Fragen richtig zu beantworten und dadurch Chips zu sammeln. Wer einmal Theo, Tess und Quentin komplett hat, kann diese drei gegen einen WAS-IST-WAS/Punkt eintauschen. Und wer am Schluß die meisten Punkte gesammelt hat, gewinnt das Spiel.

Inhalt:
6 Kartensätze zu je 32 Blatt
3 Spielpläne doppelseitig bedruckt
1 Kartentableau mit WAS-IST-WAS-Chips
1 Spilfigur
1 Spielanleitung
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Polite Murder: 6th Murderous Player Expansion
description:
The 6th Murderous Player Expansion expands the base game for inclusion of a 6th player.

This expansion includes:
11 Action cards
2 Character cards (these cards can only be used if you have the Vile Fiends Expansion!)

During game play of Polite Murder, players play action cards from their hand in which they may either do the action on the card or sometimes attempt murder on their fellow players by rolling the die. The Character cards allow the player playing the action card to +1 to die rolls or if a player is under attack using the named card on the Character card, escape murder by a fellow player.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The King's Armory: Firepower Expansion Set
description:
This expansion comes with "The Elder Wyrm Dragon" Boss monster and "The Magma Cannon" armory card.

The Elder Wyrm Dragon has 2 movement modes, and 3 Attack Options, and uses Status Effects against the heroes.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Dilemma: Mads & Monopolet
description:
Bet on what your friends would do in fun, embarrassing and uncomfortable situations.
On your turn, you are given a dilemma and have to chose, from three options, what you would do in that situation.
The other players must then guess on what you would do, and the ones that are correct will advance on the scoring track.

name: Showtime
description:
In the game it comes to celebrities. For every famous head features must be represented and guessed. You even have to convey these features your team. You may paint, show a pantomime or talk. But you have 60 seconds each time - for five terms

Based on the public domain game known as Celebrities.

name: El desafío del dragón
description:
El desafío del dragón is a game where you have to travel a dungeon with the danger of being pushed by the dragon into the abyss.
Will you arrive at your castle before the others?
Using a spinner, you have to move your knight to your tower.

Spanish description:
Un juego en el que tendrás que recorrer una mazmorra con el peligro de ser empujado por el dragón al abismo ¿Lograrás llegar a tu castillo antes que el resto? Estamos ante un juego mecánico en el que mediante una ruleta tendremos que hacer llegar a la torre a nuestro caballero.

name: Hoppin' Frogs
description: Race to be the first one to get all your frogs into the bucket! Kids can use the bucket as a target to flip their frogs into or they can just have the frogs race each other as they let their fingers do the flipping! Game comes with 12 frogs in four colors and a reusable bucket for easy cleanup and storage.

name: Ti-Joe Connaissant
description:
Ti-Joe Connaissant is a quiz game inspired directly by "Joe connaissant". Designed for children aged 7 years and older, it offers to young smart two ways to play. The reversible game board shows a cooperative version and a competitive version of the game. The puzzles cover a range of topics tailored to the interests and level of knowledge of the youngest.

Version Cooperative
Players must solve all puzzles in order to accumulate 20 points. To encourage the players have six supporters that should not be disappointed by wrong answers.

Competitive Version
Three supporters of two teams clash. The team that will solve most puzzles with the least indices and has the fewest disappointed supporters will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Monopoly: Copa Mundial de la Fifa Brasil 2014
description:
Esta nueva versión del clásico Monopoly incluye dentro de su tablero a 22 de las 32 selecciones que participaron en la Copa del Mundo: Brasil, Colombia, España, Argentina, Alemania, Italia, Holanda, Portugal, Uruguay, Francia, Chile, Inglaterra, Estados Unidos, Rusia, Nigeria, Japón, México, Ecuador, Camerún, Corea del Sur, Costa Rica, y Honduras.
Monopoly Copa Mundial de la FIFA Brasil 2014 incluye: Tablero con las 22 selecciones, 6 fichas con diseños alusivos al mundial, 28 tarjetas de título de propiedad, 16 tarjetas fuleco y 16 tarjetas trofeo, 1 paquete de dinero, 32 casas, 12 hoteles y 2 dados.



Version of Monopoly themed on the 2014 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Multinational 2
description:
Multinational 2 is a boardgame where the players have to grow their multinational company. This is done by buying stock in ten multinational corporations, and then influence stock prices by buying factories, buying countries and playing cards. All this in order to sell the stock at a better price.

A successor of Multinational with more innovative features and new game modes.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Lingua-bank
description:
Throw the die and move your pawn between the shops. Take a card with a letter, you have to say a word in 20 seconds, which begins with the letter taken and you can find in the shop you finished the movement. If you win, you earn money; if you lose, you leave your money.

Whoever earns the most money wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rumemba
description:
A memory game to frazzle the mind, a cross between memory game and rummy. 60 tactile counters, in 4 bright colours, numbered from 1-13, and 8 black counters can be used as anything.

Turn the counters face down and shuffle them around, arrange in a grid of 6 rows and 10 columns for easier play, leave random for harder play, suitable for 2+ players.

The active player turns over 3 counters of their choice, and the aim is to make a run of three consecutive numbers in the same colour, or a set of three numbers the same. If the numbers do not make a set or run, the counters are turned back over face down and the next player choices three counters to turn over, to make a set or a run. If a player turns over three counters making a set or a run, they take these from the middle and place them face up by themselves, and this gives them a score. The black counters have no numerical value, but can be used as anything to make up sets and runs with the other counters turned in a go.

The more counters you can rumemba which have been played, the greater your ability to make runs and sets. The counters all score for face value, and each player adds up the total number of points they have from the sets and runs they have won.

name: Think Big Science
description:
From the publisher:
Climb the tower to conquer the big ideas of science! Unique 3–D game board combines with important core–concept questions for a game that's exciting and educational.

Reinforces key "big idea" science concepts, content vocabulary, data and graph interpretation, and life science topics with engaging game questions

Offers opportunities to review and integrate concepts as players answer questions to climb the tower until they reach the top–level core concept question for the win

Focuses on specific content with color–coded, standards–based questions on animals, plants, life cycles, food chains, human body and more

Engages students with eye–catching graphics and game cards that feature photos, graphs, charts and diagrams

Helps students become comfortable with standardized test–style short answer and multiple choice questions

Includes 200 double–sided question cards in a storage box and an easy–to–assemble game tower measuring 3.5" in diameter at the bottom x 10.75"H

Grades 3–5

How to Play:

Answer questions correctly to race around each level
Three correct answers move player up a level
First player to correctly answer the top–level "big idea question" wins!

name: All About Vineland
description:
Another in the All About Town series. Vineland (New Jersey), 1983. Object is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel Cards by moving about the gameboard. (The length of the game may be varied by changing the number of cards required to win.)

Game includes $100 in Merchant Coupons, which have long since expired.
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: Combicolor
description:
A game consisting in 28 cards, each depicting birds in different colours. Place the cards face down on the table, throw the dice and find the card with the same colour combination. But be quick as there is only one! Improves reflexes and helps children to learn colours.

Cognitive aspects

We have based this proposed classification of toys on recent studies and investigations, as well as recent domestic and international classification systems. Our proposal aims to be coherent, unified and practical at all times.

1. Visual perception: Perceptual ability to visually differentiate the objects multiple characteristics.
2. Motor skills: Ability to perform different movements with adequate precision.
3. Hand-eye coordination: The ability to synchronize visual perception with precise manual movement.
4. Spatial orientation: The ability to maintain oneself in a space with the help of spatial references in relation to the surrounding area.
5. Reasoning:
- Concrete: Ability to select forms, categories and objects, and then link them together.
- Abstract: The ability of thought to systematically analyse the possible combinations of elements or ideas to discover specific relationships.
6. Concentration: Ability to detach oneself and keep the focus on certain elements.

name: Rooster Race
description:
From the publisher:

Help your roosters gather corn in this high low game of fowl fun! Rooster Race™ is a fun simple card game that suits all ages, from kids, teens, college students, parents, and grandparents. If you can count to 15, you can play Rooster Race. The object of the game is to make educated guesses; to predict if the value of the top card in your card stack is higher or lower than the last card played by your opponent. If you have ever played war or blackjack, Rooster Race will be your next card game favorite for family game night!

name: Playmobil: Ritterburg
description:
The Falcon Knight sneaks through the ruins of the Lion Knights’ Castle on the hunt for the valuable treasure of jewels. A knight can easily get lost on such a mission. In what castle tower is he now? Find the Falcon Knight and, as a thank-you, receive part of the treasure.

The youngest player starts. The game continues in a clockwise direction.

The person whose turn it is hides the knight underneath one of the two castle towers or under the bell tower. At the same time, the other players close their eyes or turn around and keep their ears pricked up! Maybe it gives out a telltale ring and you can work out where the knight is being concealed. Once the knight has been hidden, all the players can open their eyes again or turn back to the game and, in turn, guess where they think the knight is hiding. Each tower has a different colour, so that you just have to say the colour out loud. You are not allowed to touch or lift up the towers until everyone has had their guess.
Before the secret is disclosed, you draw your bet. If you think the knight is under the bell tower, you take two jewels out of the linen bag – no looking! If you think he is under one of the other two towers, you just take one jewel. Place the jewels in front of you (do not yet put them into the treasure chest): you only get to keep them if you have guessed correctly.
Now the player who hid the knight discloses the secret and lifts up the tower hiding the knight.
Did you guess right? Great! Then you get to keep the jewel(s) and put them into your treasure chest.
All the players that guessed wrongly throw the jewels they had just drawn into the jewel tower.
The player that hid the knight this round gets to keep any jewels that fall out of the tower.
If you have too many of one type of jewel (more than four of one colour), throw the extra ones back into the linen bag and shake well.
It is then the next player’s turn.

The first player to collect four green emeralds and four white diamonds wins the game, and leaves the castle as the victor.

name: Peoples: Migrations
description:
Over three ages of world history, tribes of different peoples move across the Earth. They found settlements, establish foreign relations and develop civilizations. Each people is led by one secret player, who rules its fate and claims its victory points. However, each people may be moved by any player and each age sees a new leader.

The player who accumulates the most victory points over the three ages wins.

The game is played on a world map of 144 triangular regions grouped in 6 continents. Each of the 6 peoples have 12 tribes that are randomly distributed over the world. Each player has a secret subject people and a secret ally people each age.

The players take turns to move tribes, always closer to populated regions where there is space left for them, and group them into settlements. The later the age, the longer the tribes may move and the bigger the settlements may get.

1. In the first age, move 1 region at the time. Found 12 villages of 3 tribes each.
2. In the second age, move 2 regions at the time (even across water). Found 9 cities of 6 tribes
each.
3. In the third age, move to any region. Found 6 metropolises of 9 tribes each.

At the end of each age, you score for your tribes in the settlements and for the settlements where your people has the majority of the tribes. Resolve ties by adding the tribes of your allied people.

In the advanced game, you may increase the settlement score by establishing foreign relations and making civilization advances. However, those increases will benefit the leader of the next age

In Peoples, you are faced with tough tactical and strategic questions. Should you enrich your people this age and risk having a poor people the next? Should you make advances that benefit several settlements or only your own? When should a settlement be expanded and when should it be abandoned? The history will judge whether you answered the questions right or wrong.

name: 寿司雀（Sushi-jong）
description:
User summary

寿司雀 (Sushi Jong) is a simple set-collection card game, where people try to collect as many MahJong-styled sets of sushi as possible. Wasabi will ruin a sushi set, but a complete wasabi will increase the points. Bad Sushi can pollute most.

name: Super HOO HA!
description:
The game uses a pack of 81 cards consisting of one Super HOO HA! card, 24 red "answer" cards and 4 suits each of 14 cards of a particular colour. Each suit consists of one HOO, one HA! and 12 "question" cards of the form "40+8"and "2x8".
Seven cards are dealt to each player, one is turned face up and the rest put face down as a draw deck.
On their turn a player should can do one of five things depending on the top card of the discard pile.
1) Play another question card of the same colour as the top card
2) Play a question card that has the same answer
3) Play correct answer
4) Play a question card that matches the answer
5) Play any HOO HA! or Super HOO HA! card
If they can do none of these they pass.
Each of the above plays has an effect, e.g. next player misses their turn.
When one player gets rid of all their cards the rest of the players add up the values of their unplayed cards and a running total is kept. The winner is the last player to reach 215.
The Super HOO HA! game consists of three 81 card packs, based on the numbrs 8, 12 and 14 respectively and only one pack is used in any one game.

name: Isle of Coconuts
description:
From the publisher:

The Isle of Coconuts is a beautiful place with lush palm trees and teams of Monkeys jumping from tree to tree competing for delicious coconuts. Roll the dice and count your chances to become the biggest team on the palm tree or be smart enough to stay away - either way, you win coconuts. Let your team be the first to gather 10 coconut tokens to win the game.

What They'll Learn

Quick Addition - Each turn, players add up the dice one of three ways to decide where to place Monkeys on palm tree fronds.

Risk vs. Reward - Players pick the palm trees where they can build the biggest team of Monkeys. Stay away from trees where there could be an all-way tie or where you might end up being the smallest team when all the palm tree fronds are full.

name: Lerne zählen!
description:
An apple, two pears, three plums? In the cards you see different images of fruits and with different amounts of numbers.
Mix all the cards and then You must try to correctly match the cards together.
The winner is the player with most matched cards.

name: Mindent a helyére!
description:
In this game for children, you need to move pawns into the holes with the corresponding shapes and earn the most victory tokens this way.
Contents:
1 gameboard
12 pawns (in 4 different color red, green, blue,yellow, and 3 different shape triangle, brick, roll in every color)
12 victory tokens
4 color tokens (in 4 different colors)
3 shape tokens
2 dice
When it's your turn, you need to take a step with a pawn. The goal is moving a pawn into a field having a hole with the same shape. When this occurs you can get a victory token. To take a step with a pawn, you need to roll with 2 dice. The first die identifies the number of steps, the second die identifies the color, so if you roll green and 2 you have to take 2 steps with one of the green pawns.
If you roll a star with the color die, you need to select a color token from the face-down pile and a shape token also from the face-down pile and these identify which pawn you must move.
The game ends when all pawns fell down in the holes.
The player with the most victory tokens wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: 1 • 2 • 3 Stapelei
description:
The caterpillar is hungry and eats its way through fruits, vegetables and all sorts of other goodies. Children help him fight his way through the largest possible number of threats. This creates a tower of cards. But be careful! If someone is not careful, the tower collapses and the caterpillar must start from scratch...

Every card has a hole in it. The first player has to stack one card of his choice over the caterpillar, always leaving the caterpillar's head visible. All players do the same, increasing the stack, and trying not to collapse the stack.
If you collapse the stack, all the other players gain a butterfly chip except you. If the players manage to put all the cards in the stack without it falling, then all players get a butterfly chip.

The game ends when one or more players have won five "Butterfly" chips. These players are the winners!

name: What Are The Odds?
description:
A roulette-style dare game where players take turns challenging each other to dares listed on black cards.

Each round, one player (The Challenger) draws a black card and challenges the rest of the players to do the task on the card. The rest of the players collectively decide what the odds are. On the count of 3, every player throws down one of their number cards. If your number matches The Challenger's, you have to do the challenge.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Mascha und der Bär: Chaos vor der Party
description:
Tidy up the room along with Masha. Before the guests turn up, each and every object must be in its own place.

At the beginning of the game, each player is allowed to turn over one tile such that it is visible for all players. Once you have remembered your pictures, turn the tiles back face-down.
The youngest player casts the die and performs the action. The die is then cast in a clock-wise direction. Each die has a different action.
You all play together, so you are allowed to give each other tips.

Once all the objects are in their right places, face-up so that they can be seen, you have tidied up Masha’s room in time and, therefore, have won!
Once Bear, Rabbit and Squirrel reach the front door, you are allowed to turn over all the tiles. If all the objects happen to be in their right places, you have still won. If, however, you haven’t managed to tidy up in time, sorry but you have lost this round and the only thing to do is play another round!

name: 片目の商人 (One-Eyed Merchant)
description:
Once this country knew of a genius merchant called the "one-eyed merchant", who regularly combined two products into a single auction to cross-sell them to the public, a process by which he built up enormous wealth.

In 片目の商人 (One-Eyed Merchant), each player bids on "cross-sold" commodities at the market, trying to gain the most money and become something of a "one-eyed merchant" themself.

name: The Three Pillars: GameHoleCon Promo Card
description: Promo Card for The Three Pillars: A Paranormal Card Game. Game text reads, "Plays in your evidence pool. This card is worth +1 O at the end of the game. May not be canceled." This was a promo card available to attendees of GameHoleCon 2015.

name: 猟奇耽異-キュリオシティ・ハンティング (Curiosity Hunting)
description: 猟奇耽異-キュリオシティ・ハンティング (Curiosity Hunting) is an expansion for Phantom Detectives that provides personalities for each of the twelve suspect cards, with those personalities translating in game terms to special abilities.

name: The Addams Family Creepy Mansion Action Game
description:
From the box:
"It's another crazy day with Gomez, Morticia, Pugsley and Wednesday! This spooky mansion is full of creaky surprises! Make it all the way to the top and the family fortune is yours!"

Players choose one of the four Addams Family playing pieces, roll the die and make their way up the plastic "mansion". If player lands on a white space, they must press down. Some white spaces trigger special traps that will knock the player back to start. The first player to make it to the top of the mansion wins.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Umi-Para-Dice
description:
User summary
海パラダイス (Umi-Para-Dice) means Sea Paradise in English.

Umi-Para-Dice is a dice game where players collect cute sea creatures (actually pencil erasers!) and make their own aquarium.

One player rolls a number of dice equal to twice the number of players, and players take turns taking one die. Each player collects a sea creature that corresponds to the two numbers of their dice taken, and place that creature onto their personal board.

The game ends when dice are rolled 12 times. Each player scores according to the types of creatures collected. Bonus scores are added by multiple creatures of a kind and positions on the personal board. The player with the highest total wins the game.

The game is for 1-2 players with one copy. Up to four players can play if two copies are combined.

Publisher's summary
サイコロを振って海の生き物を集めていく、箱庭的 水族館ボードゲーム。海の生き物は可愛い消しゴムで出来ています。サイコロを手番の人が人数×2個振って、手番の人から時計回りに、2週1つづつとります。取った2つのサイコロの目に該当する海の生き物を手に入れます。同じ海の生き物を集めたりすると、ボーナスが貰え、最後にサイコロを振って加点出来ます。
1セット1・2人用ですが、2セットで3・4人で遊べ、みんなでワイワイと遊ぶことが出来ます。

name: Going Places in the World: Globetrotter Edition
description:
The ultimate round-the-world trip!

This extended version of Going Places, with 200 destinations including islands and Antarctica, offers the ultimate challenge for the explorer. New places, new routes, but only one winner!

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 15 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 15 destinations.

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the world each round!

name: Doku No Oukan
description:
User summary:
毒の王冠 (Doku No Oukan) means Crown Of Poison in English and features the accession to the throne by use of poison.

In this game, players are King's successors and struggle to be the next King. They initially each have five lives and three rights to the throne. Each round, they secretly choose other player or the current King, who is not a player, as a poisoning target.

The most chosen player is poisoned and loses one life, but has a chance to retaliate. If that player correctly names a player who chose the poisoned player, the poisoned player steals one right to the throne from the named player or forces the named player lose one life. If the retaliation is unsuccessful, the named player does the same to the poisoned player.

If at least one player chose the King, the King loses one life, and if the King's life is reduced to zero, the game ends and the player with the most rights to the throne is crowned as the new King.

Each player has a hidden special ability. The game may change drastically when the ability is revealed and activated.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは王位継承者となって、暗殺対象を投票制で決定します。
この投票には、現国王（プレイヤーではありません）も含まれます。
対象となったプレイヤーは、自分のライフ（初期値５）を１つ減らします。
また、対象となったプレイヤーは、自身へ暗殺依頼を出したプレイヤーを「報復」として言い当てる事が出来れば、相手のライフ、もしくは王位継承権（初期値３）を１つ奪い取る事が出来ます。
外してしまった場合、逆に濡れ衣を着せられた側が、ライフを減らすか、王位継承権を１つ奪い取る事が出来ます。
各プレイヤーは真の正体があり、これを公開する事で、ゲーム展開は大きく変わります。
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!
description:
User summary:
犯人はこの中にいる! (Hannin Ha Kono Naka Ni Iru!) means "The culprit is right here with us!" in English.

This card game follows the story-line of detective novels.

Each player is assigned a character who has three characteristics: nationality, gender, and physique. Players play event cards, detective cards, trick cards, and story cards to determine the culprit's characteristics.

It is not important who is the culprit. Everyone just tries to brand another player as the culprit. You can earn big points by playing a scoring card named "The culprit is right here with us!", which steals points from other players according to the number of characteristics that they share with the culprit. Or by finalizing the game with "You are the culprit!" scoring card, when the target player has all characteristics of the culprit.

A succession of turnovers may happen in a game, so play several times and add up the scores to determine the grand champion.

There is also an expansion to the game, called Shin Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!

Publisher's summary:
推理小説のストーリー展開をイメージしたゲームです。
各プレイヤーには、国籍、性別、体格の３つの特徴を持った人物カードが割り当てられます。イベントカード、探偵カード、トリックカード、様々なストーリーカードを駆使しながら、犯人の特徴を決めていき、他のプレイヤーが犯人になるように陥れていきます。
合致した特徴分の点数を全プレイヤーから奪う「犯人はこの中にいる！」で得点を稼ぎ、「犯人はお前だ！！」カードで確定出来れば、高得点を奪って1ゲーム終了となります。
逆転につぐ逆転があるゲームなので、トータルで得点を競う連続ゲームがお勧めです。
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Take That

name: Wargamer's Guide to The Battle of the Bulge
description:
Guidon Games Wargamer's Guidebook Series WG102-200
Wargamer's Guide to The Battle of the Bulge.

Small pamphlet the compliments Avalon Hill's classic Battle of the Bulge.

Donald Greenwood, Editor
Don Lowry, Illustrator
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Gameshop Expansions
description:
This is the 5th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012), Gameshop Gladiators (2013), and Gameshop Adventurers (2014)

This expansions adds:

an additional map card to Gameshop Express

an alternate "3" card for Gameshop Workday

a new gladiator class - the Party Gamer - for Gameshop Gladiators

and two new characters - The Cleric and The Thief - for Gameshop Adventurers
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Bay Area Regional Planner
description:
Where will you zone for more homes? Get ready to negotiate!
The San Francisco Bay Area faces a housing crisis. With far more people wanting to live here than there are homes, rents have risen to record heights. However, building new housing isn't easy, with concerns about traffic, views, gentrification, and open space, to name just a few. Still, the problem can be solved, though not by San Francisco alone. You'll have to plan and build regionally.

In Bay Area Regional Planner, you'll be given some policy goals to fulfill. On each round, you'll negotiate with the other players to decide where to zone for more housing. Everyone must be in agreement, so get ready to compromise and make coalitions!

Bay Area Regional Planner is for 2-12 players and typical games run 60-120 minutes.

More than a game:
You'll have more than just fun when playing Bay Area Regional Planner: you'll be navigating real world strategies and challenges in the Bay Area planning process. Developed as an educational tool for the San Francisco Bay Area Renters' Federation, Bay Area Regional Planner tries to be as accurate as possible to actual issues and numbers. Game data on commute time and current numbers of housing units are sourced from the Metropolitan Transportation Commission (MTC) and the Association of Bay Area Governments' (ABAG) Bay Area Census. Policy goals are based on actual feedback to regional plans at ABAG's Plan Bay Area public outreach workshops, and the consensus-based decision making is an abstraction of how the public process here works.
categories: City Building, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play

name: Math Rummy
description:
Math Rummy is a children's educational game designed to teach basic addition and subtraction. It was released in the Leapfrog My Card Games set. Although it shares a name, it bears little resemblance to the classic card game Rummy.

In Math Rummy, each player is dealt eight cards, each of which show a number (both the numeral and picture showing the matching number of cartoon bugs in a jar) or a plus or minus sign. On each player's turn he or she discard cards by making an equation (x +/- y = z) on the board. If the player cannot do so, he or she draws a card from the draw deck or chooses a face-up card that left next to the draw deck. If an equation still is not possible, the player places one card of his or her choice on the face-up pile next to the draw deck and passes. Once the first equation is made, all players play off that same equation on their turn by covering all or part of it with new cards, making sure to keep the equation correct. After each player's turn, a marker is advanced on a turn track. The game ends when one player uses all of his/her cards or when the turn marker reaches the lily pad after turn ten. In that case, the player with the fewest cards wins.

name: La boîte de la langue française
description:
La boîte de la langue française is a game of various questions about French language.

The first edition contains 300 questions and the second edition 500 questions.

name: Starfleet Legions
description:
ENGLISH
Starfleet Legions is a card game for 1-4 players which takes us to a science fiction universe where humanity is threatened by the alien Insectoids: A highly hostile race intended to end our specie. You'll be in command of a infantry squad, traveling through the galaxy and eliminating the threat. Starfleet Legions is a competitive game. The squadron with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins. You'll need get the most from your 4 soldiers, equip them with the best possible weapons and use cunning tactics.

During combats, each player will be drawing and allocating result cards for the members of their squads, trying to maximize casualties and considering their strengths and advantages. All the result decks have the same proportion of cards: critical success (1), success (2), partial success (3), partial failure (1), failure (2) and fumble (1). When a card is assigned to a soldier, it can no longer be changed during that round of combat. All results are evaluated at the end of the round depending on the skills and equipment of each soldier in the squad. Requiring enemies are eliminated before those who has survived attack the squad members.

ESPAÑOL:
Starfleet Legions (Las Legiones del Espacio), es un juego de cartas de 1 a 4 jugadores, que nos traslada a un universo de ciencia ficción en el que la Humanidad se encuentra amenazada por los Insectoides alienígenas: Una raza altamente hostil, que pretende acabar con nuestra especie. Estarás al mando de una Escuadra de infantería de Las Legiones del Espacio, encargada de viajar a lo largo de la galaxia, eliminando a la amenaza Insectoide allí donde se encuentre. Starfleet Legions es un juego competitivo, en el que la Escuadra con mayor cantidad de Puntos de Victoria resultará vencedora al final de la partida. Deberás sacar el máximo partido posible a tus cuatro Soldados, equiparlos con las mejores armas posibles y utilizar sus tácticas con astucia.

Durante los combates, cada jugador extrae y asigna cartas de resultado para los miembros de su escuadra, tratando de maximizar las bajas y teniendo en cuenta sus fortalezas y ventajas. Todos los mazos de resultados tienen la misma proporción: crítico (1), éxito (2), éxito parcial (3), fallo parcial (1), fallo (2) y pifia (1). Cuando se asigna una carta a un soldado, ya no se puede cambiar durante ese asalto de combate. Todos los resultados son evaluados al final de la ronda en función de las habilidades y equipo de cada soldado en la escuadra. Los enemigos que se requieran son eliminados antes de que, los que ha sobrevivido ataquen a los miembros de la escuadra.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Word Speed
description: Players race to spell words combining the consonant cards in their hand with the vowel dice in the Dice Slide. The first to state their word wins the hand.

name: Dodge the Dino
description:
From the box cover: "Collect the eggs - but watch out for the crazy dino!"

From the publisher's web site:
"A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Each player races to collect Dinosaur eggs from the Dino's den on the rock, whilst trying to avoid the tail of the revolving dinosaur; which can knock all the eggs away. The player who has collected the most eggs wins the game. If there is a tie - the player with the most brown eggs wins.

Dodge the Dino is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. The game can help your child learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is even great fun when it's not your turn. Dodge the Dino was created to help children with colours, shapes, matching, and co-ordination along with developing the ability to play together. The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing."
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Was ist Was: Fußball
description:
How do football players train, what equipment is needed, and what is a challenge? Was ist Was: Fußball includes ten thematic cards showing football-related training, equipment, and tasks, and during play players will need to find matching motif cards to score.
