Was ist Was: Fußball includes a child-oriented manual about football for those who want to know more about the sport.

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Gespensterjagd
description:
Rocky Beach is haunted, with ghostly figures suddenly appearing everywhere!

It's time for a ghost hunt in Die drei ??? Kids: Gespensterjagd, with Justus, Peter and Bob getting in disguise (thanks to the players covering them with cards) to look as creepy as possible. But the ghosts reappear repeatedly and keep getting in the players' way. Be bold with your searching, but try not to take too many risks as you together work to put an end to the specters.

name: Lexigo RUSH!
description:
In Lexigo RUSH, you have 60 seconds to find as many words as you can using the tiles in the grid. Be creative — only words no one else found will count. The stakes rise every round as score doublers are added to the grid.

Finding words in Lexigo RUSH:

1. Twisty Paths
Words are formed by making paths through the grid. You can start each word on any tile.

2. Reusing Letters
Your words can use the same letter tile more than once. However, you can’t hop on the same tile to use it twice in a row.

3. Blank Tiles
Blank tiles can stand for any letter you want. However, if you use a blank tile more than once in the same word, it has to stand for the same letter each time.

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Liebe und Sex
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Liebe und Sex ("Unuseful Knowledge: Love and Sex") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about love and sex.

From the Publisher (translated):
"How many calories consumes a kiss? What method of contraception do baboons use? And are you allowed to shout "Yippee" during sex after 22 clock? The big questions of love - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Wie viele Kalorien verbraucht ein Kuss? Womit verhüten Paviane? Und darf man beim Sex nach 22 Uhr noch laut „Jippie“ rufen? Die großen Fragen der Liebe – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zuhause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Walloo!
description:
The poor little kangaroos are feeling bored! They've seen a lot of little rabbits hopping around, and have decided to try and catch them and make some new friends.The rabbits have other ideas; there are too many carrots in need of munching, so they'd really rather not get caught!

The players each take charge of a group of rabbits, trying to keep them away from the kangaroos. To succeed, they'll need their wits about them, and may be just a bit of luck.

name: Wolves and Seven Days
description:
User summary:
狼と七日間 (Ookami to Nanokakan) is a worker placement game, called Wolves and Seven Days in English.

In the game of Wolves and Seven Days, each player leads a clan of werewolves. They try to infiltrate a village and control it from inside.

There are six villagers in the village. You send your henchman werewolves into these villagers to control them. You gain victory points by controlling these villagers, and the highest scorer wins the game.

A game consists of seven rounds. Do the following each round:
1) Players play an initiative card simultaneously. The player with highest initiative value goes first. But if there's a tie for the initiative value, all tied players lose the opportunity to play this round. (In Japan, the mechanism that has the same cards or the tied values cancelling each other out is called "butting".)
2) Among non-tied players, in the initiative order, place your henchman on a villager. You may then activate that villager's special ability.

After seven rounds, for each villager, total your henchmen's influence points on that villager. You gain that villager's victory points if you have the highest influence points on that villager. But "butting" is applied here again; you cannot gain victory points if your influence points are tied with any other's.

Although this game is inspired by Werewolf, it is not a werewolf game. You send your henchmen in like worker placement, and determine the controller of each villager by majority of influence. And the "butting" and a little bit of bluffing are the keys to enjoying the game.

Publisher's summary:
「バッティング」とちょっとした「ブラフ」が楽しい人狼モチーフのカードゲームです！人狼一族をひきいて人間の村を支配することを目指します。
村には得点の異なる6つの地区（エリア）があり、自分の狼を配置していくことでその地区を支配することができます。
支配したエリアの合計得点が最も高いプレイヤーが勝利します。
また、各エリアにいる、特殊能力を持つ村人たちを扇動することで、さまざまな能力を利用することができます。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Worker Placement

name: E. Kensingworth Pinfield's New Game of Circuitous Meandering
description:
Subtitled: "an Adventure, From Beginning To the End.


From the back of the box: "A Game of Luck, Chance, Serendipity, Fortune, and Happenstance, Intended as an Entertaining Amusement For the Youths and their Elders."


A roll and move game. There are 51 spaces, and all even spaces have a programmed instruction. Up to 6 players roll dice, move and follow the instructions until one player successfully arrives at the end space by exact count.

Many of the instructions are witty, silly or entertaining.

name: Rocket Lander
description:
In the dice-based game Rocket Lander, players are challenged to plot a graph on a three-dimensional axis, with them escorting their ships, searching and overtaking opponents, and defending their home turf.

In more detail, each player controls a group of rockets exploring the vast world and outer space, and during play they plot information on an X, Y and Z-axis, then interpret that info to draw conclusions about what to do next.

name: Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen!
description:
Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen - is a trivia game focusing on topography of the German state of Baden-Württemberg. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Baden-Württemberg. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.

Baden-Württemberg: Suchen Sie Buchen is a local variant of the more known "Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden", which was published on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of Baden-Württembergs founding.

name: Troll dich!
description: Simple dice game. The setup consists of each player placing his pawns in a row on one side of the board. The goal is to be the first in reaching the opposite side with all his pawns. Pawns are moved by rolling a die and can only move within the own column. You can throw back other players pawns by ending your move on the same field.

name: Polynesian Voyage
description:
Polynesian Adventure is a fun and educational board game for families. The game is a voyage through the Pacific Ocean visiting several of the islands of Polynesia. Players race to the island of Hawaii as they learn about numbers, islands in Polynesia and life in the Pacific.

Gameplay
Every player starts their Pacific island voyage at the bottom of the board game. To advance, each player draws a card in turn and follows the directions provided on the cards. Number cards have varying amounts of fish on them, along with the accompanying numeral to help children learn to count and associate numerals with the counting. The player then uses that number to follow the fish along the path. There are also "bonus" cards in the deck. These cards can instantly transport a player to an island or move other players around the board. For example, the "Hurricane" card moves the player at the front of the game back six spaces. There are also bonus spaces on the board that allow players to take shortcuts on their voyage or to lose turns. The first player to arrive in Hawaii wins.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Mythology, Transportation

name: Koboldbande Schnupperspiel
description: Koboldbande Schnupperspiel is a small, promotional copy of Koboldbande containing 18 road cards, 6 Dragon cards, 3 Key cards and one paperboard.

name: Ambition II
description: Ambition II is a 2-8 player race game representing the four branches of the United States military services: Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marines. Playing pieces include 2 of each metallic tanks, ships, fighter jets, or artillery. Each player follows one of four separate career tracks in a quest to reach Washington, D.C. and the President's inner circle by rolling dice.

name: Dam-it!
description: Dam-it! is a strategy game in which players claim circles on the playsheet in an attempt to form lines of 3, 4, or 5 circles in length. The game is won by the first player to succeed in forming either eight 3-circle lines, five 4-circle lines, or a single 5-circle line. Players attempt to claim circles that not only complete lines for scoring, but also 'dam' the opponent’s ability to score.

name: Get 'Em
description:
The Cat Herding Card Game!

This simple, fast-paced, simultaneous play card game is all about balancing speed and perception.

Players race to be the first to round up 150 cats (points).There are 60 cards with point values ranging from 5-75 in increments of 5. Players try to collect 4 cards of equal value to earn that many points.

All gameplay is simultaneous. The 60 cards are divided evenly among all players so that each player has their own draw pile. At the shout of "Get 'Em" all players quickly draw 4 cards. Players can only hold 4 cards at a time. Players can put cards face up on the table, one at a time. Players can pick up cards, one at a time, Either from their draw pile or any face up card on the table. The first player to have 4 cards with matching point values in hand shouts out "Got 'Em" and scores points equal to the number on the 4 cards. Then all the cards are shuffled and redistributed and a new round begins. The first player to accumulate 150 points wins.

name: The Race
description:
From the publisher:

The Race is a fast paced drag racing game where each player tries to get to the finish line first! Pick a color, take the matching components and roll the dice. With a little luck you might become the ultimate racing champ!

The Race features a fun dice mechanic where everyone rolls their dice at the same time and compares results to determine how their race cars move along the track. The Race is heavily based on chance, but uses a bit of strategy with a well timed boost.

It's a great filler game that can be played by nearly all ages. For shorter or longer games all you have to do is change the track length, so it's modular as well! Pick up The Race today and see who, among your friends and family, is the ultimate racing champ!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Thinktangles!
description:
Is it really there.. and can you find it?

This is similar to Dobble in that there is a set of cards (of different shapes) with symbols, words and shapes on them. The difference is that there is a second set of cards which have descriptions of objects on them:

"Something that has a tail"

Against the timer each player has to determine if there is an item that matches the description or not.

To make things even more complicated there are also 2 dice which determine which shaped cards you are using in the round.

name: Which Friend
description:
Which Friend is a social game that was designed to bring friends together. It promotes interaction and laughter as the question cards tend to bring up old stories and funny instances that are unique to each set of friends that play the game. It involves thought and strategy, and is a great way to see which of your friends knows each other best.

The object of the game is to vote with the majority. Each player is given a rotating voting wheel that has a specific number on the back that represents themselves. After a question is read from the pile of question cards, each player rotates their voting wheel to display the number associated with the player they feel best represents the question. Once all players have chosen their vote and rotated the voting wheel to the appropriate number, all voting wheels shall be flipped over and set on the playing surface simultaneously. Once the votes are tallied up, any player that voted with the majority is awarded a point.

If there is a tie, any players involved in the tie must try to persuade any players that are not involved in the tie to agree with their answer and swing their vote.

name: Burg Mengenstein
description:
Overview (by the publisher): At the tournament place, the knights want to prove themselves. The colored symbol dice are thrown into the dice tower, showing new challenges every turn. The various symbols and colors have to be sorted. Which is the largest set? Skill is necessary when flicking the pieces. The more dice match the target space, the further the Knight can move.

Gameplay: The active player throws the six dice and a small wooden cube into the dice tower. The player then flicks a wooden disk. If he hits one of the target spaces, he claims the dice that show the matching result (color or symbol). Then the other players in turn order also flick the disk to try to claim some of the remaining dice. After this, the next player becomes the active player, and continues with throwing all dice into the tower.

Each die collected moves the player's knight one step forward. The first knight reaching to other side of the tower wins.

There are also rules for a variant in which the players bet which symbol they will roll, get points for matching symbols, and are able to change their bet by paying dice.

name: Komm, wir kaufen ein!
description:
With the shopping cart in the supermarket. Where is the shelf with the bananas or the milk? Colored chits have to be sorted into the correct shelves and counters, before they can be added to the cart and paid at the checkout.

The main game is a memory variant, in which the players don't have to find pairs; instead, they need to find food items that match the colored spaces in their shopping basket.

In addition, there are several simple rules for play whith very young childs: just naming the various objects, sorting the items into she correct shelves, moving them around with the plastic shopping cart, buying their favourite dish ...

name: Treasure Chest
description:
You are on a mission… to place your precious gemstone into the Treasure Chest. First player to do so wins the game. Sounds simple right?

The trick is to use the 8 supporter stones on the game board to navigate a path to the Treasure Chest. To win you must strategically plan your moves and stop your opponent in their tracks. Before they trap you.

Rapid gameplay and extremely simple rules make for incredible fun! May the best player win.

name: Cast Off: A Game of Inappropriate Casting
description: Cast Off is a party game where you’ll put actors, characters, and other voices in an audition for a well known film. You’ll score points as your team tries to guess information about the film, and who was trying out for what part, with as few as 4 people or as many friends as you’d like to laugh with.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Fluxx: The Board Game – Scramble Colors
description:
An action card for Fluxx: The Board Game. It reads:

Action - play + discard
Scramble Colors

Gather up all color cards currently in use, shuffle them together, and deal them back out.

You must do this either before or after you make all of your moves.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Little Storm Thinks
description: Little Storm Thinks is a children's game. The players are each given one wooden stick of each colour. Then one by one they roll a die with different colours on the sides, and got to take a wooden stick of that colour they get on the die. Each player also have a card (thought card) with a figure on, and have to make their figure on the card with there wooden sticks. After the dice roll a player can place as many sticks on the card that is possible. There are three versions to play the game. The easy game is played with the white thought cards. A figure is complete when the wooden sticks are in the correct places (as shown on the thought card). The difficult game is played with the coloured thought cards. A figure is not complete unless the wooden sticks are in the same colours and in the correct places as shown on the thought card. There is also a cooperative game version.

name: Calm before the Little Storm
description: Calm before the Little Storm is a children's card game of motion, concentration and memory. Each turn first begin with a part of concentration, and when the storm comes and it's time for the activity. In the calm before the storm, participants must remember the cards they draw, until they pull a Storm card, then it would be time for the activities drawn. For each motion remembered from the cards, the player can keep the card. The player in the end of the game with the most cards is the winner.

name: Waschi-Wurti
description: The players try to form certain patterns (house, tower, pagoda, double pagoda)with their tiles on the board. They get points for completing their own patterns (Waschi) or for completing patterns of their opponent (Wurti). Tile placement and movement is controlled by dice. If the player rolls a black 1, 2 or 3 he may place or move the corresponding number of tiles. On the roll of a red 1 or 2 he may move 1 or 2 tiles of an opponent player. If he rolls the black dot, he has to skip a turn. The game ends when a player gets two Waschi or two Wurti.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Merchants (fan expansion for Carcassonne: Traders & Builders)
description:
Each player has a Merchant follower that is visibly different from a regular follower.

The Merchant follower can only be placed in a city and counts for as many followers as there are wine, grain and cloth symbols on that city's tiles.

If there are no wine, grain or cloth symbols then the Merchant counts as zero followers and when the city is completed, or if in an incomplete city at the end of the game, the player will score zero points.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Chicken Drop
description:
Similar to Tumblin' Monkeys.

Take turns removing feathers. You get all eggs that drop during your turn.

The player with the fewest eggs when they've all dropped is the winner.

name: Cuba (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: they also give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but you can travel by air for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: You Bet Your Ass
description: Adult icebreaker/party game where one player picks a true/false statement off a card and reads it aloud (example, "I have played strip poker," or "I have baked pot brownies.) The other players try to guess whether this statement is a lie, or the truth. Depending on how their bet their plastic 'ass' pieces on either the 'TRUE' or 'FALSE' parts of the board, they either keep them or lose them. The last player with plastic 'ass' pieces left in play wins.
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Voting

name: Primary Dice
description: During a presidential primary, players are candidates competing to win the most delegates in a series of state elections. Players will start with one die (representing staff), and will roll to earn resources, votes, or more staff.

name: Kingmaker
description:
There was no king in the serene republic of Venice, but every year one was chosen. During the carnival at the Doge`s palace the masked ball of the false king was held. At the ball a courtly game of blind man`s buff was played where the winner was crowned king for the evening.

In this nine card nanogame players position character cards around one card in the middle of the table and guessing each others play try to become the Kingmaker and thus win the game.
The Fool will jest, the Minstrel will dance and the Courtisan… erhm prefers touch.

name: Ett Vinspel
description: Ett Vinspel is a quiz game about wine. The questions has different areas like "vineyards", "food and wine", "geography" and "grape varieties" etc. The questions are in varying difficulty. Then it is a players turn another player draws a card and read a question. On each card there is 6 questions. What question to read is selected by a dice roll. If the answer is right, one point is marked on the point block. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Yarloop
description:
Southeast of Perth Western Australia, lies the little timber town of Yarloop. Behind it are the forests of the Darling Ranges. For more than 100 years, the people of Yarloop milled timber from that forest, brought to their saw mills by a network of tramways.

Yarloop is a tile laying game where players try to place their worker on newly discovered timber coups or the expanding tram network in an effort to score points faster than everyone else.

Each player has one meeple. The Draw stack contains only 15 double sided tiles. Once the stack is empty, players pick up a tile that is already placed, flip it over and place it in new position on the map. They may then move their meeple and check for scoring.

The first to score 40 points is the winner.

name: Speed Art
description: In Speed Art, the cards have six categories on them such as landscape, sculpture, or seated figure, but on the face-down side that players don't see. Players race to try to guess which cards match in which categories.

name: The Napoleonic Wargame
description:
A book containing rules for miniature wargames covering the Napoleonic Wars using various figure scales frokm 5mm to 30 mm and various ground scales of 1mm:2yds to 1in:10yds.

From the back of the book:

A criticism levelled at many books on wargaming is that they attempt to cover too wide a period of military history. This book concentrates on one of the most active and interesting episodes in the history of warfare - the Napoleonic Wars. The author firmly believes that wargames should duplicate the conditions and events of real warfare as far as is possible within the context of a set of rules. Among the factors which he stresses are the use of realistic scales and the importance of morale. He also believes that, provided the player has done his research, the rules should be flexible enough to allow him to employ unconventional tactics. After all, neither Napoleon nor Wellington won their battles by sticking to previously accepted ideas on tactics.
This book is the result of a long experience of wargaming and painstaking historical research. Whether the reader accept the author's conclusions or not he will certainly find much both to enjoy and discuss. The text is illustrated with eight pages of colour photographs and nearly 40 line drawings.

name: Vuxenpoäng
description: Vuxenpoäng is a quiz game. The players gets "yes or no"-questions, and depending on the answer the player gets a point. The game features over 300 questions, and you compete with the other players to collect the most "adult points". The game ends with the scores added up and you find out how old you really are.

name: Bid A Letter
description: Bid A Letter for a chance to go first each round. Bids are won based on alphabetical order. On your turn, use your Letter Tile to build, expand and/or change a word in one of the four Word Chains. Select your Letter carefully, have the Letter that comes first in the alphabet to win the bid and go first. The first player to play all of their Letter Tiles is the winner
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Time Jockeys: Vatican Edition Expansion
description:
A small expansion that adds the following to the game:

The Cross

Video of the Resurrection

Video of Noah's Flood

Video of Moses Parting the Red Sea

Video of Moses getting the Ten Commandments

Video of The Last Supper

Video of the Sermon on the Mount

Video of Jesus Turning Water into Wine
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious, Science Fiction

name: Japan Ranking!
description:
"Todofuken" is interesting! Different born place, different common sense?

Do you know an amount of potatoes crop in an area of your country? How about the ranking for them? It's easy? If so, do you know 4th area?
It's too difficult! Okay, show you a hint.

This is a trivia game from the statistics data of Japan. But this is not just a knowledge game. Please remember the price cards in a super market, a history of areas in your country. Maybe you know a little bit. It's a very big hint.

The area is a flatland or a mountain? It's warm or cool? These are also a big hint. The players use any experience, memory and knowledge, try to get the top!

After this game, you will have more interesting for all area of your country.

--

ジャパンランキングゲーム！　～都道府県は面白い！～　出身地が違うと常識も違う！？

「じゃがいもの収穫量」の多い都道府県はどーこだ！？　 そんなの簡単？　じゃあ、４位までちゃんと覚えてる？
そんなの難しい？　そんな時はヒントだ、ヒントを見よう！

このゲームは都道府県別の統計資料を元にしたクイズゲームです。でも教育や勉強だけではありません。スーパーで目に入る産地や各地の名産を思い出そう！　案外覚えていませんか？
その都道府県は平地なのか、山地なのか、はたまた暖かいのか、寒いのか、きっと役に立つはずです。知識だけじゃない、自分の記憶や経験をフルに生かして、トップを目指しましょう。
「新たにわかる真実が楽しい、都道府県を知ることってこんなに面白いのか！」を体験できるゲームです。

☆ここがポイント！
みんなの出身地によって変わる常識が垣間見れます！
小中学校の社会の知識勝負と思っていませんか？　大丈夫です！　一体何年前に見聞きした情報でしょうか？　問題は「今」ですよ。

※データは2016年２月時点で最も新しいデータを使っています。

name: France (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

There are special rules for ferry journeys.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Treehouse Dreams
description:
Designer Summary

Treehouse Dreams is a card game about imagining a giant, impossible treehouse built together by the people playing the game. Each card represents a room or feature in this treehouse, and they all contain elements of who you are and the connections between you and the other players. The game is designed to ask simple questions that can reveal the deeper (or sometimes funnier) elements of who we are.

Play with people you already know, but want to know better.

User summary of play
Depending on the length of game desired, 10-20 cards are dealt among the players and everyone arranges them into a central 'tree' shape.

Taking turns, players flip cards - revealing new rooms in the treehouse and questions for the current player or all to answer. This is a storytelling game without objective win conditions.; play continues until all the players agree that the treehouse is done or all cards on the table have been revealed and answered.

name: Zachraňme svět
description:
You take on the role of world saviors. You and your team are represented by your colored pawn and you try to find the best solutions for controlling the Disasters and earn Merit points (i.e. Victory points) for that. There are colored fields on
the game board showing potential Disaster Epicenters. The type of the Disaster and the Epicenter location are determined by a die roll (place) and a card draw (type). An Epicenter token is then placed on the place of the Disaster’s origin on
the Game board and Spread tokens are placed on the adjacent fields. Players use various Vehicles during their Turns to travel to as many Epicenter and Spread tokens as possible and take care of them. Each token collected in this way results
in a Merit point. But Disasters spread and evolve. If the players do not manage to contain them in time, they can strike in full force. In this case all players must return
the Epicenter/Spread tokens – being Merit points at the same time - in the color of that particular Disaster. To mitigate this somewhat it might be wise to trade the tokens with other players for Vehicle or Control cards, or even for Permanent
points...

name: Puffing Gods
description:
Puffing Gods'' is a card game where players interpret different primitive leaders of completely mad tribes that uses their villagers to send their offerings to the "Mystery Hill" in a frantic race to please their gods. When the all-mighty receive their gifts in his kingdom, the player is rewarded with divine benefits. However, in that fervor, your flock decreases and you will have to convert the villagers of the surrounding tribes to be ahead. Be sure to send your offering before someone does.

The game is played among 3 to 6 players and consists of a hand draft gameplay. Players need to place villagers in their play area adding later some "task" cards to make them prepare the offerings, to later on, play a ritual card to send the offerings to one of the three gods available. As soon the gods are satisfied with a specific amount of offerings they reward the player with special benefits and score points for him. Different gods with unique powers grant the player interaction and fast-paced game play.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Territory Building

name: Japhet Jenkins' and Sally Jones' Visit Tu Bosting
description:
The rules say the full title of this 1868 game from Milton Bradley is: "A Side-splitting Account of Japhet Jenkins' and Sally Jones' Visit Tu Bosting with the Old Meere and a Load Uv Pro-Duce", subtitled "A facetious fund of funny fancies from fact and fiction".

One part of the game consists of a booklet with title page, publishing information and preface, followed by a 20-page story told in a kind of country-bumpkin dialect and containing many blanks. The other part of the game is made up of 162 small (2.5" x 1/2") cards each printed with a noun and one or more other words (e.g. "A rusty rasher of bacon" or "A fighting parson").

One member of the party is designated as the narrator, and the small cards are distributed equally among the rest face down. As the narrator reads the story, he points to one of the players as he gets to each blank, and that player turns over his top card and reads it aloud. Merriment ensues.

name: Cotto & Frullato: The Game
description:
Cotto & Frullato is a game for only cool people. You've been recruited into a team of legendary action movie stars in the most epic competition in history. Finally the world will see who will be the best badass of all. Your task will be to taste different dishes that have been blended to pulp, recognize their nutritional benefits and assign them to each star of your team, in order to bring him / her to their highest physical supremacy.

All the stars will face 4 Challenges: Strength, Resistance, Coolness and Charisma. But as we all know, physical strength is not enough. To win the Challenges you will need to let your stars drink cooked and blended dishes, so that every fiber of their organism can be pervaded by the right nutrients. Carbohydrates increase the strength, Fats increase the resistance, Proteins increase the coolness and Vitamins increase the charisma. Pay close attention, because the final victory will depend on your choices.

First of all each player gets 2 or 3 stars each (according to the number of players), revealing them.
There are 2 stages: in the first one each player get some cards that represent dishes that have been blended with a drink. Each dish is divided into 5 ingredients. Players will place on the table 6 tokens (5 ingredients and 1 drink). All tokens are true (so they have a correspondence with those indicated on each card) but one, that is false. The opponents should guess whether an ingredient is true or false. They bet on one of theit choice thanks to their own double-faced token (1 side indicates TRUE, the other side indicates FALSE). Clearly betting on the false ingredient is harder, but it gives you a lot of rewards.

Betting on ingredients allow players to obtain nutrition cards, that can improve the basic values of the stars. Carbohydrates improve Strength, Fats improve Resistance, Proteins improve Coolness and Vitamins improve Charisma.

After all players played their dish cards allowing the opponents to guess ingredients and collect nutrition cards to assign to their stars, the stage 2 starts.

All stars will face 4 challenges: Strength, Resistance, Coolness and Charisma. Players reveals all cards of each challenge assigned to the stars. The character with the highest score gains 3 victory points, the second only 1. In case of tie all characters at the first position gain 2 VP, while all characters at the second one gain 1 VP.
Then pass to the second challenge and so on. Each character, however, has a skill that can influence several moments of the game, making the results of the challenges always unpredictable.

At the end of the game, the team's player with the highest rank (calculating the total amount of rewards of each star of his team) is the winner. In case of tie, the player with more nutrition cards assigned to his team is the winner. In further case of tie, players share the victory.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Adventures of a Mailman
description:
Simple roll-and-move Board game with penalty and bonus spaces, set in the bushranging days (1840s-1850s) of the Australian colonies of Victoria and New South Wales. The board depicts the pre-railway horseback mail route route either from Melbourne Post Office westward to the Town of Ararat, or from the Sydney Post Office westward over the Blue Mountains to Bathurst. Hazards include broken bridges, bushrangers and bushfires.

At least three versions appear to have been published.
The first, apparently from the 1890s, is set in Victoria. The Melbourne Post Office is depicted anachronistically as is was after the completion of its clock tower in 1887, and the race route is via Melton, Moorabool, Bacchus Marsh, Mt. Egerton, Lal Lal Creek, Mt. Buninyong, Lake Burrumbeet, and Mount Cole to Ararat, with an alternative route via Laverton, Werribee, Little River, North Shore and Geelong. Ararat asylum is shown as two small single-storied cottages. Hazards include bushrangers and bushfires. This version was specified as being for 2 to 4 players.

A second version, published c.1900, also depicts the Melbourne-Ararat route, but without the alternative route via Geelong. The quality of artwork and printing is improved, and the Ararat asylum is depicted as three large two-storied buildings. It was also billed on the back of the board as being for 2 to 4 players.

A third version of unknown publication date features the Sydney to Bathurst route and is subtitled "a great entertainment". This version came with at least 5 playing pieces, so presumably was for 2-5 players. The rules-sheet includes an adventure story of a mailman's adventures along the route, intended to be read before playing the game, and which included footnotes relating the events of the story to the various penalty and reward spaces.

name: Nimble Words
description:
Crossword dice game. 13 cubes with one letter on each face, except one blank face on one cube, with a plastic cup. Letters have values similar to Scrabble.

The box says "No. 143" Kohner probably released this at the same time as their Tumble Words (which has dice in three colors, without values, and has "No. 142" on the box). The company address has no ZIP code, so it's probably from the early 1960s if not older.

name: Zoker
description:
Zoker is a rethinking of common playing cards.

Instead of 4 suits and values between 1-14 each card has three qualities which are Color, Size and Corners. These each have four different values, totaling 64 cards.

Zoker basic set includes playing cards and rules for four different games that are variations from card games or original designs.

Zoker Solo is a variant of a solitaire. In Solo your job is to gather as much cards into piles on a bottom row of set up.

Zoker Memo is a variant of a common memory card game, played with sixteen cards at a time, filling up the empty spaces on table when needed.

Zoker Tiko is a trick taking variation of the common trick game.

Zoker Kubo is abstract card placement game where you try to collect diagonal sets throughtout changing and evolving square of cards. Player who gathers most points from scoring diagonals wins the game.

Homepage of the game has multiple other rules although most of them are only in finnish at the moment.

name: Disturbed Friends: Exclusive Review Pack
description: This exclusive expansion pack was available for the first 1,000 people who reviewd the base game Disturbed Friends[/thing] on amazon.com. It contains 18 cards (16 question cards and 2 #WINNING cards).
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Cat and Koban
description: ネコトコバン ねこかぶりへん (Cat and Koban) is a fast bluffing game. Each player has an identical set of cards, 1, 2, 3, and cat, and lays them out in numerical order increasing to the right, with the cat in any position in the row, with a stone above one card that acts as a doubler. The dealer for the round lays their cards out similarly. If the dealer's cat is in the same position as a player's cat, that player receives no points for the round, otherwise the player receives points equal to the sum of the cards from the left of their cat to the next player's cat. After everyone has been the dealer once, the highest total score wins.

name: Das Distanzreiten
description:
This game is about a horse race from Berlin to Viena and vice versa in 1892. One space represents 10 Kilometers. Movement is determined by a 18-sided die. The die results are as follows:
blank side: 1 space forward (rider leads his horse on foot, 6x)
Schritt: 2 spaces forward (pace, 2x)
Trab: 3 spaces forward (trot, 2x)
Galopp: 4 spaces forward (2x)
Carrieré: 5 spaces forward (1x)
Verirrt: 1 space backward (lost, 1x)
Gestürzt: stay (fallen, 1x)
Rast: stay and pass a turn (rest, 2x)
Lahm: drop out of the game or start again at space 1 (lame, 1x)

The game is probably from the 1890s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cycling Stars
description:
Cycling card game, the player who can deplete the other players deck wins.
Each card features famous cycling champions including Laurent Fignon, Roger De Vlaeminck, Tom Simpson, Joop Zoetemelk, Eddy Merckx, Bernard Hinault, Fausto Coppi, Jacques Anquetil, Alfredo Binda, Eugène Christophe, Gino Bartali, Fabian Cancellara, Bradley Wiggins, Mark Cavendish, Cadel Evans, Erik Zabel or Marco Pantani.

Via hand management players have to beat the other players using skils from their champions like panache, climbing sprinting or stamina.

The player who can run the other player's deck down wins the game.

name: World of Strangely Card Swap
description:
Card Swap is a 2-5 player, fast-paced game that challenges your memory and strategy skills against your opponents'. It's easy to learn for most ages and great for family game night!

Play to collect all four of the same card by swapping with cards around the table. Try to remember where cards have been moved to steal the win!

name: Out of sight
description:
From the rulebook:
Aim of game: To get all the Indian Braves of your color in the tents.
The number of Indian Braves used in a game depends on the number of players.
Each player selects a color and takes the pieces on that color. The first player spins the arrow. When the arrow stops he then takes as many tents as the number the arrow points and places each of the Indians under a tent. Each player proceeds in a like manner. Soon all tents will be occupied. At this point, they are all mixed.
From now, each player spins the arrow and takes tents off Braves already covered to the amount as shown by the arrow. If the Brave under a tent belongs to another player, he replaces him with one of his own. If it is his own he leaves it there and it counts as part of his go.
The first player to have all his Indian Braves in tents is the winner.

name: Grand National Victory: A New Game
description:
This post Civil War spin-and-move game is notable both for its historical value and its sales technique. The board has a track of 100 circles starting at Washington and ending in victory at Richmond. The game requires a 1-8 spinner, and players use toy soldiers as tokens.

Each circle is marked with a battle, place, person or unit that took part in the Civil War. Some spaces are setbacks (Bull Run at 20 sends a player back to Washington), while the Andersonville and Libbey prison spaces traps a player until another player reaches a prisoner exchange space.

The back of the board both describes the game and shows how it was sold. A veteran soldier "or his agent" would leave a game card on doorsteps for residents to play freely, and then would "call in the morning for 10 cents, as it is earnestly hoped you will patronize", signed "A Boy in Blue". The rest of the back features the words to the patriotic song "We Saved the Union for You".

name: The Medfly Game
description:
This satirical roll and move game for two players pits then and current California Governor Jerry Brown against the Mediterranean fruit fly, which first was seen in the state in 1975, and became a scourge to the state's agricultural industry in subsequent years. The spread of the Medfly created a political crisis in 1981 for Gov. Brown, and led to the start of aerial spraying in the state. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_California_medfly_attack).

Most squares on the game track are either California counties or products, with their populations and annual agricultural production value listed. Players who land on a crop space take a card with a joke event that boosts one player and penalizes the other. The Brown player deploys four Malathion tokens and the Medfly player four larva tokens, which act as landmines sending the other player back four spaces.

If the Jerry Brown player wins, he makes it to the U.S. Senate and becomes a potential presidential candidate for 1984. If not, his political ambitions are crushed.

name: Praktika
description:
Praktika is a cooperative game for "adult or fairly adult" players that bills itself as "the only useful social game". The goal is to get the playing piece to the end of the Snakes and Ladders-esque board and communally answer trivia questions to avoid getting penalty tokens that might end the game in a loss. Some questions have no clear-cut answers and players are encouraged to discuss freely (and even disregard the answers given if they disagree with them).

This is a translated and adapted version of the Canadian game Untrivia by Jim Deacove. In addition to including legal, historical and social questions appropriate for a Swedish context, the layout of the board is different and the categories for questions are fewer.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Tricks and Traps Treasure Map Game
description: Play as Jake and his friends or Captain Hook and search for buried treasure! Explore the island by rolling a dice to move around and use Search Cards to help find the treasure’s location. Players eliminate locations by using Search Cards guessing colors, shapes, or cardinal directions (in the advanced game). Once a player thinks he knows where the treasure is they can use a Search Card that says "Dig" to dig for treasure. The player who finds their treasure first wins! Comes with dry–erase boards to help keep track of your clues! Every game is a new treasure hunt!
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Macho
description:
Description from the publisher:

Toughest Card Game Around

A Party Favorite Card Game

MACHO... STRONG... COURAGEOUS...
that's what it takes to turn the next card in this exciting, fun game of cards.

The higher your score, the more MACHO it takes... Do you have it?

Any player starts the game by drawing and laying face up on the table one, or as many cards as he chooses, but he must draw at least one card. He may stop at any time. The points on each card are counted until the player stops, and are added to his score, unless he turns up a hog or a pig card during the draw. Hogs and Pigs can take away a player's points. Other MACHO cards can force a player to draw five cards with possibly devastating consequences. A game ends when a player scores 100 points or more. It's Press-Your-Luck-style gaming as you must choose carefully when deciding to draw the next card!

name: Super Fighting Robot
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Super Fighting Robot, you Punch, Block, Counterattack, Pulse, Energize, and Repair your way through the grueling gauntlet that is the Super Fighting Robot Championship!
Defeat 4 robots plus the final boss challenge to claim supreme victory! The game comes with 8 different robots.

Choose a robot, add their specialized moves cards into the deck, and then battle by drawing and assigning moves 1 at a time to the 2x4 Ring. Cards in slots 1-4 are your opponent's moves and cards in slots 5-8 are yours! Spend energy on power ups to help deliver the final blow, but watch out, energy is in limited supply!

Super Fighting Robot is a solo game designed for the 2016 Solitaire Game Contest.

name: High Risk!: Expansion Module 1.0
description:
Description from the publisher:

Now enhance you High Risk! system with this exciting new Military module! Continue the Struggle with SAC Bombers, Electronic Countermeasures, Surface to Air Missiles, Rapid Deployment Forces or Tactical Nuclear Weapons under your commend!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Embargo
description:
Embargo is a pick up and delivery game with play mechanics similar to Monopoly or Easy Money, but laced with political jabs...just look at the box cover. The game challenges players to deliver 9 barrels of oil to a port in each country, while trying to avoid going broke. Landing on a competitor’s port (occupied by their colored barrel) makes you roll and multiply the dice together, then multiply them again by one thousand- ultimately paying that cost to the owner of that port.

While the goal is to deliver a barrel to each country you can forego that objective by placing all your barrels as strategically as possible, hoping to bankrupt the other players. This is a risky endeavor since you are preventing yourself the opportunity of an outright win, and you may end up going broke yourself while pursuing the rapid acquisition of ports.

With 4 players, ships are divided into pairs which navigate the oceans in opposite directions. Collisions with other ships are just one of the hazards when seafaring around the globe. Landing on an "Embargo" space causes you to pay $25,000 or lose your precious cargo of oil. Choosing the latter causes you to lose a turn the next time you want to reacquire another barrel of oil. Other spaces can reward you with a cash payout, which you can possibly double or triple with another roll of the dice...but beware, the wrong dice roll means you get nothing. Some spaces allow you to draw a card, most of which are fortuitous but some will be detrimental to your pocketbook.

Money can be tight in this game unless you land on a money space or the start space (yes, passing start nets you nothing), you draw a card or you have other players land on your ports. The player that delivers 9 barrels first or forces everyone else into bankruptcy is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Summoner
description:
Description from the designer:

The Summoner is a one-player mission-based board game inspired by “count-and-capture” mechanics of Mancala along with some random card draws. Instead of using a number to represent mana (magical points), this game introduces a new concept of using mana token to form patterns on the board. When the mana pattern on the board matches the mana pattern of a monster, you can capture that monster. Each monster captured along the way will give you more power and higher chance to complete the mission.

Your objective is to complete all 3 missions assigned by the Elders. Through the course of your adventure, you will encounter various monsters in different lands. Each land has a special environment that will weakens your life and power. You need to endure through these environments and complete all the missions to achieve the title of Master Summoner.

name: Cat-A-Pillar
description:
Description from the publisher:

After an unfortunate autocorrect mistake, a mad scientist attempting to create elemental cats with 9 lives has instead created elemental cats with 9 limbs - and counting, as the cats are mutating more arms by the minute! Armed with their new elemental powers, the cats are now engaged in a fierce battle for dominance - and with the ability to absorb limbs from their fellow mutants, some dismemberment is bound to happen.

Reign supreme as the longest cat in Cat-A-Pillar, a 3-6 player card game about building long cats out of things like dragon wings, or shark fins, or...cherry blossoms? Use your special limbs to dismember your friends’ cats, then add their limbs to your own body to become the longest (and best) cat on the table!

Each round, players have the oppurrtunity to both draw from the deck and steal another player cat’s limb and add it to their own cat. Drawing from the deck can also get you powerful Catastrophe cards, which will help your cat become longer, faster. The first player to reach 9 limbs and shout “Cat-A-Pillar” wins!

name: Spider's Cradle
description:
Game description from the designer:

Spider’s Cradle is a 2 to 4 player cooperative board game where you play as spiders trying to capture insects in a spider’s web. Players work together to build a web out of rubber bands laid across wooden dowels. Recommended age is 4 and up due to the game’s minimal dexterity requirements and small components. Set-up and break down takes about 2 minutes each, while learning to play takes about 5 minutes. For your first time playing, from set-up to putting things back in the box takes about 45 minutes. A normal game will last about 30 minutes.

Spider’s Cradle is very quick to learn and play, especially for young children but offers dynamic spatial challenges for adults. Because the game is cooperative, parents can work directly to physically help children play and beat the game together. Spider’s Cradle allows everyone to feel accomplished as each player will contribute to winning the game.

name: Hipster: Teenage Wasteland
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Strategy is the name of the game as you compete to be the coolest in town in 'Hipster: Teenage Wasteland'. Collect your gear and play against others in your quest to be hipper than everyone else. But watch out, because once things become too cool they're no longer cool. When stuff becomes too cool it goes away, replaced by newer, cooler stuff no one is into. If you're gonna win, you gotta be on the cutting edge! Can you be faster, can you be cooler, can you be Hipster?

name: Government Worker
description:
Simple 2-8 player card game with two separate decks that will comprise a players hand or cards immediately played - the "Work" deck and the "Draw" deck. The red Work cards cards adds hours worked to your hand. The Draw deck is split between blue "Dick Off" cards that subtract hours worked to your hand and green cards that are played (read) immediately, then discarded.

Each round, players receive four Work cards, then, in turn order, they draw a card from the Draw deck until a "Time Cards Due" card is revealed. As players draw cards from the Draw deck they either read and immediately play the green cards or add to their hand the blue "Dick Off" cards. Once the "Time Cards Due" is drawn, the round ends and players add their "Work" card hours and subtract their "Dick Off" card hours for their net score. Play continues over a series of rounds (determined by the players) with the player with the lowest number of hours worked declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: 7 Seize
description:
7 Seize is a speedy battle of pirate wits that anyone can play with common bits & bobs found around the home along with a standard deck of cards. The Kickstarter includes deck up playing cards with custom art, 49 pieces of booty, and a box that transforms into a balance scale.

Players have 7 rounds to collect as much booty as they can. At the end of the game they weigh their pieces and the heaviest collection wins!

In each round starts with players wagering for the powerful role of Captain. Then the Captain divides some booty into 2 piles. Finally, players play another card to try to seize the best booty. They take turns grabbing pieces in order of rank from Ace to 2.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hästspelet
description:
Hästspelet is action-packed, eventful, fun and exciting game for everyone.

Hästspelet is a board game where you compete against each other to become the first to achieve three milestones.
These three milestones are: building up the horse farm, win races and to collect a certain amount of money.

The game can be played at three levels: local, regional or national.
The levels affect the playtime and requirements of the milestones.

Some of the things that can happen during the game, competing in dressage, jumping and trot, chasing money, questions and fun and less fun "Mockor"
Mockor are random events that can affect both you and others of good and evil.

The questions for the game are mixed in different categories and divided into three age groups: children, youth and adults.
This means that you will compete on the same terms.
The questions and "Mockor" are on an APP that is available for free download for both Android and Apple.
The APP requires no internet connection after installation.

You don’t have be a horse person to play this Hästspelet, likewise to you don’t have to be a broker to play monopoly.

Preparations
It requires the free app Hästspelet downloaded to a phone or tablet.
The app contains the questions and mockor needed to play. The download and installation takes a few minutes. The app requires no internet connection after installation. In the meantime you can prepare the bank with banknotes and read the rules. Unfold and place the game board so that everyone reaches it. Before the game begins, all players must agree on what level they will select.

The start
Start by placing the buildings "house and stables" in all the blank squares on the game board. This area represents each player's horse farm. Then distribute the SEK 50 000, a horse farm card, a holder for the game piece and a horse for all participants. The horse should be the same color as the two boxes labeled "Inackordering" on the board.
All then select the respective game character piece, attach it to its holder that has the same color as the horse. Place the game character piece in the starting box. Let a roll of the dice to decide who starts playing.
Always roll two dice during the game (with the exception of mockorna). The order is always clockwise. The bank pays out 30 000 SEK each time a player passes the starting box.

The milestones
Milestone 1 - Build a horse farm
Horse farm built by landing on the "Mäklare” (Broker) ", where the player can buy buildings to their horse farm. You can buy several buildings at the same time. Read on horse farm card for more information.

Milestone 2 - Gain Diploma
Diplomas obtained by winning races. The Bank manages the distribution of the award to the winner of a contest, with the prize money standing on diploma card.
The winner and runner-up parts of the money in the pot. If the pot is uneven it is awarded to the winner advantage.

Milestone 3 - Cash
Cash acquire it through: to win races, coming second in the competitions, the boarders at your horse farm, answering the question right, pass the Start box, some mockor and on the horse market where you can sell.

There are special Contest Rules for "jumping", "Dressage" and "racetrack" because it is a competitive element of the game that often occur. Much because of the desire to win money, which in turn generates that one can buy buildings to their horse farm. Last but not least, you will gain a diploma when you win.

There are rules for three and two players and rules for five and four players that is slightly different from when there is 6 players.

What makes this game a little unique is precisely the balance of the questions and mockorna, racing adrenaline and the crazy events that may occur in mockorna. And also fun with an APP for a board game, it makes it feel new and fresh.
categories: Animals, Dice, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Danger Mouse Secret Agent Card Game
description: Play a card with the same same symbol or colour as the top card of the discard pile. First player to play out all their cards and shout 'Danger Mouse!' wins.

name: Koth: Chronicles of War
description:
Koth is a two-player, fantasy-themed duel card game in which players assume the roles of the two attendents (Sina or Ames) of the god of war; Koth of the game world, to decide the outcome of a battle between Orcs and Humans.

The game consists of a single deck of 52 cards. It is shared by both players to draw cards. There are 20 different kinds of units in the deck and these units are commanded onto the battlefield. Each unit has an ATTACK and a DEFENSE value. These values are used to dominate (attack) and hold (defend) a column. Some units also have ABILITIES (band, flank, rage, rally, and support) which give units additional skills than these two.

The battlefield is divided into five sections. Each section is called a "column" and players compete to dominate those columns. To dominate a column a unit's ATTACK must be at least equal to the unit's DEFENSE that is holding it.

Players have 10 Command Points (CP) for each round and they can command as many units as they please -provided they don't go over CP. Each unit has a CP cost equal to its ATTACK value.

Players start the game with three cards and draw one card at the start of their turns, and they take turns to command units onto the battlefield.

To win a game, one player must either control all of the five columns. In cases which this is not possible (i.e. when there's no more cards to draw and/or play) the player holding the most columns win the game. And whenever a player wins two consecutive games s/he wins the battle.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Il nuovo gioco dell'oca + La lepre e la tartaruga
description:
A box with 2 games:
1) Il nuovo gioco dell'oca
A mix between The game of goose and Ludo. Each player tries to move his 3 geese to the end of path (2 adult and 1 child): during his turn he rolls the die and moves one goose. According to the square he lands, he can move forward, backward, roll again or move back an opponent goose to closer lake. If 2 or 3 geese of the same player are on the same square, they are safe. An adult can "eat" an opponent child, a child can't "eat" an opponent adult.

2) La lepre e la tartaruga
A racing game for 2 players, based on the Aesop's tail "The hare and the tortoise".
Each player rolls the die and moves his figure, then he can put a tile on the path and/or move again if he lands to a tile or a square with a number. Each tile has a number between 1 and 3, with + or -: so a player will move forward or backward 1-3 squares.
The game ends after one player completes 2 rounds.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Geek-opoly
description:
Classic game of Monopoly with a geek twist.

Publisher's description:

ALL HAIL THE GEEK!

Although it may not be good for their skin, geeks are enjoying a day in the sun. A seismic shift has taken place in our culture and geeks are moving toward world domination. Once a disparaging term, geek is now most often used to indicate someone of higher intellect with superior knowledge of a subject. It's a salute to genius!

Celebrate Geekatude with Geek-opoly. Gather a group of like minded individuals who are up to code and advance to Go Geek! Buy your favorite geek chic properties and up the rent with Gigabytes and Terabytes. It's all fun and games until you're sent to Internet Down, and you're out for three turns as other players roll on to Geekdom.

Who knows? You may soon be elected Alpha Geek... or you may be busted for trolling the Internet. Whatever happens... be eccentric, enthusiastic, and intelligent, you know... a geek.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Phineas and Ferb: Mission Achterbahn
description:
Phineas and Ferb have a mission: They want to build the coolest rollercoaster in the world. With tactival thinking and luck, you can make it together. But beware: taddle-tale Candace and the mean Dr. Doofenschrmirtz will do everything to destroy the build!

The player flips a few coins. If they land with the right side up, they get to move their token. This way they can collect pieces of their own puzzle, which shows a picture of the Rollercoaster! The first one to collect all the different pieces, AND makes it to the House, wins!
There is a risk, though. Candace can also move, and when she gets home before one of the players, she will tell mom and the plan is foiled!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Johnny's  Boneyard
description:
Every legend has a beginning and every famous skeleton like Johnny the Skull had to start somewhere. Where would that be if not at the graveyard!

To play this game the first thing you should do is find a place with dim light. We suggest going to the nearest graveyard at night to play, but we feel that might be too creepy! A darkened location is best because the skeleton bones glow in the dark.

On the count of three, both players should start excavating to become the fastest digger on earth. One player is collecting green bones and the other player orange bones. Use the shovel to move the dirt and uncover the elusive parts of our friend, Johnny. When you find a bone of your color, seize it with the eerie tweezers and put it next to the other pieces you have found on the glow in the dark diagram.

The winner of this unusual game of digging out a skeleton from a graveyard is not the one who finds all the bones first, but the one who can put all the pieces where they belong. The first player to build Johnny's skeleton will be the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Horror, Humor

name: Zecchino d'Oro
description:
The official board game of Zecchino d'Oro: a TV Show competition where small children sing a song.
Players have to perform some tests to earn tiles to complete their mini puzzles.
The current player rolls the die and, depending on the square he lands, perform one of the following tests:

Answer to a curiosity concerning the Zecchino d'Oro and its most famous songs;
Complete the verse of a song, choosing one of three options proposed;
Sing, mime or draw a song, so the other players can guess it;
Draw 2 cards with images and invents a verse by being inspired by them.


If the test is successful, the current player can find out 2 tiles placed on the table: if they belong to his minipuzzle, he can keep them, otherwise he puts them in their place, always face down. Anyone can try to remember the location of their tiles, to discover them during his turn.
The player who completes their mini puzzle first, is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Princesses & Unicorns
description: In Princesses & Unicorns, players use their identical decks to bid on three types of prizes — crowns, gowns and frogs — because a princess needs as many of these to pick from as possible. The Fairy Godmother will let you choose a prize whereas the witch will cost you a point...

name: English Civil War
description: Simple strategy wargame on a map of central England in the 1640s. The winner after fifty turns is the player controlling the most towns. Combat uses 2d6. Published in a limited edition of thirty copies.

name: We Are Dragon
description:
You play as one of the heads of a three-headed dragon named
Josh who has captured the Princess. You and the other
players, i.e. the dragon’s other heads, will have to deal with
endless daring knights, a horde of the Princess’ defenders
and loads of other challenges, all while flirting with a lovely
Princess. Try not to let the dragon down and do your best to
stick with him until the end. That means not spending all your
money, or charming the capricious damsel more than the
other heads.

Gameplay: there is an event every turn that requires the attention of a dragon (for example, if you are attacked by a knight, or there is a thunderstorm, or if something like that happens). Each player-head suggests a solution (basically, it all boils down to an auction to minimize the resources needed). Those who can solve the problem with the least effort win the favor of the princess. If the problem appears insoluble, the entire dragon suffers – for example, a knight hits it hard with a sword. A few turns “lost” this way end the game. In the end, this is a balance between the cooperative part (benefits the entire dragon) and the individual one (to become the most efficient manager among other heads). And, of course, the princess herself occasionally assigns tasks – and the princess’s card additionally defines which methods she likes most.

Contents:
• 9 player cards (dragon heads);
• 3 two-sided princess cards
(six beauties in all);
• 30 dragonfire cards;
• 15 spell cards;
• 8 defense cards;
• 7 gift cards;
• 18 cards with daring adventurers
to defeat;
• 6 unexpected move or
“force majeure” cards;
• 6 tokens representing
Gosha’s health;
• 24 coins;
• rules.

name: QB8
description:
Description from the publisher:

QB8 is an engaging game of balancing the accumulation and retention of game cubes. Each cube displays one of four colors AND a number between one and six. In order to win, a player must be in possession of exactly two cubes each of all four colors AND where all eight numbers on those cubes, when added together, total exactly 28. You must only have eight cubes in your possession to win.

It's not as difficult as it sounds but it does require some concentration and some playing strategy. The goal of each turn is to acquire a game cube. While that's not guaranteed, the rules make it pretty easy to accomplish. At the end of each turn, a player is allowed to "discube" - or get rid of an unwanted cube - thus engaging in the act of balancing which cubes a player retains in their effort to obtain a winning combination of eight game cubes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Pexino: Vláček
description: Innovative take on Memory with added strategic layer. Players are trying to find sets on the grid 10x9 of face down cards. But here they are not trying to find just two same pictures. Players can collect same colour of wagons or same purpose (postage wagons, coal wagons etc.), than add matching goods from hand (postage bags, coal etc.), they also need locomotive for every five wagons.

name: Quoin
description:
Triangular domino game. Numbers are on sides of dominoes rather than the points (as in Triominoes)

Numbers on played tiles must match all adjacent tiles.

Points scored per lay are the product of "free numbers". These are the numbers on unmatched sides of both the laid tile and all adjacent tiles.

name: To Windward!: The Lunar Islands
description:
To Windward!: The Lunar Islands is a 2-4 person competitive, historical Euro-style tabletop game inspired by the Golden Age of Sailing.

It is a competitive, strategic tabletop game which realistically captures the excitement, danger and unpredictability of life at sea. Players command their own fleet of ships in an effort to establish themselves as the dominant naval power in the Lunar Islands. The scales of power can shift suddenly all with a change of wind or an enemy's skills as a master gunner, skilled sailor, or clever scoundrel.



How to play

Set upEach player gets a Home Island a sturdy Sloop to begin their quest for adventure and riches and the race to gain the most Power & Influence over the islands.



Player turn

1- Check WindCheck wind timer and reset wind direction if necessary.



2- Perform actionsDuring their turn a player gets 4 actions.


Sail up to 2 steps leeward or straight to leeward
Sail 1 step to windward (may not sail straight to windward)
Use Gunnery card
Use a Sailing card
Dock/Go to town
Upgrade a ship
Buy a new sloop
Relaunch a sunken ship
Dive for sunken treasure
Buy up to three cards (Sailing and/or Gunnery) for 2 gold each
Buy 1 Power and Influence token for 8 gold (once per turn, not allowed during final round)




3- Collect Power and Influence tokens & claim accomplished Missions
+1 Selling cargo for 2 gold per ton during a docking action
+1 Buy Power and Influence for 8 gold (not allowed during final round)
Sink an enemy ship
+2 for a Sloop
+3 for a Frigate/Barque
+4 for a Indiaman/Man o' War



All awards doubled during final round



4- Draw and carry out 1 Event card

The WindThe wind can be an unpredictable ally or fierce opponent. It dictates how far and which directions ships can sail and a change in the wind change quickly shift the balance of power.



Sailing & FightingA players hand consists of Sailing and Gunnery cards which are used then discarded to move across the board with ease, to attack other players ships or perhaps fend off an opponent. The diversity and strength of these two decks can turn vulnerable seeming Sloop into a fierce or wily opponent.



TradingBy filling a ship's hold with one of 3 commodities in the game and trading it to the neighbouring islands, players can begin to amass gold and gain Power & Influence.



UpgradesThis gold can be used to add ships to their fleet or upgrade their Sloop or Sloops to be fierce fighting ships like Frigates and Man o' War or rich merchant vessels like Barques and the famous Indiaman and take on enemies to win Power. But be careful, as a ship becomes laden with treasure, it will become targets for other players.



EventsEvents add another wrinkle of unpredictability in the game. At the end of each players turn a random event occurs which may effect their fleet, or the entire board with positive or perhaps disastrous consequences.



MissionsMissions set out tasks that players can accomplish during their turn for a significant payout. Be sure to store as much treasure on your home island as possible because treasure still on a ship at the end of the game only counts for half of what gold on shore is worth.



End GameIn the final round the stakes are raised as the race to get the most Power & Influence over the Lunar Islands nears an end. Players who have thought strategically and planned can turn this to their advantage and sweep victory out from under their opponents.



Victory

End of game awards
+1 for each Sloop in your fleet
+2 for each Frigate/Barque in your fleet
+3 for each Indiaman/Man o' War in your fleet
+1 for first Mission, +2 for second, +3 for third, etc.
+1 for every 10 treasure


At the end of the game the player with the most Power and Influence wins. In case of a tie whoever has the most treasure is the victor
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: To the Last Extremity!: The Siege of Fort Stanwix
description:
To The Last Extremity recreates the 21-day siege of Fort Stanwix in 1777 during The American Revolution. Any number of decisions or events could have altered the outcome, and 'To The Last Extremity' gives players the chance to see what might have been." --from the rule book.

In To The Last Extremity the forces of the fledgling United States of America, consisting of Continental Army infantry and artillery, local militia, and allied Oneida Indian units, face off against the besieging forces consisting of British Army infantry and artillery, Hessian Jägers, Canadian militia, and American Indian allies. Each side receives a deck of cards representing its military forces and the various leaders instrumental in the campaign, such as the American commander, Col. Peter Gansevoort, and the British commander, Brig. Gen. Barry St. Leger, plus many others (including American Indian leaders and Benedict Arnold before he turned traitor!).

Players face off on opposite sides of a period map of the area surrounding Fort Stanwix. At the beginning of each turn, the American player will roll to see if a Chance card is drawn. Chance cards introduce historical events into the game and their effects on one or both sides. The rule book has detailed historical descriptions of each event, which are informational only, but help to bring the history and drama of the Siege of Fort Stanwix to life. Following a possible Chance card draw, players will secretly assign forces and leaders to each of the four sides of Fort Stanwix: north, south, east, and west. How the players choose to distribute their forces will determine the outcome of the siege. Players then reveal their cards. If the British have assigned forces to assault one or more sides of the fort, players will compare the strengths of the opposing forces on that side and roll a die to determine the resultant casualties and whether a breach of the fortress walls has occurred. If the British achieve two breaches on the same turn, they have taken the fort and win the game. If, after 13 turns, the British fail to take the fort, the outnumbered Americans have broken the siege and have defeated the British.

On each turn, the British may also elect to dig entrenchments to protect their artillery, or bombard or skirmish with sides of the fort to effect American morale.

Easily playable in under an hour, "To The Last Extremity" is a simple wargame that provides a great deal of historical flavor surrounding one of the earliest American victories achieved in U.S. history.

name: Trach! gra w zbijanego
description:
The game involves two sets of pieces of dinosaurs: team red and blue.
Each player must try to beat the opponent. The winner is the one who will beat all the dinosaurs from the opponents team or the player who can reach to the base of the opponent with their pawn. Each turn you can move one piece to an adjacent hex, play a special movement card, or launch a little ball from a tiny catapult on your end of the board, trying to knock down opponent's pieces.

name: Say Cheese Cafe
description:
Say Cheese Cafe is a multiplication tables board game for students of grade 1 and up. It is designed to get them 14 times more multiplication tables practice than classroom.

Similar to their first product, Cafe is a more advanced version of Say Cheese with the addition of "rotten coins", "dessert coins" and a spinner which sets the "cheese" value to a random number instead of the standard "4" in the base game.

name: Wild Cat Platoon
description:
Wild cats! This will be the start of the military exercises, which are divided into first and second platoons. Your goal is to suppress the three columns in which the enemy can attack, and you can conquer a column by having more cats than the enemy.

In ノラネコ小隊 (Wild Cat Platoon), each player has a set of twelve cards, with those cards being numbered 1-3 twice in two colors. Starting with four cards in hand, players engage in a placement phase, then an operations phase.

name: Wild Monopoly
description:
Jordanian version of Monopoly

The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player through building, renting and selling properties (bungalows and lodges).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Road To Infamy: Gangster Booster Pack
description:
This Gangster Booster Pack was a Kickstarter Exclusive. It started with 4 new gangsters but added 4 more via stretch goal.

The Booster Pack contains 1 card with game variations and clarifications and the following new gangsters...


Goons : When hit by an action, ignore its effect (Once per game).
Highroller : Start each hand with 7 bids.
Hitman : +3 Infamy Points for each Gangster you have assassinated.
Identity Thief : Choose an opponent's Gangster. Identity Thief copies that ability for the rest of the game.
Rat : -2 Infamy Points (The player with the lowest Gangster bid takes the Rat).
Saboteur : Discard an opponent's 3, 4, or 5 bid played that turn (Once per game).
Spy : Pick an opponent. They must show you all of their action bids (Once per hand).
Swindler : When Laundering/Gambling look at an extra card and discard the one you don't want.


Each of these cards has a KS logo in the bottom right corner.
