In その男、班文虎 (That Man, Going Halfsies), players start with a deck of 76 cards, with the values ranging from 0-8, along with a few 11s, and with the numbers 2-4 appearing most frequently. Shuffle the deck, then place ten cards on the bottom of the deck at a 90º angle from the other cards.

For the first turn, the active player ("elder brother") reveals the top card to all players, then takes that card in hand along with three other cards. The elder brother then splits the cards into two face-down piles, offering one pile to a younger brother (the player on the left) and keeping the other pile. If younger brother accepts the split, the elder brother places their cards aside in a scoring pile, then the younger brother takes their pile into their hand, draws cards to fill their hand to four, then becomes the elder brother and offers a split with the brother on their left.

If the younger brother doesn't accept the split, then reveal the cards in the two piles. If the elder brother kept the larger share for himself, then you get to split that elder brother's share in half, discarding the larger half (if you can't split it evenly) to punish him for being unfair. If the elder brother's share was only a single card, then discard that card.

If, however, the elder brother had split the pile evenly or favored the younger brother, then the younger brother's pile is split in half or discarded as punishment as described above. The elder brother keeps their share, then retains their role as elder brother, with the next player in clockwise order taking the role of younger brother. The elder brother reveals the top card, etc.

When you start drawing from the ten cards that had been turned 90º, continue play until the player to the right of the first elder brother has either received a share in the role of elder brother, or doubted what was given to them, then resolved that situation. Everyone then tallies their points to see who collected the most sweets!
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ), Toydrop

name: Final Judgment
description:
The four gods: Satan, Lucifer, Christ, and Jehovah compete to exert their will over the Common Realm, but realize they may not succeed alone. They’ll work through their followers in pairs to manipulate their rivals and accomplish their goals both in plain sight and in secret.

Final Judgment is an area control/hand management card game for 1-2 players inspired by occult practices and Tarot decks. Players will draft decks based on 4 gods: Jehovah, Christ, Satan, and Lucifer, and then use these cards to compete for Influence in a shared spread of cards called the Common Realm. Players will take various actions to maintain cards from their hand, Personal Realm, and Common Realm to utilize special powers and manipulate their opponent. Players will also use cards from a fifth shared deck, the Major Arcana, to complete secret objectives and gain more points. The player with the most influence at the end of the game is the winner.

Each god's deck of cards contains unique strengths and weaknesses and leads to many diverse playing strategies and increased replay-ability.

Also includes a single player variant with a player-controlled AI called The Fate. The player will have to manage their deck smoothly and make choices for the AI to hopefully complete 7 objectives from the Major Arcana deck as well as have the most Influence over the Common Realm to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Riband: Transatlantic Steamship Board Game
description:
In the early 20th-century, rival steamship lines fiercely competed for speed, luxury, and profit. The legendary Blue Riband award was the greatest prize of all, won by the passenger ship with the fastest westbound transatlantic crossing. In this game, you’ll design and operate your own classic transatlantic liner, with one player as Lusitania and the other as Titanic.

You have two paths to victory: speed or luxury. Focus on one strategy, or try for both at the same time. In the first part of the game, you'll act as a ship designer, competing with your opponent to build the fastest and/or most luxurious ship. You build your ship by placing design cards that can increase your ship's speed, luxury rating, safety level, and profitability.

In the second part of the game, you'll captain your ship as you and your opponent race across the Atlantic from Southampton, England to New York. Set your speed by deciding how much coal to burn each day, and contend with hazards including icebergs and a U-Boat. Try not to sink or become stranded along the way! The first ship to reach New York wins the Blue Riband award, but you can also win the game by having the most luxurious ship. You earn bonus points through financial profit.

The game materials are based on historic, public domain photographs and drawings from the early 20th century. The steamship images feature Titanic, Lusitania or their sister ships.

name: Mousetrap Trappers
description: The mice are on the loose. Players place their mice throughout the room and then race to be the first to trap their 4 mice in a stack in their trapper. First player to trap all their mice wins.

name: Golden Trivia Cards: Star Trek Edition
description:
Contains 216 Trivia Cards. These are the same cards as found Golden Trivia Game: Star Trek Edition

Draw card, roll the dice for question and the first who answer correctly gets the card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia

name: Nava
description:
'Nava' is an ‘easy to learn – tricky to master’ light abstract strategy game inspired by ancient Asian past-times, such as Nepalese 'Bagh-Chal' and 'Go'.

In Nava, players compete to gain control of the board. They do this by moving ‘Discs’ to capture rival pieces and laying ‘Cubes’ to mark and hold conquered areas.

Variable piece powers, diplomacy in 3 and 4 player games and player elimination combine to create a game that is rich in complexity and deeply though-provoking.

A typical game of 'Nava' is around 10 minutes but this is often extended in 3 and 4 player variants.

There are two ways to win: through elimination (quashing other players by landing on all of their discs) or through territory control, having placed all of your cubes.

'Nava' is due to launch on Kickstarter in 2020.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Cinderella Magic
description:
Cinderella must ﬁnd things in the house. Her Fairy Godmother needs a pumpkin, lizards, mice and a rat, and the dress. When all are found, the Fairy Godmother will cast her spell, and Cinders can go to the ball in the castle. The pumpkin will become the golden carriage, with the mice turned into horses, and the rat and lizards as coachman and footmen — and Cinderella will get her glass slippers! But she must gather all the items ﬁrst before she can go to the ball!

In Cinderella Magic (シンデレラマジック), the players try to guess the played cards. On a turn, the active player plays one card either face up or face down. If it's face-up, the player plays the effect on the card; if it's face down, the card just sits there.

After playing a card either face up or face down, a player can declare that they're off to the ball! Each other player in clockwise order can choose to join them on this journey or not. Once everyone has decided, all face-down cards are revealed. If these cards collectively show at least one pumpkin, dress, rat, mouse, and lizard, then Cinderella indeed goes to the ball; everyone who thought they'd go to the ball then takes one face-down glass slipper card from that deck. If a pumpkin, dress, or rat is missing, but the Fairy Godmother is revealed, then the Fairy Godmother can replace one of those missing items. If not all items are present, then those who didn't go to the ball take a one face-down glass slipper card.

In either case, all of the item cards are shuffled, then a new round begins. Once the final glass slipper card has been claimed (with anyone else who needs to score taking an item card to represent 1 point), the game ends. You then reveal the glass slipper that has been tucked under the Prince card at the start of the game, and whoever has the matching slipper claims this card (and its points). Glass slipper cards are worth 1-3 points, and whoever has the most points wins!

name: Wokou
description:
Designed for the 2018 Nine Card Contest.

Set in Ming Dynasty China, Wokou is a solitaire game of revenge. After being left for dead, the player must sneak into the Wokou camp in order to take back their father's stolen sword and eliminate the dreaded Pirates.

Using a variable play area of seven cards and minimal components, the player must sneak through the Wokou camp using an intuitive dice pulling mechanism. Once the camp has been alerted, the player will use a dice based combat system in order to take their bloody revenge.

The winning conditions are simple. You either kill all of the Wokou, or die trying. Good Luck!
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: King of the Castle
description: Scale the ramparts, and send opposing knights to the dungeon. Secure the tower with your knights to become the King of the Castle. The most cards at the top wins. For 2-4 players. Ages 3 and up.

name: La Citadelle
description:
A race game with AA and coastal guns. 2 to 6 players compete to reach the citadel (a fortress surrounded by a body of water) with their 4 pieces. There are 3 paths to reach the citadel, each as dangerous as the others. Cards help the players and moving spaces is with a die.

One of the paths is by ship, but an opposing player can sink it if he mans the coastal gun. Do you have an armor card to protect you? Another way is by plane, but the AA guns may hit you. Finally you can try the lower tide but will you drown?

Arriving at the citadel's island, you're still not safe. You have to move around the citadel until you get the exact number of spaces with the die to enter it. Beware of opposing players' spies and a hole in the ground that will make you start from the beginning.

The winner is the one with the most of his pieces in the citadel at game's end or the first one to reach it in case of a tie.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dead Ringer
description:
In 30 seconds, players write down three items from a category card they think will match the answers of a chosen player (the Ringleader), in order to score points. The first player to ring the bell may also score bonus points.

Game includes 336 categories on 168 cards, score sheets, Dead Ringer bell, 30-second timer, rules.

name: Milka Biscuit Run
description:
One spring day, Hans, the family’s mischievous golden retriever goes nuts over the yummy treats.

In an attempt to hide the Milka biscuits in his dog house, he accidentally scatters them all over the place. The Biscuit Jars then set off on an adventure to collect as many biscuits as they can.

They’re not going to let Hans have all the fun!

“Milka Biscuit Run” saw players compete in the ultimate quest for real Milka biscuits and soft cakes. The board game set players inside the world of Lilaberg—already familiar to audiences from our popular films—where the jar characters breathe and dream about their delicious Milka biscuits. So much so they’ll do almost anything to get their hands on the sweet tender treats.

Embodying their favorite jar character, players complete a series of hilarious (and sometimes embarrassing) dares and challenges—from mimicking an alpine animal to yodelling their favourite song.

name: Zverometr
description:
Board game Selfie Media "Zverometr" will give a lot of positive and excellent mood to your children. Applying their agility, logic and savvy, children will move towards victory. During the game you will have to measure yourself with longevity, speed and fluffiness of your animals. The winner of the game will be only one who turns out to be more dexterous and quick-witted.

On one side of the card - the name and picture with the beast, on the other - the figures for the four properties:

The size,
Longevity,
Travel speeds,
Fuzzy.
To each property are added points, proportional to the values.

Each player in his turn receives 4 cards, but does not look at the reverse side with the data. He needs to arrange these animals in order of increasing points for a single property. When the cards are arranged in a row, the player turns them over. If the sequence is correct, he gets one card for himself in the bank, if not - he puts all the cards back into the deck. Each player has three such moves, then everyone counts the earned points.

name: Love and Hate
description:
Love and Hate is a meta-game that can be played with any point based game. Each player gets a public identity card and a secret love and hate card. You add your love's score to yours and subtract your hate's score to determine who won "Love and Hate" after you finish playing the host game.

The playing time is only one minute because it adds less than a minute to the playing time of the host game.

name: Terrigeo Perú
description:
Terrigeo is a filler game of observation and reflexes about peruvian geography (peruvian regions)
You could learn how to play it in a minute. Is not necessary previous knowledge.

The goal is to accumulate as many regions as you can!

Game dynamics: Deal 1 map and 3 cards to each player; In turn the challenges will be revealed, and whoever is the first to guess the challenge with the cards in hand, saying the name of the region aloud, takes that letter; the game ends, when the deck of Regions has been used up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Cheeky Monkeys
description:
A fun game of chance for all the family. There's no hanging about in this fast paced game, as players battle to collect and count the most bananas – but watch out for other players trying to steal them! Players must make strategic decisions by choosing whether to play it safe after their first turn or spin the spinner to either collect or risk losing more bananas!

Children will enjoy hanging their monkeys onto the 3D tree, which adds another fun dimension to this exciting game. As well as teaching basic counting skills, Cheeky Monkeys encourages children to think strategically, interact with others and make decisions.

—description from the publisher

name: Samurai Warfare
description:
Samurai Warfare

These rules are designed on two levels.

The first parts consists of skirmish rules which we hope are an accurate reflection of the individual warrior ethic

The second part is designed to simulate major battles in the sixteenth century

25mm or 15mm scale figures

name: 2d6 Sci-Fi Combat
description:
2d6 Sci-Fi Combat is a fast-playing "beer and pretzels" miniatures game of sf skirmishes. Each figure represents either a player-controlled star or a grunt whose actions are wholly determined by the game mechanics. It's possible to play solo against "AI-controlled" grunts or against other players' stars, with our without grunt allies.

Miniatures are further classified by reputation (essentially skill/quality), class (bugs, mercenaries, police, etc), defensive value (how hard to hit or hurt), and what weapon they have. The game is well suited for campaign play.

name: India
description:
In India, you and an opponent are trying to retrieve a dagger and bring it to the Taj Mahal. You will move along a path using a Carrom style flipping mechanic to determine how far you can move.

Each turn, the players will flip a chip in a box that is filled with numbered squares. The chip must bounce off the far wall and (hopefully) land on one or more of the squares. Your opponent will then look and the squares covered and decide which value you will move. You may choose to move forward or backward on the path.

There is only one dagger in the game. To capture it, you must land on it by exact count. You may also steal it from your opponent if you land on his or her piece.

The path is marked with yellow squares which give special events and shortcuts along the path. The first player to carry the dagger and land by exact count on the Taj Mahal is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Go Eco
description:
Go Eco is a card game for 2-6 players that celebrates diversity in nature.

The objective of the game is to reach a predetermined number of points over multiple rounds by scoring a set of food chain cards from one ecosystem.

Players start with a hand of 8 cards. On your turn you can either draw a card or declare victory of the round. If you draw a card then you can play or discard a card from your hand. There are two basic types of cards in the game: Ecosystem cards and Go cards. Ecosystem cards will be collected in order to declare victory. Go cards allow you to gain an advantage over other players or protect yourself. If you declare victory and meet the victory conditions, you tally your points and then begin a new round. Play continues until one player has reached the predetermined number of victory points, 50 for a shorter game or 100 for a longer one.

name: Monster Fight
description:
Who would win in a fight, a zombie or an alien? A giant Kraken or a fire-breathing dinosaur? A robot or a mad scientist? Now it's your chance to find out with a new card game from Alternate Histories.

The way you play Monster Fight is simple, and it’s fun for the whole family, ages six and up, with fun illustrations by everyday balloons.

There are five kinds of monsters: Zombies, Robots, Aliens, Kraken, and fire-breathing Dinosaurs. Each one is assigned a number based on their strength. There are also five colors (or zones for colorblind). Each player gets 8 cards. The first player must play a card that “beats” that monster in a fight, either by playing the next number in the sequence (1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and then repeat) or by playing any monster with the same color. There are also a lot of special action cards, like a Mad Scientist card that creates any monster you want, cloning machines that make other players draw a card, and even a doomsday device card that causes everyone to pass their cards to the left.

The first player to get rid of all their cards, wins!

-description from designer

name: Kids Know Best
description:
The kids vs grown-ups trivia game where the grown-ups assume to know more than the kids, but is this true?

Kids team up and challenge the grown-ups as to what they know about kids' things. The grown-ups get to test how smart the kids are. The team that gets to the other side of the board first wins and knows best! Sounds easy - but be aware of the special spaces that may help you forward more quickly… or set you back!

—description from the publisher

name: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937
description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937 is a game of the factional strife in the Army and the Navy of Imperial Japan.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.

name: 2nd Megiddo: King Josiah vs. Pharaoh Necho II
description:
Archers, chariots, javelin throwers, infantry, initiative, and the Mount of Megiddo itself all play their part. This is a two player non-card driven war game. The Egyptians have to get 1/3rd of their forces, within a time limit, off the opposite map board edge. The Judeans either have to delay them, or inflict sufficient losses on them. Historically, the Egyptian forces were on their way to help their allies the Assyrians against the Babylonians. To do so, they had to pass through Judean territory. We do not know why Josiah went to war against Egypt. The Assyrian capital, Ninevah, had already fallen to the Babylonians and Medes in 612 (read Nahum). The remaining Assyrian forces had regrouped at Haran, but in 609 they were forced west of the Euphrates. It appears to be at this time that the Egyptians under Necho II were coming to the Assyrian’ aid. King Josiah marched out to meet them in battle. Perhaps Josiah opposed the passage of Necho’s forces through the pass at Megiddo (See 2 Chron.35:20-24) because he feared that the growth of either Egyptian or Assyrian power would have adverse results for the continued independence of Judah. (TKB 2 Kings 23:29). Pharaoh Necho II sent word to Josiah that God had told him to immediately attack Babylon “so stop opposing God who is with me, or He will destroy you.” (35:21) Yet, Josiah refused to accept the word of the Lord from Pharaoh Necho II and went to fight against him on the plain of Megiddo. “Josiah, however, would not turn away from him, but disguised himself to engage him in battle. He would not listen to what Pharaoh Necho II has said at God’s command but went to fight him on the plain of Megiddo.” (35:22) Josiah was wounded by an archer in battle and died in Jerusalem and was buried in the tombs of his fathers (35:23-24). There was great mourning in Judea and Jerusalem. This is 2nd Megiddo, King Josiah vs Pharaoh Necho II. Can you change history?

—description from the publisher

name: Subdue
description:
Subdue is a card game of capture and control which takes place in a legendary universe where Kings and their Dragons fight for Castles supremacy.

Unfold your strategy in an intriguing and fun-to-play game with up to 6 players in free for all or cooperative mode.

Objective:

To achieve the desired victory, you must be the first to control two Castles with your full army or achieve the highest score at the end of the game.

Game Set-up:

The secret playing cards are placed facedown in a row at the center of the game table.

The special cards are placed in a pile next to the secret cards.

Each player chooses randomly half (6) of his playing cards as a starting hand.

Each player takes his inactive King army card and places it in front of him.

Each Player Turn:

1. Play: Play a card either directly from the hand or after an exchange with one card from secret cards on the table (obligatory stage)

2. Expansion: Developing the army (king and dragons) and purchasing special cards (optional stage)

3. Magic: use Magic special cards to affect the status of own King or other players Kings (optional stage)

4: Conflict: attack adversaries to gain control over Castles and use Conflict special cards (optional stage)

Components:
108 Cards
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Bearfoot 'Tessa Promo Card
description:
Upgrade: Send one of your active dice to your reserve.

At the start of the Brawl phase you may choose to remove 1 die from your Battleground or Barracks to gain 1 Food.

The card is numbered UP-08.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).
categories: Animals, Bluffing, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Black Stories: Tod in Hollywood Edition
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories with a Hollywood background which happened in real life.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Whistle While You Work Promo
description:
This promo is a new upgrade card for the game BarBEARian Battlegrounds.

This upgrade card costs 2 faith, 1 food, and 1 ore. It's ability is: "Gain 1 resource token of any type each time your bears clash on the Battleground."

The card is numbered UP-05.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).
categories: Animals, Bluffing, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Ahead in the Clouds: Extra Player Pack
description:
Contents:
1 Green or Yellow Player Habitat
4 Resource Cards
1 Contract Add-On

Setup:
To add an extra player to the game, simply choose your Contract Card and add the 3/4 player Contract Add-On. If you have two Extra Player Packs you will use the 3 and 4 player sides, but if you are using just a single Extra Player Pack, you will tuck the 4 player side underneath your current Contract Card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Hammer Time Promo Card
description:
This promo is a new upgrade card for the game BarBEARians.

This upgrade card costs 2 food, 1 faith, and 1 ore. It's ability is: "You may place dice of any value on your forge (not just 4, 5, or 6)"

The card is numbered UP-06.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, City Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Uniwersytet Niepodległy
description:
Board game about history of Catholic University of Lublin

Independent University is educational card-boardgame.
It was released by Fundacja Rozwoju KUL to commemorate the hundredth anniversary of the creation of the Catholic University of Lublin.
And also to celebrate the hundredth anniversary of regaining independence by Poland.
Players choose roles from seven available, and try to study, and graduate with best score.
The game is divided into five years, which are divided into trimesters.
They will met lots of events connected with history of University or Polish Independence.
First three years they learn about University, and last two years they can get to know the city of Lublin.

Components:
1 Rulebook
1 Board
1 dice 10 sided
7 magnetic players boards
32 magnetic counters
7 pawns
10 year cards
169 event cards (124 for University, 95 for City)
2 aid sheets
1 magnetic turn track
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: La Carrera del Chollo
description:
It was used in a giant size in 1984 in the Spanish most famous TV contest "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez" (on which the British "Three, two, one" was based)and shortly later comerciallized as a board game for the general public.

Game about moving pawns through a locker until you reach the end of the course or fall eliminated. Slightly based on the Game of the Goose.
The route has bifurcations, and each square has different effects: the highlighted "La Chárcel", which obligates the player to answer a question or to do a try-out the first time or stop playing; "El Chobstáculo", like the previous one but with two opportunities; "El Saltichollo", with similar effect to the Goose; and "The Retrochollo", similar to the previous one, but backwards.

Se utilizó en un formato gigante en 1984 en el concurso de TV "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez", para ser comercializado al poco tiempo como juego de mesa para el público general.

Juego de mover fichas por un casillero hasta llegar al final del recorrido o caer eliminado. Ligeramente basado en el Juego de la Oca.
El recorrido tenía bifurcaciones, y cada casilla tenía efectos diferentes. Destacaban "La Chárcel", que obligaba a contestar una pregunta o hacer una prueba a la primera o dejar de jugar, "El Chobstáculo", igual que la anterior pero con dos oportunidades, "El Saltichollo", con efecto similar a la oca, y "El Retrochollo", similar a la anterior, pero hacia atrás.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Off World: Building Better Colonies
description:
In Off World you control one of the leading international corporations that have carved out the dying, polluted Mother Earth, sucked dry of natural resources. Following a major technological breakthrough that allowed interstellar travel lasting dozens of years at a time, these companies have invested massive sums into private space fleets that would launch an immediate exploration effort across the neighboring systems. Your success is measured not only in hard cash but chiefly in your colony assets, among them terraforming installations on inhospitable planets.
In a 3X type of play (explore, exploit, expand), there is little place for the fourth X - exterminate. Always keep in mind that corporate boards are stationed back in the Solar System and answer before authorities for every wrongdoing, forcing them to play within the rules enforced by the United Nations.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Josef Bugman – Coach & Star Player
description:
The name Josef Bugman is as synonymous with Blood Bowl as Goblins are with being cheating gits. Pitches bear the Bugman’s B, while the bearded face of the master brewer grins down on players from massive billboards. When Bugman turns up at a match in person it is a spectacle to behold.

Bugman is no mere spectator, however, as the stout brewer owns numerous teams, and coaches them from his private dugout as he knocks back beer after beer. For all his bluster, and the vast quantities of XXXXXX he consumes, Bugman is actually a fair coach, having a good eye for the ebb and flow of the game – the problem arises when things don’t go his team’s way, or he gets excessively drunk, or some combination of the two, and he staggers out onto the field to take matters into his own hands…

This resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble 2 models – both of which depict the iconic, stout figure of Josef Bugman. The first is Josef as coach, pipe and rulebook in hand, watching over his team with a stern, furrowed look and one foot resting on a beer barrel – the second depicts Bugman in a rather less disciplined state (probably something to do with the beer barrel mentioned earlier…) – this is Josef Bugman, Star Player, holding a ball aloft in his left hand and a foaming stein of XXXXXX in the other.

This kit is supplied as 9 components, and includes 2 32mm round Blood Bowl bases. Rules are included for fielding Josef Bugman as a part of Dwarf, Halfling, Norse, Human, Amazon and Ogre Blood Bowl teams.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Worst Game Ever: Secret Agendas Promo
description:
Point this card at another seat as your secret hate. If the player in that seat is eliminated, you get 10 tokens from the kitty at the end of the game.

This card was included in the game "Desert Island."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Night Terrors – Dark Elf Cheerleading Squad
description:
Many Dark Elves aspire to be Witch Elves or Assassins so they can turn torture and murder into a lucrative profession. Then there are those who are truly cruel and pitiless, these join the Naggaroth Nightmares cheer squad the Night Terrors! If the unpleasant antics of the Naggaroth Nightmares keep other teams up at night then the Night Terrors give the Nightmares nightmares. They are so vicious and vindictive one of the few times the Nightmares were defeated they made a ‘commiseration’ banner out of the opposing team’s cheerleader squad – though when they waved the banner it didn’t so much cheer as scream.

This resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble The Night Terrors, a 4-model Dark Elf cheerleading squad. Slender and furious, much like the team they support, they each clutch not only the standard pom-pom you expect from a cheerleader but 2 include a sinister dagger.

These models are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Reaverettes – Human Cheerleading Squad
description:
The Reaverettes have a long and proud history cheering for the Reikland Reavers. Based in the Old Bowl stadium in Altdorf, they are as synonymous with Blood Bowl as the Reavers themselves. Getting into the Reaverettes is even harder than earning a spot on the Reikland Reavers however, the cheerleaders chosen for not just their agility and vocal abilities but also their intelligence. Rumour has it that given the number of head injuries among the Reavers their cheerleaders also double as their accountants and publicists.

This resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble The Reaverettes, a Human cheerleading squad. 4 models are included, each posed in synch with the other – arms aloft holding pom-poms (actual pom-poms, not the scary metal spiky weaponry of certain other cheerleading squads…), left leg in the air.

These models are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Gen Con 2018 Pack
description: A pack of 18 cards sold at Gen Con 2018 heavily focused on American recent events and the political climate.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Spyfall: UFO promo cards
description:
A new location for Spyfall or Spyfall 2.

Given out at GenCon 2018
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Atenti
description:
Players have the same number of colored cards. In turns, they must put a card over the discard pile, but when an "Atenti" card is played, the player must choose somebody, and he then must say which cards are in the discard deck, in the right order.
The winner is who plays first all his cards.

name: Deal: American Dream – Hells Dogs MC
description:
A promotional 7th clan that was published as a stretch goal during the Kickstarter campaign.

From the publisher‘s website:

Founded in California by WW2 veterans, the Hells Dogs MC quickly spread all across the U.S. and Canada. They now count chapters in all the major cities of North America. These bikers tasted the joy of the 70s by being better at consuming the product than distributing it. Until they decided to use their fondness for immoderate violence to get in the business. Progressively, they began to contest the established monopoly of drug dealers in their cities, and soon emerged as some of the major players of drug trafficking in the continent. The Hells Dogs are a collegiate organization; meaning that their president is not omnipotent and that all the important decisions need to be voted unanimously by the inner circle.

These nomadic riders are present in all of North America; thus allowing the Hells Dogs to start their operations from Illinois, California as well as British Columbia.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame

name: FateShifters
description: FateShifters (轉命師) is a card game that combines elements from astrology, astral myth, and tarot to compose several different game rules to suit players' gaming preferences, including storytelling, area control, trick-taking, etc.

name: Carrera de Caballos
description:
Try to win the horse races and take all the money as you can.

A lively game of horse racing where players bet on one of five horses to try to gain the most money by the end of the game.

One player, the Horseride Manager, reveals action cards one by one and moves each horse as indicated. The five horses vary in strength, but even the weakest horses have some amazing bursts of speed taking advantage of any kind of mistake. Finally, there are money tokens now for the winners and a new horse race is prepared.

After six races the winner is the player who get more money.

name: Game of Phones: Expansion 001 – Creative Pack
description:
Get Creative!

Expansion Pack 001 is all about getting creative: taking photos, videos, and even drawing. There are 30 all new cards to go with the main game.

Game of Phones is a Battle of Smartphone Skills, perfect for those who can't escape their phones! The only requirement to play this game is the Game of Phones deck of cards and a smartphone. Take on challenges such as:

Finding the best selfies
Taking photos of other players
Showing your worst or funniest texts

Game of Phones makes a great gift for teens who can't look up from their smartphones for more than two minutes at a time, and parents who don't want to be left out of the fun.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Multiplication War
description: Multiplication War is a version of the classic card game War with a twist, designed to teach multiplication facts. Players are dealt an equal number of the 86 cards showing multiplication problems. Like in war, each player then turns over a card. They must then solve the multiplication problem displayed on the card. The player with the highest answer wins and takes all the cards. If a player's answer is wrong, he or she gives her card to the player to the right. A wild card automatically gains all the cards in that round for the player who plays it. Like in wars, equal answers result in a "war" where players play two face-down cards and the an face-up card, and the winner wins all the cards. Players play a predetermined number of times through the deck or until one player has all the cards.

name: MEMOTEP
description:
MEMOTEP is the educational board game promoting learning languages to put between all hands.

This new method of collective learning of a foreign language allows students to have fun together in class (up to 35 players), from the age of 7 years, while learning the most important words and phrases
useful of a language.

With MEMOTEP, it becomes child's play to learn or improve in any what language, to listen to or train to pronounce words and phrases through the free mobile app who evaluates your pronunciation.

The board represent an antic egyptian pyramid from which each player will try to climb on and reach the top at first place with an exact amount of coins to win the game

On his turn, each player have to throw a dice for going futher on the pyramid and to translate all the 5 words of a same card depending of the color of the board's box he just reached.

Every good answer win 2 coins and aim to collect the amount of coins necessary to win the game.

—user summary

name: Wall Jumper
description:
The aim of the game is to jump the wooden pieces over a wall into the holes of the playing board and to score as many points as possible.
On her/his turn, each player has 3 attempts to flick one of the pieces into one of the holes. In order to do this, the player has to slide one of the provided springboards into the slits in the wall, place the pieces on it and flick it over the wall (hopefully into the net).
Jumping height, distance and direction depend on the following:

How deep and in which angle the springboard is slid into the wall
The placing of the springboard in the wall
The power with which the springboard is pushed down


—user summary

name: Not Yet Lost: The Defense of the Polish Post Office in Danzig
description:
Not Yet Lost (NYL) is a quick playing solitaire print-and-play game depicting the heroic defense of the Polish Post Office in Danzing during the German invasion in September, 1939. Using a chit-pull system, the player defends against increasing numbers of German attackers over the course of 15 turns. The player's success is measured by the length of time (in turns) that the Germans are repulsed. With each fighting turn that the defenders survive, Poland is not yet lost.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fleet 1715 Solo
description:
This edition combined the original base game deck and rules, and the expansion set and rules, in one tinned pack. The tin looks like a suitcase and simply holds the base game and expansion cards and both sets of rules. No other changes.

User summary

The above description seems to be incorrect concerning the contents of the game. The back of the 'tin box' states that the game includes 64 cards for 16 puzzles in different difficulties. That's exactly what the box contains (apart from a sheet which you can copy for solving the puzzles). So no expansion set and rules 'originally'.

name: Inazuma Eleven Go: Duelo de Campeones
description:
Based on the soccer anime and videogame.

Every player control one team of 5 characters with differents bases depending if they're defenders, midfilders or strikers. Each turn you can move, pass, use a super technique as double movement, double shoot or precise passing, then the defender can move.

The ball change when a pass or shoot is failed, a goal is scored or you have 4 turns attacking.

To shoot or pass you flick using your players, to move you just go to an adjacent position which has no players.

The first player to score 5 goals is the winner of the game or the player who scored more goals in 30 minutes.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: quintro
description:
Quintro is a simple game similar to Tic-Tac-Toe. Only instead of three in a row, the winner must connect five in a row.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

name: Fußball: Das Kartenspiel
description:
A card game about soccer
The starting player play a card and the next players try to find a next logical move by playing a new card. The winner is the player who managed to get rid off his cards before the others do so.

name: Car Clash
description: Clash with your opponents on a trail full of pitfalls. In Car Clash, you build your track, construct your vehicle, and face your opponents throughout a thrilling race.

name: Looney Tunes Balloon Game
description:
At the beginning of the game each player is given a number of discs face down based on player count.

Players move around the board using a spinner. When they land on a yellow circle they turn over a "balloon" cardboard disk. If it matches the color of the character holding the yellow circle, they place their disk covering the space they're on. If it doesn't match, the disk is turned back over and mixed back into their draw pile.

If they land on a circle with a disk, the player still draws. If it matches a different color on the character's clothes, they replace the original disk.

The first player to get rid of all their balloons wins.

—user summary

name: GET LOOT!
description:
GET LOOT! is a 2-5 player competitive hacking game where your goal is to exfiltrate (steal) loot while sabotaging your rivals with strategic crypto-locks and Hak5 themed cyber attacks!

Win by being the first with 5 unlocked loot cards.

Each turn you may Exfiltrate or Attack, then you may Lock or Unlock.

Exfiltrate: Take the top loot card from the loot draw stack. If it is locked, you must take the lock with it.

Attack:Follow the instructions on the attack card, then discard and draw a new one.

Lock: You can lock one loot card in your stash, or the top card from the loot draw stack if it's unlocked.

Unlock: Remove a lock from one loot card in your stash if it matches your key's suit. Return lock to inventory.

name: ファインディング・ニモ (Finding NEMO)
description:
User summary
ファインディング・ニモ (Finding NEMO) is a Japanese game for children with the famous Pixar characters. This card game reunites Nemo and Merlin on the game mat.

Each player gets five cards. taking turns, players draw crads from the deck and discard cards. The aim is to make pairs of the same characters. You can play out yellow Nemo cards and green Merlin cards. The player who can join Nemo and Merlin at their spot is the winner.

ゲームマット上の「ニモ」と「マーリン」を再会させるカードゲームです。

プレイヤーに5枚の手札を配ります。自分の手番では、山札もしくはカード捨場からカードを補充し、同じキャラクターのペアを作ります。黄色カードは「ニモ」を、緑カードは「マーリン」を動かすことができます。自分の場所で「ニモ」と「マーリン」を合流させることができたプレイヤーが勝者です。
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Säbel & Schädel
description:
Damned pirate souls want to take possession of you ..
You want to get rid of these soul markers as fast as possible, but also the other players have the same fate. It goes from island to island and the lucky 6 always helps you. All other numbers can have bad consequences. Let the sabers rattle! / ~ based on the classic dice game Zeppelin ~

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher

Game play:
The island coaster with the 6 is selected and placed on the table. The remaining coasters are mixed well and placed one after another open in a circle around the 6. Each player gets all 6 soul tokens in a chosen color.

The player rolls the dice and can place exactly one token on the Islands “1” to “5” according to the rolled number. However, if there is already a token on this island, the player must take this and finish his move immediately.
Island “6”: On this island, any number of tokens can be placed with a rolled 6.
Special coaster “Skull”: On these islands the limit of only one possible token is lifted. The number of the respective island now shows the maximum number of tokens that can be placed there. If this number is exceeded, all tokens located there must be taken.
Special coaster “Saber”: If players pick up tokens from these islands, the player must additionally also take all possible tokens of the same-color from island “6”.

Object of the game: The players are gradually trying to get rid of all their soul tokens. The game ends immediately if a player places his last soul token. This player wins the game!

—description from the designer

Verdammte Piratenseelen möchten sich Deiner bemächtigen ..
Du willst möglichst schnell diese Seelenmarker loswerden, aber auch die anderen Spieler haben das gleiche Schicksal. Es geht von Insel zu Insel und die glücksbringende 6 hilft Dir immer. Alle anderen Zahlen können böse Folgen haben. Lasst die Säbel rasseln! / ~ basierend auf dem Würfelklassiker Zeppelin ~

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf:
Der Inseldeckel mit der 6 wird aussortiert und mittig auf dem Tisch ausgelegt. Die restlichen Bierdeckel werden gut gemischt und nacheinander offen in Kreisform um die 6 ausgelegt. Jeder Spieler bekommt alle 6 Seelenmarker in einer gewählten Farbe.

Der Spieler würfelt und kann auf den Inseln „1“ bis „5“ entsprechend der gewürfelten Zahl genau einen Marker ablegen. Ist allerdings dort auf dieser Insel schon ein Marker vorhanden, muss der Spieler diesen aufnehmen und seinen Zug sofort beenden.
Insel „6“: Auf dieser Insel können beliebig viele Marker mit einer erwürfelten 6 abgelegt werden.
Sonderdeckel „Schädel“: Auf diesen Inseln ist das Limit von nur einem legbaren Marker aufgehoben. Die Zahl der jeweiligen Insel zeigt jetzt die maximale Anzahl der dort ablegbaren Marker. Wird diese Zahl dann überschritten, müssen alle dort liegenden Marker aufgenommen werden.
Sonderdeckel „Säbel“: Wird von diesen Inseln Marker aufgenommen, muss der Spieler zusätzlich alle gleichfarbigen möglichen Marker der Insel „6“ mitaufnehmen.

Spielziel: Die Spieler versuchen nach und nach alle ihre Seelenmarker loszuwerden. Das Spiel endet sofort sobald ein Spieler seinen letzten Seelenmarker ablegt; dieser Spieler gewinnt das Spiel!

—description from the designer (German)

name: Thunder Hollow Mud Madness Game
description:
Join Lightning McQueen and Cruz Ramirez for a crazy race on the Thunder Hollow figure-eight track!

Drive fast, but don't crash!

ROLL! Pick a die. Do you play it safe or push your luck?
CRASH! Move one space back!
WIN! First player to complete 3 laps is the winner!

name: Victimology
description:
Victimology is at tongue-in-cheek, political card and dice game in the new tradition of games designed to encourage players to find humor in political incorrectness, such as Cards Against Humanity. The genre is filler-for-laughs, but the scoring mechanism ensures a competitive edge along with hand management and "take-that" elements.

In turn, each person rolls dice to determine their gender and ethnicity, collects or loses "victim points" based on scoring cards, have an opportunity to play penalty cards to change other players' ability to score points, and play cards to eliminate restrictions on themselves.

Gaming groups that are open-minded, will find humor in poking fun in absurd elements of the ‘Social Justice Warrior’ movement. Be warned, not everyone has the objectivity to laugh at poking fun at their own set of taboo subjects. However, Victimology, like all games that look for humor in taboo subjects, will offend some.

From the website:

"Tap into your inner Snowflake, start your virtue signaling and above all else, be offended! – Because he, she, or ‘ze’ with the most Victims Points at the end, wins!”

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Viva La Revolution!
description:
A two player abstract wargame simulating a revolutionary movement in a fictional South American country. The wargame mechanics were influenced by Irish Freedom by David Kershaw and Guerrilla Checkers by Brian Train.

One player takes the role of the Government and aims to stay in power, through any means necessary, by the end of twenty turns of play. The other player leads the Rebels and is seeking to become the next government by taking control, support, legitimacy and finally the capital, from the Government player. If the Rebel player wins the game starts over but this time with the players swapping sides - the units present at the end of first game become the starting forces for the next game.

—description from the designer

Steam TTS link: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=15470...;searchtext=viva+la+revolution

PAXims review: https://paxsims.wordpress.com/2018/11/10/playtesting-viva-la...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Altitude: Yeti Promo Card
description: Promo card with a Yeti. When you get this card you can scare a free animal off an opponent's mountain.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Uh-oh Hippo!
description:
Feed the need for fun with Uh-Oh Hippo!, the hilarious “what did Hugo the Hippo eat?” memory game for preschoolers. Place the munchies inside of Hugo’s mouth for feeding time and see if you can remember what he ate. Then close his mouth—when it opens again, one piece is missing! Do you remember what it is? Shout it out loud and press on Gary, the bird on Hugo’s tail, to see what pops out in this adorable memory game. Whoever collects enough pieces first, wins.

Psst...They're Learning!
Encourages memorization and visual recognition. Teaches social skills and turn taking.

—description from the publisher

name: L'eredità
description:
L’eredità recreates the atmosphere of the Italian TV quiz game by re-proposing the challenges that made it famous, in particular the final one (La ghigliottina). There isn’t a host, but all the players compete for the final victory, taking turns asking questions.

The challenges are Il domino musicale, Una tira l’altra, I fantastici 4, La sfida (which takes place at the end of each of the first 3 rehearsals), Il triello, I calci di rigore and La ghigliottina.

There is no elimination of players, but whoever is defeated by the challenge loses € 10,000. The questions are taken from the TV show and are divided into 3 levels of difficulty, so you can play at all ages: in fact, at the beginning of the game players can decide whether to play all with the same level, with a random level that changes for each question or everyone with their own level.

The player wins who, among those who have guessed the guillotine word, has the highest inheritance.

-description from designer

name: Strings
description:
Strings is a strategy game for two players that can be played at four levels of complexity. Level 1 is a simple game that is easy to learn, with each subsequent adding a new layer that deepens the complexity. Level 1 takes only a few minutes to play and can be casual or serious, whereas Level 4 takes roughly 40 minutes and offers richer opportunities for strategy. Each level is its own game, and players choose which to play based on preference.

Strings does not require a board and can be played on any flat surface. Each player starts with an identical deck of forty cards in their color. Each card has a color, element, and power. Players place cards from their hand onto any free space next to a preexisting card. The board is generated from the card placement and unique to each game.

In Level 1, players try to align the color of their cards while blocking their opponent. In Level 2, players must align their cards into strings where each element appears exactly once. In Level 3, players may also move their cards on the board. In Level 4, players may use their cards to attack.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: C.O.G.: Shifting Gears
description:
C.O.G.: Shifting Gears is an 9-card pack that transforms the base game C.O.G. into a quicker and more portable version without sacrificing any of the interesting and intriguing aspects of the original game.

C.O.G: Shifting Gears converts COG into a portable game by replacing the game's main board with a few cards. This variant also shortens the game by changing the goal into a race to complete words, as opposed to a competition over victory points. Also, instead of completing the usual 10 or more words per game, the game ends when a player has completed only 4 words. However, using the goal tiles from the original game, you can add variety by changing both the words and the number of words.

-description from designer

name: Alphabetta
description:
Alphabetta is an exciting new concept Pocket Size word game. Players must decide at the start of each game which size word panel they are completing and all players use the same size.

Before starting the game, lay all letter squares face down in their colour groups in the middle of all the players. Each player gets an privacy/information Screen. Players can use the Word Panel samples on the privacy screens or complete a word panel of their choice.

To start each player throws the three dice and highest tally goes first and the other players continue in a clockwise direction. Letters are acquired by throwing the three dice and picking up one face down letter.

The aim of Alphabetta is to be the first player to complete your chosen word panel, either 3, 4 or 5 word square.

Alphabetta is primarily for 2-4 players. Three Letter Word Squares can be played by up to 6 players in a game. The Four Letter Word Squares should be played with a recommended maximum of 3 players and Five Letter Word Squares is an excellent game with 2 people.

—description from the designer

name: ベビーカーでGO! (Go with the Stroller!)
description:
ベビーカーでGO! (Go with the Stroller!) is a simple co-operative card game in which the players are all moms out with their strollers and need to reach the goal.

Each turn, the player draws a card, then plays one. A go! card makes the player advance. A trouble card is played in front of any player and blocks that player from advancing. Troubles can be overcome by a die roll or playing a help card.

Once all moms have advanced ten steps, the players win. Otherwise they lose.

name: Svenska växter
description:
The game consists of a deck of 100 cards. On each card is a different flower which are grouped into 27 different sets. The objective is to complete sets of flowers by asking your fellow gamers for cards in the sets you already have and drawing a card from the draw pile in case they did not have the card you asked for. The game continues until the draw deck runs out and then you count points depending on how many sets you have collected and a few other criteria.

—user summary

name: Kartulikuhi
description:
"Potetoepile" in English.
Players take turns to filling the circles. After Your turn if all
circles in any horizontal, vertical or diagonal row have filled cross out that row and write up the number of crossed circles as
a points. The game ends if all circles are crossed out. The winner is the player with the most points.

—user summary

name: Who is Stronger?
description:
A tower defense game set in near-future East Asia (plus USA):
Aliens are attacking the countries of the players - they appear on the top of the board and are pushed down, when more aliens appear. Aliens that reach the bottom destroy the buildings there.

Players can fight the aliens by buying military units - They destroy the aliens, which then leave a "core" that can be exchanged for money.

Your objective depends partly on your secret objective card - some gain points for helping the aliens destroy certain opponents, others have to concentrate on defense or making money. There is only one winner.

—user summary

name: Psycho Dropsy: Sezon Pierwszy
description:
A party game for those who feel the need to say something completely inappropriate. Incorrect politically, hilarious and eccentric.

To start the game, each player draws eight white cards. One player becomes a Reader. He randomly draws a black card and reads the question or fill-in-the-blanks phrase out loud. Each player chooses an answer from white cards kept in hand and passes it face down to the Reader. The Reader shuffles received cards and successively reads the answers and arranges them on the table. It's best to read the answers together with the question matching the syntax where it's needed. Some questions require two white cards. In this case, the Reader does not shuffle them and reads in the order arranged by players. When all responses have been read, each player points the finger at the funniest answer. The player whose answer got the most votes wins the round and gets the black card as a reward. When it's a draw, each of the drawers wins and gets a black card. Before next round everyone draws cards up to eight, the next player becomes a Reader. The game lasts until no cards, time or participants left. The player who earned the most black cards wins.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: 冬虫夏草 (Caterpillar Fungi)
description:
You know, this neighborhood has become pretty dangerous along with the battle intensifying between the Mushroom Fungi and Insects. So the battle begins...

The players are divided into Mushroom Fungi (hereafter called "Mushroom") and Insects players.

Roles and Victory Conditions

Mushroom Fungi


Victory condition: You win if you find all 6 Insects (Cicada and Swift Moths) and flip them to turn them into Caterpillar Fungi.

Insects


Victory condition: You win if any one of the Insects survives by not getting caught by the Mushroom.

[How to Play]
---Starting the Round---
1. Insects hide under Ground sheets. (The Mushroom player counts numbers while holding the Ground cloth to conceal from their sight the view of the Insects hiding.)
2. The Mushroom player looks for the Insects.
3. Resolve the action (Flip the discovered Insects to turn them into Caterpillar Fungi, etc.).
---Ending the Round---
Steps 1 to 3 count as 1 round. Play 5 rounds.
After 5 rounds, proceed to the Result Announcement.
Ending the Game (Result Announcement and Ending)

—description from the designer
publishers: ひとりじゃ、生きられない。(I Cannot Live By Myself)

name: Traffic Oi!
description:
Vietnam’s crazy traffic is made fun in this chaotic road race challenge where players try to be the first to drive across the country. Meander through busy streets and the countryside, while your opponents try to slow you down with flat tires, red lights and accidents. Start your Drive Pile, build up your kilometers, and look out for Bonus Cards and Safety Cards that can protect you from others. 104 cards with hilarious characters, and illustrated with some of Vietnam’s most famous cities and landmarks. As an extra design bonus, all the cards can be linked side by side to display one huge continuous scene.
English-French-Vietnamese language.
Inspired by Mille Bornes but with some twists.

name: [redacted]: The Transporter Room Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Setup: Place this card next to the main board, as close to the Tunnel Entrance as possible.
Gameplay: This is a new location, adjacent to the Tunnel Entrance (and to the Tunnel Exit, if playing with the Garden Party expansion). Its action is the Transporter: as an action move to any room, anywhere on the board. If that room is not empty, trigger Sneaking Out rules. Using the Transporter triggers the
Computer Room’s ability, allowing the active player to be hacked (similarly, how using the Radio would).
The Transporter Room has no yellow border, therefore there are no interactions here when the lights are out.
For added thematic flair, say “One to beam down” every time you use the Transporter.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Team-Based Game

name: Waleczne Piksele: Kucharka / Maggadae Ghesseler
description: Two additional cards including Maggadae Ghesseler.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Tactics: CCG Player / Deques Applenti
description: Two additional cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Rebustory
description:
Rebustory is a French game in which players must form rebuses (express words or sentences through drawings or signs) with illustrated cards.

Game content:
140 cards including 128 "image" cards, 11 jokers and 1 Rebustory card, 1 card dispenser shoe, an hourglass, a score book and a game rule.

Goal:
Form rebuses and be the first player to reach the 300-point score to be crowned the winner of the game.

Start of the game:
Shuffle the cards and deal 10 cards to each player. The rest of the cards are placed in the shoe, face down.

The 1st player begins:

He draws a card from the shoe.
If he can, he places all the cards forming his rebus in front of him, then counts all these points and marks them on the scorebook.
If he can't form a rebus, he throw a card.


And it is the 2nd player's turn (clockwise), he draws a card from the shoe OR the last card from discard. And so on as the first player.

—user summary

name: [microfilms]: The Honeymooners Promo
description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Setup: Place this card in the middle of the table, within all players’ reach.

Gameplay: During their turn, any player may pay 1 franc to draw a card from the top of the draw deck. This is NOT an action and can only be done once per turn, but cannot be done after discarding down to the hand limit. Place the spent coin on the Honeymooners card. (Thematically, they’re running a con, and handing out cards for money.) When any player takes a Steal action they can choose: steal 2 francs from any other player (as before), OR steal all francs from the Honeymooners. There is nothing more satisfying than conning the con artists after all…
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Malkyrs: Arenas of Eternity
description:
Malkyrs: Arenas of Eternity is a collectible card game, with elements of role-playing and timing allowed by the use of computers/phones and wireless technology.

Each card contains a RFID chip, which is recognized either by a proprietary reader or a smartphone app, and allows it to keep track of:

its current Health, Might, Intelligence and Strength levels;
its learned Skills;
its Evolutions (by using "Favor" points);


which implies that two physically identical cards can be different in-game depending on their playing history.

The game itself focuses on a main Champion card, which embodies the player as it casts Action cards to bring its oppenent's Health total to 0.
Playing these Actions has an element of timing, as a computer app keeps tracks of player turns, which by default last 30 seconds; some effects can alter this total, or some cards have different effects depending on how soon/late they have been cast.

Each victory grants Glory points, which are tracked by the app, and can be reinvested as Favor points to upgrade cards (see above). The app also allows to play online.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Mamonono
description:
Mamonono is a game about demon summoning. You start off with loyalty, and have to use loyalty to bid on magic stones of different colors. Using the magic stones you can summon demons, but each demon has different requirements for the type of stones to summon them. Summoned demons give you victory points, loyalty points you can use to get more stones, and also have other effects like altering the rules for bidding or allowing you to steal demons from other players.

Can you build the most powerful demon army?

—user summary
publishers: TANSANFABRIK, 株式会社ケンビル (KenBill)

name: I Got This!
description:
Get ready to bounce, toss, balance, roll, hop, and laugh!

It's up to you to match your confidence with your competence as you lay it all on the line to prove you can complete the challenges and rack up the most points over nine rounds of play.

The first player rolls the die and then reads aloud the corresponding challenge card. "Flick the button through the ring!"

First, everyone marks a check by the number of points they want to try and win.

Feeling confident? Check nine points. Not so much? Check one point. Feeling like you can conquer the world? Why not play the I Got This card to double your potential points?

Once all the score cards are marked - Start flicking, tossing, balancing, measuring, guestimating, or whatever else the challenge entails.

Successfully complete the challenge? Woohoo! You get to circle the number you marked and keep it as points at the end of the game!

Things didn't go quite as planned? You'll have to cross out that number and cut your losses - OR, if you're convinced all you need is just one more try, you COULD use your Do Over card.

But be careful! You can only use it once!

Keep on playing through the nine rounds of ego-humbling challenges. Once every number on everyone's cards is either circled or crossed out, add up your points and announce your scores.

The player with the most points wins!

Fun, funny, and challenging in ways you've never imagined, I Got This is sure to become an instant family game night favorite.

—description from the publisher

name: Cuckoo Eggs
description:
→ Board in colors suited to the colors of the balls
→ Two sets of balls – each has 16 balls of the same color

Basic Rules
Each move consist of putting one of your ball to the board (put) and pushing one of your active ball so it will move one field (push). At the end you check for the lines, than for the triangles (pull).

Goal of the game is to capture oponent balls.
You can achieve that in three different ways:

Catch the opponent's ball using your 3 balls arranged in the form of a triangle (triangle). If the opponet’s ball is not active it is considered as sucesfully surrounded and it is removed from the board.
Push one of the ball outside the board (point) – pushed out ball will be taken by the player who did that move. If this is opponent ball it is considered as captured and it is removed from the game. In case player pushed out his own ball it will go back to his “hand” and can be added to the board again in future.
Through the line alignment of the at least five balls in their own color (line).
a. A line of five balls – opponent gives away three balls of his choice
b. A line of six balls – opponent gives away six balls of his choice
c. A line of seven balls – this ends game instantly by glorious win

—description from the designer

name: TOKYO✖CROSSING
description: Cross the famous Shibuya intersection first with all of your pieces to win TOKYO✖CROSSING. Each player has three types of pieces — ninja, otaku, and high school girl — and each piece moves differently. Try to block others while getting across the street yourself!

name: Slip Of The Tongue
description:
Similar to Taboo

Don't say the banned words!
A classic party game that will have you lost for words.
Can you describe what's on the cards without saying the words?

Players split into two teams. One player chooses a card and must describe the keyword on the card without using any of the taboo words along the bottom. If their teammates guess the right word within the time limit then the card is theirs.

First team to an agreed number of cards, wins the game.

name: Wooop Wooop
description:
In Wooop Wooop, the game box transforms into a police car driven by a Police figure. Players take turns trying to catch as many burglars as possible by finding pictures of matching thieves. The Policeman who collects the most cards wins the game.

Competitive push your luck game for the youngest kids, 4 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: The Lion King: Simba's Pride – Hop-a-Croc Swamp Game
description:
Join Kiara, Kovu, Timon, and Pumbaa on a challenging trip across moving logs and hungry crocodiles.
Spin a dial to move 1 to 4 logs ahead or to move one of the movable logs. Travel across the logs until you reach the end, except the movable logs may move you forward, backward or prevent you from moving ahead.

name: Kiss
description:
It's a party game for 2-4 girls.
The goal of the game is to collect the most kisses.

Every girl tries to collect the most kisses on her friend photo. But as in real life, there are lots of problems, obstacles and impediments....

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Karla von Kill – Star Player
description:
Karla von Kill takes a day off from the family pig farm to watch some Blood Bowl at a local stadium with some friends. Having never seen the sport up-close before (only having caught the occasional big match on the crystal ball in the local tavern), she is immediately taken with the flashy plays, colourful commentary and over-the-top violence. She sticks around after the match to help clear up and manages to speak to some of the Hochstadt Hellfires, who convince her to abandon the provincial life and join them on the road. She spends the next few weeks driving carts, raising stands, selling tickets and dealing with troublemakers, but it isn’t long before the Hellfires open their doors for new recruits. Karla is one of the first in line, where her passion for the sport impresses head coach Krüber. She takes a spot on the reserves bench and never looks back.

In 2483 Karla helped the Hellfires quit the backwater circuit and start hitting some of the bigger stadiums. She has proven herself a natural Blitzer, always leading the team from the front. When they came up against the Bloodskull Brutes, she coordinated the front offence to bring down both of the team’s Trolls in short order, and was awarded the position of team captain in recognition of her efforts.

Karla von Kill is a Star Player who can be included in the following teams: Amazon, Halfling, Human, Norse. This highly detailed miniature makes a fantastic addition to any team that can afford to hire her.

This is a complete, multipart resin kit which contains one Karla von Kill. She comes with a 32mm Blood Bowl base and her rules can be found in the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports

name: iGure Table Soccer
description: A flicking table soccer game.

name: Squeezamals Freeze 'N' Squeeze Game
description:
Squeezamals Freeze 'N' Squeeze Game is a twist on the classic game of hot potato. Players take turns making a yummy treat for their Squeezamal to enjoy, and the player caught holding the plush when it's time to eat must pay for the treat! Each game features an exclusive Squeezamal! Colors and styles may vary.

—description from the publisher

name: Party & Co Cardgame
description:
Travel version of Party & Co.
You don't need a playing board!

Party & Co card game is a game for 4 or more players.
A team consist of a minimum of 2 players.

One of the teams rolls the dice and takes a card. On every card there are 4 challenges, every category 1 challenge.
There are 4 categories: Art&Co, Show&Co, Quiz&Co and Crazy&Co.

You have 30 seconds for completing a challenge.
Before you start the challenge you can place a bet per team.
For example the challenge is: How many cartoon figures can you draw? Then each team can place a bet (bonus card) on that challenge. The team that wins collects the bonus cards.

The goal of the game is to collect 10 bonus cards.

—user summary

name: Jurassic World Volcano Escape Game
description:
It’s a race against time to see whose dinosaurs can make their way around the gameboard and into their boats to safety. Watch out for rolling lava balls and an irascible T-Rex that’s ready to block your moves.
(back of box copy)

A game for young children based off of the volcano scene in Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. It plays similarly to Parcheesi. The goal is to get all four of your dinosaur pawns off the island and onto your boat before the other players.

There is a custom die that features the numbers 1-5, and a picture of a t-rex. On your turn, you roll the die, and if you get a number, you either move the number of spaces indicated or choose to use the turn to instead put the rolled number of lava balls into play in the volcano. The volcano piece will randomly shoot the balls out to different parts of the board, and pieces hit by the lava balls must go back to start.

If you roll the t-rex, you may move the non-player t-rex pawn to part of the board. Players can't pass by the t-rex and get two turns to try to move the t-rex. If you don't roll and move the t-rex in these two turns, that pawn must go back to start.

-user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Rendita
description:
The players roll two dice and combine the results of the roll into a two digit number (red = tens , black = ones). So red 1 and black 6 combines into 16. This would allow the player to buy commodity 16 if no one else has already done this. If another player already owns the commodity the player has to pay a fee. There are 3 different commodities: shops (black letters), restaurants (red letters) and a cinema (Filmpalast).

A player owning a shop may make further investments to increase the fees he gets from the other players if it's number is rolled again. The fees for restaurants are increased if a player owns 2 or 3 restaurants in adjacent buildings. Fees for the cinema are only payed if a player owns both halves (space 63 and 64). If a player owns only one half, another player may still buy the other half or even the half already in possession. When a player owns the whole cinema it is opened and the fees increase automatically every time it's number is rolled, without the player having to invest any money.

If a double is rolled, an event occurs that causes the player to lose or gain money.

The game ends after a fixed playing time or if all players but one go bankrupt. The last remaining player or the player with the most money and the most valuable commodities wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: LULU' L'ANGELO TRA I FIORI GIOCO
description:
Game based on the anime TV series Lulu the angel among the flowers (original name Hana no Ko Runrun 1979).

The aim of the game is to wander from one country to another collecting seeds and then collect the flowers from them. The game will end when the first player who collects all the flowers in his garden, including those that border the other (the other players), and will have discovered the Magic flower (with the colors of the Rainbow).

On his turn, the three cubes are rolled and his marker is moved by how many colors correspond to the base of their triangular markers, received at the beginning of the game. When you happen on a city, you take the corresponding counter from the deck (seeds).

During the course of the game, you will collect several seeds that are placed on their right outside the game plan. Sowing can be attempted when stopping or passing over the Celi box. We turn the record of how many seeds we own at that time. If the character in the slot of the disk is green then you can sow in your garden (friend of Lulù), if it is red (Enemy), you will have to resitituire all seeds collected so far.

When the player has finished sowing on his own garden or passes on the Paris box, he can collect his own flowers.

Game content: a game plan, 4 LuLuù counters of four colors,50 double-sided scented cards,1 cardboard rotating disc,3 cubes with colored faces (dice),9 triangular markers (3 per player).

The cards depicting the flowers on one side and the seeds on the other ... rubbing the part of the seed gives off the scent of the corresponding flower.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Fracture of Biel-Tan Campaign Box
description:
Set in the dark sci-fantasy world of Warhammer 40,000, Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters allows players to build teams of iconic characters and warriors to battle it out for supremacy using custom dice and cards. Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters uses the game system designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang for Dice Masters and is completely compatible with other games in the line. Four factions are available when the series first launches, and players can either build teams using a single faction or mix and match to create their own Dice Masters team.

The Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Fracture of Biel-Tan Campaign Box features iconic characters from the Daemons of Chaos and Ynnari like Skarbrand, The Masque of Slaanesh, The Yncarne, and Yvraine! With multiple versions of each, select the one that fits your team the best!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ratingen 10
description:
"Ratingen 10" is a tactical sorting game. Every player gets ten random cards and places them in a random order face up in front of him. The goal of the game is to form a row from 1-10 or from 10-1.
