To achieve this goal, you change the place of two cards in your row or you change one of your cards with one of the other players. In the end, only who pays attention very well, can win the game.

The game is published on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the "Ratinger Spieletage".

-description from designer

name: 5150: Back Alleys, Bright Lights
description:
What: A stand alone 5150 RPG that can be played with our other 5150 titles.
Scale: 1 figure equals 1 man.
Your Role: Players try to gain Fame and Fortune while adventuring in New Hope City's dangerous Little Hisha.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

Back Alleys Bright Lights takes you deep into New Hope City - specifically the area known as Little Hisha. It's our first 5150 stand alone supplement that goes into greater detail, allowing you to play unique, one of a kind adventures, while you create your Story.

Inside you’ll find:

Five two-sided color tiles with 40 buildings with over 100 areas to explore.
An easy to use combat system that enhances, not inhibits, your games.
An easy to use Character Interaction system that brings each Non-Player Character to life as you wheel and deal with them.
Interact with or play as one of 13 different Races and 17 different Professions.
Rules for Psy - you call it Psionics, we call it Psy.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.
A counter sheet of 40 different characters representing 10 different Aliens.
All this and much more...

Back Alleys Bright Lights can be played with 5150 Urban Renewal, New Hope City PI, Fringe Space and even Future Tales.

Check out NHC PI, a supplement for use with 5150 Back Alleys Bright Lights. "NHC PI, when the Police just won't do!"

-description from publisher's website
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Danmarks historie
description:
A small 60 card quiz game about the history of Denmark.
Also has a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Outlast: A Reading for Information Game Comprehension
description:
Can you survive the perils on Shipwreck Island long enough to escape? Only if you can find the right information on the question cards! In this skill-building game, players read short passages and answer questions that challenge them to recall facts and details, analyze text and more. Each correct answer could earn them a survival medallion and get them closer to the finish line…if flash floods and forest fires don’t get in their way!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Wildfire Rescue!
description:
You are a group of park rangers. A wildfire broke out and there are several groups of people camping. Your job is to rescue as many campers as possible before the whole forest is set ablaze.

Each player takes a turn and moves through the forest, which is randomly created at the start of the game, going through each obstacle: trees, boulders, and wild animal tiles - each requiring their own special tool to enter. Players need to work together; when you meet another player on a tile all players on that tile can move those players and use their tools as their own - greatly increasing your chances of saving as many campers as possible.

Be careful though - once every player has taken a turn, the event die is rolled and must be immediately dealt with. If a "Wildfire!" is rolled, the wildfire spreads without warning throughout the forest. Any campers or players caught in the blaze perish, and are removed from the game. You can also roll "Nothing!" where nothing happens, or "Fire Rescue!" to extinguish part of the fire.

You're not without help on the ground though, players may receive the "Fire Extinguisher" which helps them extinguish the fire as they move into tiles set ablaze.

Will you rescue as many as you can? Will you come out victorious? Find out today!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Wortmix
description: This is a quick game to collect letters to create a given word.

name: The Little Game of Beer
description:
This beer-themed trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players.
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about beer and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The first player to reach the finish space on the board wins the game.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture memo" and "Anagrams". "Picture memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Anagrams" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.

—user summary
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic is a roll-and-write game, like Yahtzee. You supply the dice and the pencils, and print off one copy of the first page for each player. The second page has the rules.

Object
To score the most Victory Points (VPs) by reconstructing only the genuine portions of ancient mosaic, while avoiding the fake regions.

Setup - Each Player Does This Separately:

Roll a die and mark off the entire row of tiles corresponding to that number
Roll the die again and, counting from left to right, mark off the corresponding column of tiles. Then, mark off the arrows pointing to that tile, and continue marking off arrows so that every column is pointed to by only one arrow.
Place all the dice in the dice bag and pick a starting player, who draws three dice (two in solo play). You are now ready to begin play.


How To Play
The active player takes the die passed to her, draws two dice and rolls them. On the first turn of the game, roll all three dice drawn in setup). She selects one die. Using the color to determine column and the number to determine row, she marks off the corresponding tile, and draws that tile on her mosaic. The other players do the same, selecting only from the two dice she did not select. Multiple players may select the same die from the remaining two. When you select a die pointing to a tile that is already marked out mark out a different tile in that column, and mark off and place a 1-stone tile from your reserve. After all players are done, the active player passes her die to the next player, and discards the other two dice. If the dice bag is empty. place all discarded dice back in the bag. Pass the bag to the next player, going clockwise, and continue playing. In Solo play, draw two dice per turn, do not keep any dice from turn to turn, and refill the bag when there is only one die left in the bag.

—description from the designer

name: Metro
description:
Welcome to 1997 in the beautiful city of Montreal Canada. You will compete with up to 5 other players in a race around town and try to be the first to complete all your itineraries.

Each player will receive destinations that they will need to get to before the other players get to theirs. Once you completed your trip around the city you need to race back to the starting point to win the game.

—user summary

name: Drekki
description:
A push-your-luck game where you try to survive the dragon’s breath by bluffing and bidding against your opponents.

Over a determined series of rounds, players get attacked by the dragon: upon a given round, a dragon attack tile is positioned in front of the active player. Each tile shows the amount of possible dammage, as well as who will suffer the dammage in function of an auction result.

During the auction, each player secretely selects one among their hand of value tokens (6 ascending values in 3 color ranges). Then, in a sequence depending on the dragon tile, players will bid a number which has to be lower than the total of all value tokens. When all have passed, tokens get revealed, and the result is applied: either the highest bidder is lower or equal to the total and receives victory points, then the tile effect is applied in function of the total; or the highest bidder is higher than the total value of tokens, and the bidder suffers the attack.

When all dragon attack tiles have been played, the game ends and score is computed to determine the winner.

name: Defenders of Zarahemla
description:
Defenders of Zarahemla is an exciting co-op card game of strategy and chance! It features different levels of difficulty, where players work together as iconic heroes in the Book of Mormon to fight against infamous bad guys. The object of the game is to protect Zarahemla from the advancing Lamanite armies while also avoiding natural afflictions. Defenders of Zarahemla is an engaging game that will enthrall players and families alike!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Alien Encounters with Dogs Card Game
description:
Hilarious party & family card game of comical encounters between Space Aliens and dogs. Players help dogs fend off an Alien Attack.

Each player is dealt 5 cards. On your turn you do the following:

1. Play a card from your hand that can follow the top card on the discard pile.

2. Draw up to 3 cards from the top of the draw pile, stopping at any point to play a card if you are able.

3. Pass your turn after drawing the 3 card maximum per turn from the draw pile.

When you play your card you read the reason located next to the matching symbol on their card, for example "Waffles Pees on Paper", or you can creatively create your own reason.

The goal of each round is to get rid of all your cards. Cards left in your hand count against you. After a pre-determined number of rounds, the winner is the player with the lowest point total.

Contents: 108 cards & instructions.

name: Crypto Cash
description:
There are four volatile altcoins to bet on in the game: Ledginvest, Dodg-E-Coin, CryoCoin and Block Burster. Each altcoin has a corresponding stack of Market Cards that predict gains or losses. You need four players to be Investors to start the action. Each Investor gets two wallets and 10 physical Bitcoins. One Investor is also the Exchange Manager for the round. The Exchange Manager passes out one Insider Trading Card to each Investor and spins to see which altcoins will be open for trading that round. The Exchange Manager also secretly sets a timer for any time between 3 and 15 seconds so that only he or she knows how much time is on the clock for placing bets. Each Investor reveals their Insider Trading Card to the group to see what action they can take before the Market opens. You might even get an insider tip that gives you a competitive advantage in placing your bets. The Market is open! Investors simultaneously bet their Bitcoins on the altcoins by placing their wallets on the board. Trading immediately stops when the timer rings. The Exchange Manager then flips over the Market Card for each altcoin to reveal a gain or loss for each Investor. It’s Bitcoin boom or bust--one minute your wallet’s full and it’s Lambo time, the next second you lose everything in a scam! Keep playing until the Bitcoin Bank runs dry. The Investor with the most Bitcoin wins!

Contents: Includes: 160 Bitcoin, 12 Plastic Bitcoin Wallets, 1 Altcoin Speculation Mat, 1 Spinner, 40 Market Cards, 1 Exchange Manager Card, 4 Insider Trading Cards, 4 Character Cards, Instructions.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Trading

name: Jenus: Il gioco – Espansione: Angeli & Demoni
description:
After the successful success of Jenus - Il gioco, finally arrives its worthy expansion: Angels & Demons!

Fight in your normal version or choose the upgraded one to summon angels; exploits the forces of evil without restraint, recalling the 4 major demons through Ratzinger; perform new miracles and smash the deities with new fantastic indulgences!

Angels & Demons improves the gameplay of the basic version of Jenus - The game, taking advantage of the advice of the most loyal players and allowing you to use new ways to eradicate the opponent, turn up the nose to moralists and piss off the aunts bigoted.

With Angels & Demons the world is facing the ultimate challenge: the eternal struggle between good and evil.
And where are you going to be?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dopo il fortunato sul cesso di “Jenus – Il gioco”, arriva finalmente la sua degna espansione: “Angeli & Demoni”!
Combatti nella tua versione normale o scegli quella potenziata per evocare gli angeli; sfrutta senza ritegno alcuno le forze del male, richiamando i 4 demoni maggiori tramite Ratzinger; compi nuovi miracoli e sfotti le divinità con nuove fantastiche indulgenze!
“Angeli & Demoni” migliora il gameplay della versione base di “Jenus – Il gioco”, facendo tesoro dei consigli dei giocatori più affezionati e consentendo di utilizzare nuove strade per debellare l’avversario, far storcere il naso ai moralisti e fare incazzare le zie bigotte.
Con “Angeli & Demoni” il mondo si trova ad affrontare la sfida definitiva: l’eterna lotta tra il bene e il male.
E tu da che parte starai?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Freak & Chic LLC, Magic Press Edizioni Srl (MPE)

name: Pocket Curling
description:
Flick, block and ricochet your way to victory. Strategically shape the ice to your benefit, then thread your way through your opponent's stones to get to the house. Be the first team to reach 11 points by ending rounds with stones closer to the target than the other team.

—description from the publisher

A travel-sized, dexterity, curling game for two players/teams.

name: Jungle Chase
description:
A terrible drought has struck a bountiful jungle and all the animals are left with no food to eat. Jungle wardens' airplanes are parachuting food packages to the animals, but each animal prefers its own kind of food! To complicate the matters further, all packages look the same and animals first need to open them to see what's inside. All the animals rush wildly for the clearings where food packages appear...

The object of Jungle Chase is to collect as many food packages as possible before they run out. Players do so by controlling six animals each of varying strength on a hexagonal board representing a jungle with clearings and landing spots for food packages. On their turn, players roll two six-sided dice to determine which animals may move one space each, with doubles enabling special moves. When animals of opposing players meet the stronger animal chases its opponent off the board.

Contents of food packages are hidden from players and a player whose animal enters the package space may look at it without revealing the contents to other players. If the food is appropriate for the animal, the player may now collect it. When all packages, whose number is determined at the beginning of the game, have been collected the player with the most food is the winner.

Jungle Chase is a "classical" board game with game pieces, dice and a board with a very deliberate old-school feel and yet quite modern in it's final execution in terms of tempo, duration etc. Basic mechanics and inherent logic are quite simple and yet the game strives to offer enough depth for an adult to enjoy the game as well.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Print & Play

name: Big Bang Theory Playing Cards
description:
Enjoy the most memorable moments of The Big Bang Theory series with this card game. Includes one customized deck with the most famous quotes and pictures of the show and one Quiz deck with questions and answers.

In the Quiz game, one player reads the questions and the others try to answer them. The player who answers correctly takes the card. Whoever has more cards at the end of 20 questions is the winner.

—user summary

name: Der Phrasenfuchs
description:
At Phrasenfuchs it is important to recognize the phrase you are looking for as soon as possible. Not so easy, because you were alienated from six different species. So it may happen that the keywords are replaced by the "fox", a phrase is to be drawn or only the topic and a keyword from the phrase is known. It also appears that all players at the same time rate it. In turn, a player always reads a phrase card. The color of the phrase card specifies the task. For example, crucial words in the read phrase are reversed or only snippets are read. The goal of the teammates is always the same: guess the phrases as fast as possible. Whoever manages to be the first to score points and pulls his character forward. And when the first goal is achieved, you win.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Mature / Adult, Memory, Party Game, Trivia

name: La conquista di Gorm
description:
Each player has two Lords and four helpers/servants from a population of Gorm (Light, Air, Sea, etc) with which to defeat the other players/populations to become the conquorers of Gorm.

Territory cards are dealt and Gormiti are distributed into their starting positions. Do you put them all in one space, or distribute them throughout the territories you were dealt.

Each player is given some random Help cards and money both of which provide more or less limited benefits throughout the game.

It plays easily and it can be difficult decision whether to buy a new help card whilst paying your opponents its cost!

—user summary

name: Metal quizz Hellfest
description:
The whole universe of metal in 500 questions and 6 themes
to revise your classics of extreme music and discover the backstage of the festival

A board game and 8 tokens to become the ultimate metalhead!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Metal quizz Hellfest is a trivia game created by Lelo Jimmy Batista, Ronan Thenadey and Julien Cassiet.

In this roll and move game, reminiscent of the Game of Goose, players have to reach the end spot by rolling a dice every turn, and answering complex trivia questions regarding metal music culture, in 5 differents categories (Albums/songs/bands crew, Hellfest, Gossips, ...). If you answer it right, you can reroll. After reaching the end, you need to answer 4 out of 5 questions of the same card to win.

—user summary

name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Gratuitous Nudity Promo Card
description:
Promo card - Gratuitous Nudity

Card type: Scene
Card text: Move slasher to victim. Take one hit.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror

name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Cursed Promo Card
description:
Promo card - Cursed

Card type: Plot twist
Card text: Redirect all cards to one target.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror

name: Slasher: The Final Cut – Coincidence Promo Card
description:
Promo card - Coincidence

Card type: Plot twist
Card text: Move victim out of room. Move slasher in.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror

name: Texas Poker
description:
The game's contents consist of 104 cards -- each of which shows the rank and suit of five traditional cards -- and 4 jokers. The five cards thus comprise a poker hand, and every type of poker hand is included: royal flush, straight flush, four of a kind, full house, flush, straight, three of a kind, two pairs, one pair, high single card.

—user summary

RULES FOR TEXAS POKER

To play this game, remember each card has a five-card Poker hand, for a total of 104 different Poker hands in two decks of cards. It is like playing with 520 regular playing cards.

For fast Texas Poker, play with one card to each player where the best five-card poker hand wins. You may exchange that one card for another if you wish to. High hand wins.

Now, try playing with two Texas Poker Cards to each player, making the best five-card Poker hand from the now ten different numbers and suits each player has. You may also exchange or draw one more card, turning in to the dealer your discard. Try playing 6-7-8-9 or even 10 Poker with just two cards.

You may play this together with an ordinary deck of cards. To play the game this way, deal out one card from the Texas Poker Deck to each player. Each player may then receive up to three cards from the regular deck of cards. Have Fun!!! Plus, make your own rules.

NO SHOOTING, PLEASE ...

—description from the back of the box

name: Rymdisar
description:
Rymdisar comes with a blank playing board showing a picture of space, and 14 cardboard disks to be placed out onto the board, making the playing path.

13 disks show "spacies" and they show actions such as "+2", "change 1", or "miss a turn".

One disk has a rocket, and says "Fly!"

Each player has a marker and starts with 4 gems of different colours.

Players roll a die, and move along the playing path the number of dots shown. They then need to do the action of the space they land upon. In this way, they can gain or exchange gems, until someone has 5 of the same colour.
—user summary

Take a space walk through the stars and meet friendly Spacies! Through luck and tactics, see if you can gather magical space gems. The first to collect five stones in the same colour wins.
—description from the back of the box (translated)

Ta en rymdpromenad bland stjärnorna och träffa de snälla rymdisarna! Det gäller att, genom tur och taktik, samla magiska rymdstenar. Den som först har fem rymdstenar i samma färg har vunnit.
—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Urbanización
description:
Realistic construction game.

The players will advance on the board by a roll of 2 dice. They will have to buy plots, ask for licenses to build, buy warehouses and materials, build private plots, build town hall buildings through auctions, they will have the possibility of asking for credit, they will be able to sell the plots already built or lose them for bankruptcy.
The price of materials will change, so we will have to take advantage of the exact moment.
The game will end when all the villas are built or the public buildings are built or a player is bankrupt and will win the most money.
mechanics: Action Queue, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fressen Igel Schokoriegel?
description:
Do hedgehogs eat chocolate bars? Well no!!! Every kid knows that - but it's not always easy to find out an animal’s favorite foods: do squirrels eat eggs? Do ducks eat herbs? Do wild boar eat berries? Each player gets a board with an animal. When it's his turn, he takes a food tile and tries to fit the tile into his board. The jigsaw puzzle shows whether or not the food Type is a favorite food of the animal. The first person to fill his board with four pieces of food wins. With game variant for older children from 4/5 years.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Fressen Igel Schokoriegel? Aber NEIN!!! Das weiß doch jedes Kind - doch nicht immer ist es so einfach, die Lieblingsspeisen der Tiere herauszufinden: Fressen Eichhörnchen Eier? Fressen Enten Kräuter? Fressen Wildschweine Beeren? Jeder Spieler bekommt eine Tafel mit einem Tier. Wenn er an der Reihe ist, nimmt er sich ein Futterplättchen und versucht, das Plättchen in seine Tafel zu puzzeln. Die Puzzleausstanzung zeigt, ob das Futter zur Lieblingsspeise des Tieres gehört oder nicht. Wer als Erster seine Tafel mit vier Futterstückchen gefüllt hat, gewinnt. Mit Spielvariante für ältere Kinder ab 4/5 Jahren.
—description from the publisher

name: Nutty Nuts
description:
"Do you hop or do you stop?!"

Hop from tree to tree to collect as many nuts as you can. But, watch out! You have to make the right decision or you might lose your stash. Be the first to collect the right number of nuts and you win!
Nutty Nuts is a great decision making game!
—description from the publisher

To play the game, the eight wooden trees are placed in a circle and each player places their player piece, a wooden squirrel (complete with felt tail) on an empty tree. A bank of three nuts is created outside of the circle. One die is rolled to select the first player. Then, on their turn, a player rolls the die and the number shown is the number of hops that the squirrel (the player) makes from tree to tree. If the player lands on a tree with nuts printed on it then they take the nuts and "stash" them by collecting a wooden token matching the same amount of nuts on three from the bank.
If the player decides to hop, they roll the die and move the squirrel again. If they land on an empty tree they must return all nut tokens from their stash back bank to the bank.
On the other hand, if the player chooses to stop and not hop then they collect all Nutty Nuts (the wooden nut tokens) from their stash and the nuts are theirs until the end of the game; play then continues to the next player.
The first player to collect the correct number of nuts, determined by the player count, wins the game!
—user summary

name: Redcoats in the Wilderness
description:
We’ve spent the past ten years working on a new revised and updated ruleset based on our original “Wilderness Wars” tabletop miniatures rules system. This new edition is equally playable in 15mm or 25mm scales, with both US Standard and Metric measurement player aids included.

Usable with most 18th Century French and Indian Wars Wilderness scenarios

Fast. Fun. Furious.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: LABYRINTHIA
description: Finally, there is the popular game of skill from the "Super Toy Club" for home! With a lot of team spirit and good communication, the players have to roll the ball from start to finish. Each player is responsible for one corner of the three-dimensional game board and only together can the goal be achieved. For this skill and concentration is required, because otherwise, the ball falls into one of the numerous holes. If that happens the team has to start again. But watch out, time is running fast and the other team is just waiting for their chance. In Labyrinthia, two teams play against each other. The team that works smarter and works better together will win in the end. Stops the time and challenges the opposing team: which team is faster?

name: Pocket Quiz: Serienjunkies
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "series junkies" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

name: Michael Schumacher Formel 1
description:
Each player receives a Finish card at the beginning of the game and tries to reach the race cars via tactical use of the dice. The race covers three laps.
The player's Finish card shows in what order that player needs the cars to finish. For each correctly entered car, the player receives the specified score. The player with the highest score has won the game. If it's your turn, roll all four dice and distribute the numbers randomly to the participating cars, trying to achieve the result shown on your Finish card.

—user summary

name: Princeton 1777
description:
A tactical game on the Battle of Princeton, 3 January 1777. It is essentially a quasi-designer's kit. The rules are 'complete'; however, if you want to play the game you will have to make your own map and counters from the facsimiles provided. Units are either infantry, cavalry, artillery, or headquarters. Units range in size from company to battalion/regiment; artillery units are batteries. Rules were typed and mimeographed.

—user summary
publishers: The Avalon Hill Intercontinental Kriegspiel Society

name: Morphy
description:
Do you have the insight to morph the most and win?

Your goal is to find the longest string of changes. Start with the ball on one peg over one disc. Then, find another disc that's different by only one attribute - Color, pattern, or center circle size.

Start with a GREEN disc with STRIPES and a LARGE center circle. Move to an ORANGE disc with STRIPES and a LARGE center circle - or a GREEN disc with DOTS and a LARGE center circle - or a GREEN disc with STRIPES and a SMALL center circle...

Now - Can you find another? And another? And another?? - Whoever connects and collects the most discs wins the game!

Put your pattern recognition skills to the ultimate test with the unique and challenging game of Morphy.

—description from the publisher

name: Early Americas
description: A card and bard game for 2-5 players (playing as France, England, Portugal, Spain, or the Dutch) covering the colonization of the New World. Players will explore, settle and battle in the New World, which is divided into 17 regions. Players gain victory points for each (a) territory they control and (b) city they have on the map.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: The Independence of India
description: A card for 2-4 players covering the Independence of India from the British Empire. The players share a common deck of 5 suites (Leaders, Tactics, Campaigns, Resistance and Diplomacy) representing key events and figures from the independence movement.

name: Unequalopolis
description:
Unequalopolis is a marketplace game where users can buy, sell and trade properties while playing with rules that vary according to the "gender" of the player. The goal of the game is to become the richest player.

Players are assigned genders through an initial roll of the dice, and restrictions (based on real-life gendered legal and social barriers) restrict player's ability to buy, sell or trade property, move freely around the board, own certain types of property, access credit, have tax exemptions, etc.
categories: Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Boxwalk
description:
Expand your color, and Hide your color!
You can play in 5 minutes, "Position Expansion & Hide Color",
2 to 4 person match game♪

At first, dealt COLOR-CARD is your color.
Place dealt BOX-CARDS and spread your color. At the end, all players vote on other player's color by VOTE-CARDS.
Then his points will be reduced. Finally the player having the biggest points will win.

—description from the designer

name: Dangerous Dip
description:
Dangerous Dip has a strategic basis like backgammon. Strategically this game involves either getting through the field quickly or collecting as much prey as possible.

—description from the publisher
